Reviews.Title: “Perfect French Quarter hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: When you come to New Orleans, you want a great location and a comfortable room - but you don't want super high prices since you don't come to this city to spend a lot of time in your hotel room ! The Dauphine offers everything you want or need at the right price - clean, good-sized rooms, comfortable beds, super location a block from Bourbon St. ( just far enough away to insure you don't have to fight crowds just to get in and out of the hotel) garage, excellent breakfast buffet, relaxing pool courtyard, cute antique bar, and super friendly staff. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff who care”
Reviews.Author: Cindy N
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a room in this hotel at the last minute after having to vacate a different hotel that was terrible. The difference was night and day. During the four nights we stayed here, the staff were so friendly, helpful, and cool. They really seemed to care about their guests, and not in a phony way. The rooms are very clean, many have balconies, and the pool area is a nice place to lounge or eat breakfast. The free breakfast was really good too--with fresh fruit and orange juice every morning and a Belgian waffle maker! They even gave us vouchers for free drinks at the bar when we checked in. The beds were super comfy with real comforters, not those cheesy hotel bedspreads. Even the products in the shower were nice. The location was incredible, right in the heart of the French Quarter. I really wish we had booked this hotel in the first place! It was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great find and would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: empty002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dauphine during French Quarter Fest. We had a lot of fun and the location of this hotel is great. You can walk to everything in the Quarter. Being one block from Bourbon street was nice because it was quiet, but still close to the main areas of activity. Our room was very nice and well air conditioned. The bathrooms are a nice marble. The only thing I would change would be to have a refridgerator in the room, but we could have asked for one. The pool area is small, but clean and cute. Iced tea and cookies are put out every afternoon. All of the staff were friendly. We borrowed umbellas from the front desk and they made a couple dinner reservations for us, which was great. They were very helpful. We ate at the hotel one morning for our breakfast and it was quite good. They have the waffle marker, sausage, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit, cereal, breads, etc. Finally, the free drink tickets to Mae Baily's was a nice touch. It is an old and unique bar that is part of the hotel. This provides a close by place to grab a drink before or after dinner. If you are coming to New Orleans, I would consider staying here. Many of the guests we met frequently stay at the Dauphoine.

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine Orleans”
Reviews.Author: MaryHeedy
Reviews.Content: Dauphine is in a perfect location. It's one block north of Bourbon Street and a sanctuary away from the crowds. They have some of the most comfortable beds that we've stayed in in the Quarter. The continental breakfast has a good selection, but shorter hours than other hotels we've stayed at in New Orleans. We really enjoy our favorite bartender, Lisa. We visit her when we are in town. Their bar is an old brothel and is a relaxing setting. They also have a nice poolside garden setting. The hotel is clean and comfortable. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: pleased2012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the Dauphine Orleans for our third stay the week of April 8th, 2012. We find this hotel, in the French Quarter, to be a lovely hidden oasis! The service and friendliness of the staff is unequal in our travels. It is the perfect location to enjoy the French Quarter. The grounds are well-kept. The continental breakfast is lovely. It is an overall charming hotel that offers one a memorable experience. We highly recommend you try the Dauphine Orleans! Warmly, Mary G.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy-close”
Reviews.Author: Chandler M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I finally got the opportunity to spend a few days relaxing and enjoying New Orleans. We could not have stayed at a better hotel. The entire stay was wonderful from the complementary cocktail,comfortable bed,clean room,enviting pool,friendly staff and continental breakfast. The location made it easy to walk to Bourbon St and all of the Quarter,yet was quiet at night.The balcony from our room was a nice touch. Would highly recommend staying here and hope to make it back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine Hotel is extremely comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Donna B
Reviews.Content: 20 of my family and friends stayed here during the French Quarter Fest to help celebrate my birthday. The rooms are comfortable; the beds are exceptionally comfortable and the staff is delightfully helpful, pleasant and efficient. Everyone we encountered during our stay seemed happy to make our visit wonderful. I would highly recommend the Dauphine Orleans to anyone who wants the French Quarter Experience. This hotel is convenient to everything but not in the midst of all the noise. Nice pool area and nice courtyards. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay In The French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: GaryTucson
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine is located only one block north of Bourbon Street, but resides in a different world. It was quiet, well appointed and every staff member was helpful and friendly. The bar is a great place to relax and recover from playing tourist, and the drinks are most excellent. A quiet ambiance and superb location have put the Dauphine Orleans on my "stay again" list.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Margie H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel on April 13th. We were a small group of ladies (6) that thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The location is perfect....within walking distance to the many restaurants, bars, attractions in the French Quarter. Directly across the street from Bayonna restaruant (which was wonderful for lunch)! Deja Vu Bar and Grill is also right on the corner (wow -- the Bloody Mary's there are a great way to start the morning)!! Tell the bartender Joe - from Camillus, NY "HI!" Dauphine is also a reasonable cab fare to other parts of the city (Frenchman St. for the music scene) approx. $8-$10 fare. As well as the Midtown section for the Maple Leaf bar for music (right next door to Jacquemo's) which was approx. $10 - $12. The hotel staff were wonderful (polite and helpful at all times). As well as Aiesha at the front desk being right on for her recommendations of bars and restaurants for our group of ladies. The "continental breakfast" at the hotel was truly a full breakfast and a great way to start the day (as well as champagne by the poolside courtyard).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cms1012
Reviews.Content: We really liked everything about this quaint hotel. A friend had recommended this place to us so we did not hesitate to book it for our trip last Fall. It has a perfect location since it is just a block off Bourbon Street - so you have the proximity to all of the fun, but you can actually get a great night's sleep. The hotel is clean, the beds are comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I liked the little balcony that we had - it was nice to open up the room for some fresh air. They have a small but tasty complimentary continental breakfast. There is nothing about this hotel that didn't work out great - especially considering the price, we thought it was a great value for the French Quarter. We would recommend to friends as it was recommended to us and we would definitely stay there again! Note: There is a 24 hour restaurant across the street, Deja Vu, that is the perfect stop on your way out if you oversleep the breakfast time at Dauphine or even on your way home in the wee hours, at little dive-y but at 3am who is really worried about that?! The bartenders were fantastic and very personable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frappeboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in March. Good: - Was very close to all the attractions, but off Bourbon enough that it's pretty quiet. - The beds were very comfortable. - Very friendly staff. - Had a pool - it was tiny, but not very crowded. - Had a bar (that used to be a brothel) connected to it. Good place to stop for a drink before going out or on the way back. - We didn't use it, but they had valet parking. Less Good: -The bathroom was pretty small, and no joke, couldn't figure out how to use the shower. I guess it's a common setup there, but you have to pull the ring under the water spout. -The keycards are really sensitive. Don't keep it anywhere near your wallet or it will reset itself. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: MJFGM
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about this hotel. Great location, great staff, nice rooms, parking which is rare in the French Quarter, nice little complimentary breakfast, etc. Really can't say anything negative about the place. Also there is a 24 hour restaurant across the street which was nice. We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised and Reviewed”
Reviews.Author: Seguimarnold
Reviews.Content: Great location and hotel lived up to its expectation. We will definately stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fortydaysrain
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Dauphine Orleans. The staff was courteous, helpful, and checked in to see how our stay was going. The rooms were very clean along with all of the hotel facilities. The breakfast was great for a continental option. The pool was small but just what you needed after a day of walking around in the hot sun. The tempurpedic bed was SO welcoming and provided for a great nights sleep. The location of this hotel was wonderful, just behind Bourbon street and about a half mile from all the great spots in the Quarter. We found the hotel to be quiet for the MOST part, apart from an occasional garbage truck on 2 mornings of our stay. We were very happy and would certainly stay at the hotel again when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: TheQueue61
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the final four weekend. The place was sold out, but did not appear stressed. The rooms were functional and clean. Housekeeping did a great job and was extremely efficient. The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming in all functions, front desk, parking, housekeeping, bar, breakfast. The breakfast was quite nice for standard "make your own waffle fare". The pool was clean. Location is one block from Bourbon and three from Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hermann annex across the street from the office and had a beautiful room upstairs with exposed brick and beams. The mattress was a memory foam that was so comfortable it prompted us to come home and buy one. The breakfat offers everything you couldimagine and far surpasses the routine breakfast that is included with most hotel and motel stays. From here, you can walk almost anywhere in the Quarter or downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: ronny1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean. Staff was super friendly. Great breakfast. Pretty courtyard. Didn't use the pool as it was a bit too cold. A little bit loud a couple nights. Could hear Bourbon Street probably but that's understandable. May Bailey's was a neat little bar. Great location. Nothing at all to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Business in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: bound4carolina
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a business trip. The hotel is very close to everything. The staff is really great. The room was clean. It is an older property so you expect not everything to be perfect. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Just off Bourbon St”
Reviews.Author: Pingdave14
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to avoid the noise, but one block away from all the action, restaurants, etc. Well kept and clean. We stayed in one of the back courtyard suites that was very large and had two rooms seperated by a large see thru fireplace. Very comfortable king size bed. Only real complaint (although that sounds too harsh) was the bathroom in our room only had a big tub, no shower. Quaint little bar area that was great for a couple quiet drinks before you head off to dinner and the rest of the mayhem that surrounds the French Quarter. Just a perfect, romantic, and peaceful place to stay. Even had it's own parking garage. People were all super nice too. We'll be back to New Orleans very soon, and will look to Dauphine first. Great trip. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: srgnix
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a couple of nights and loved it! Beds are very comfortable, good linens/duvet and of course the location is excellent - one block from Bourbon Street. So, its easy to walk to restaurants, shops, bars etc. Parking garage is right at the property. Not sure if I remember the name of the valet - Mike maybe? - he gave some wonderful recommendations for restaurants...so thanks! We payed extra and really enjoyed the balcony room. NOTE: you will hear outside noise with these rooms as they are facing the street and the street cleaners come early in the morning. But, I will still request a balcony room next time we go. The only negatives (small): one side of the shutters that covered the door to the balcony was missing the main 'thing' that holds them all together. This allowed for the slats to open here and there and the sunlight came through those early in the morning. Also, just a suggestion to front staff (who were great!) I had a health issue when we arrived and asked where the nearest health facility was and they were unable to tell me. So please have that kind of general information handy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Kat036
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I came here for our belated Honeymoon, and the Dauphine Orleans was the perfect pick for a romantic stay in the French Quarter. Its right in the mix of it all, but far enough away from Bourbon Street to make nights out on the balcony enjoyable. Our room had a balcony looking out over Dauphine Street, and it was nice to wake up and have coffee and watch the early morning, as well as at night and watch the reveling. The staff was super helpful and courteous. When we wanted to do tours, we just asked at the front desk and they took care of it. The room was spacious and the King size bed was very, very comfortable. Definitely coming back to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, just next to the action but not in it!”
Reviews.Author: ghilton529
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful weekend at the Dauphine. Just a block from Bourbon Street so easy to get to but our room was quiet. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visitor to this wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mom23girls415
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Dauphine Orleans hotel since a child, and it never dissapoints. My husband and I celebrated our first anniversary there in 1998 and recently, we took our three daughters to New Orleans to celebrate their Spring Break. Of course we stayed at the Dauphine Orleans. We have been home for a couple of days and everybody is still talking about this trip. New Orleans, we missed you after Hurricane Katrina and we are glad you are back! The rooms are so nice and easily accomodates our family. We had a room, with a balcony, that overlooked the courtyard with the parking entrance and had no issue with noise. After reading people's issues with noise, maybe these are the rooms you want? Regardless, I do not know why people are even complaining about noise. You are in the French Quarter for goodness sakes! Enjoy the experience! My recommendations for families travelling to New Orleans is to stay at the Dauphine Orleans, take the Haunted History tour (loved that!), go to the wonderful bookstore across the street, ride the trolley down St. Charles and eat at Camilla Grill, tour the Historic New Orleans Collection (love!), Jackson Square, go down Bourbon Street way before the "celebration" happens, and drink a Hurricane at Lafitte's Blacksmith Shop (oldest bar continually serving in U.S.). Don't even bother with Pat O'Briens Hurricane, Lafitte's is so much better and they have a virgin Hurricane for the kids. Plus - the bar is haunted! I am sure I am forgetting something, and so many things we did not have time to do. We will be back! Please hold room 305 for us!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Gem”
Reviews.Author: TravelDeFamly
Reviews.Content: Stay 3 Nights A lot of personal attention at is small boutique hotel. Great rooms, hotel staff and comfortable beds. Wonderful location one block from the noise, music and crowds of bourbon st. Complimentary continental breakfast was a very nice surprise. Walking distance to everthing you want to do in the French Quarter Definitely will stay Again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, and a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen10151
Reviews.Content: Just one block off Bourbon street with no noise, music or crowds. The hotel is a boutique type and the smallness of it means a lot of personel attention. Staff was helpful and friendly with booking tours or suggestions. The rooms weren't huge but adequate and the pillowtop matteress was awesome. Nice little pool and courtyard, hot tub in another location and the tasty, free breakfast, (waffles, cereal, sausage, etc) kept the expenses down. Cute used bookstore across the street. But the best is that is was a 5 minutes from Bourbon, Royal street. Safe area for women and even late at night and being women we felt very safe walking back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becca478
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay before and after the Rock and Roll Marathon. Clean and quiet location. Friendly, helpful and attentive staff. Continental breakfast was a little better than average. Good in room coffee. Too cold to swim but nice looking pool courtyard. We did not have a car rental, but the valet parking staff held our luggage twice during times that was before/after checkout and they kept it in a secure area. We are personally not a fan of the memory foam mattress pads. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: ama_4327
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Dauphine a number of times and we will continue to go back. Wonderful location, not nearly as noisy or crazy as Bourbon Street but only a block away. Yes, you will hear street noise if you have a room facing the street, so, if that's an issue, request a non-street room. We love coming here: the staff is always friendly, breakfast is free and good, the rooms are clean and comfortable. If all the rooms had a mini-fridge, it would be perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Hermann House room”
Reviews.Author: ARL2601
Reviews.Content: Overall we liked the ascetic of the rooms in the Hermann house. They have exposed brick and beams, track lighting on a dimmer switch, non-ugly carpet, modern bathroom/vanity area, and sooo important for older buildings: good water pressure in the shower! Tempurpedic beds - some may not like that - we didn't mind. No complaint with cleanliness. However, we did put the card out to request new sheets one day and didn't get them. Staff is generally good. One guy provided a great recommendation for a place to get delivery dinner on a night my boyfriend hurt is back and we couldn't walk around too much. The continental breakfast does the job. Cereal, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, juice, and various breads/pastries. Waffle station, but we didn't see anyone attempt to use it. Available till 11 on the weekends and 10 weekdays. We did have some noise issues carrying in from the street, but not bad. More annoying was the yappy dog in the room two doors down. We finally called the front desk around 1am and they confirmed they are pet free hotel and would send security. Whether or not they did, we're not sure. And would guess the owners were probably still out clubbing so not much the staff could have done anyway outside of kidnap the dog. But it did eventually quiet down, for whatever reason, and we think they checked out the next day. Note: the Carriage Courtyard is where the breakfast room is located. We peeked in one room while it was being cleaned and they do look really nice as well, but you might get foot traffic noise from people going to and from the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place/Great Location/Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Pete P
Reviews.Content: No sense repeating all the positive review points, we agree with all of them. All those extras were great. Here's an easy way to combat the "noise' issue some people mention. Request a room in the main building at the back end WITHOUT a balcony. These are actually the staff favorites. Our room was quiet like a fault. We never heard the famous 3:00AM monster garbage trucks or the garage parking. If you really want a balcony then you will have the noise. You have to make a choice. The beds are super soft memory foam type. Everyone raves about them because they are so soft but they do give support. We loved them. If you like a hard bed you won't find one here. The staff was super, super friendly. We were 100% satisfied with the hotel and the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Calm Oasis in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ozfam51
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans is a wonderful respite from the hubbub of the French Quarter. Walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Clean, crisp euro-style linens, pristine bathroom, and very friendly service from all staff. Nice to have fridge and coffee maker in room. Bottled water a very nice touch. Loved the balcony. Parking was $30 a day, but it was so easy and very safe. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay during Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: laura_w224
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - not a bad thing to say about it. The best 4 star hotel I have ever stayed in. The continental breakfast was the same as what we've been finding at Comfort Inns and similar - but I also have never stayed in a 4 star hotel that provides free breakfast at all! It is one street behind Bourbon St and we didn't hear any noise from there at all (although we did hear people on a balcony below us til quite late one night - but hey, it was Mardi Gras). It is beautiful and comfortable, amazing location for Mardi Gras, there is a fitness centre with new cardio machines that have their own TV screens attached, the free wifi is an absolute surprise and works perfectly, staff were lovely and helpful even during what must be their busiest time of year - honestly could not recommend it more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: greeneyedqtpi
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 2-18/2-23 and had a balcony room over Dauphine St. The street noise was bothersome for me, everything from people shouting to cars passing by at night. After the first night I got ear plugs and was able to get some sleep. There is no sound protection provided by the doors or windows. Basically it is all the annoying noise without any of the party or excitement of actually having a balcony on Bourbon St. The beds are not uncomfortable at first, but a couple nights into it you can feel lack of quality sleep on your body. The housekeeping left something to be desired and it was clear the rooms was not vacuumed daily, in fact two days into our trip my boyfriend asked when I was eating almonds because he found one on the floor, but it was not from me. However, they were good about cleaning the bathroom. Overall for the price (post Mardi Gras) I expected better, better linens, better breakfast, better room quality... perhaps you are paying for being a block from Bourbon St, but if you can pay half the price and be within walking distance of the action I would suggest it. On the upside the staff are very friendly and competent, which can be priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: waldopepperpeculiar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel 2/15/12 to 2/17/12. We were there for the 'pre Mardi Gras' celebrations. This hotel is conveniently located in the French Quarter, we were within walking distance to anyplace we were interested in going to. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and took time to answer all our questions about things to do while in the French Quarter, restaurants to frequent, and directions about how to get from point A to B. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had a french doors that opened onto a balcony which was great, the weather was such that we could open the doors and enjoy fresh air. The continental breakfast was good, they had the setup to make your own waffles. Muffins, sausage, fresh fruit, and coffee was also available. Mae Bailey's is the lounge attached to the hotel. We thought the prices were reasonable and it was a nice place to go to after we spent a day treking thru the Quarter. We would definitely go back to the Dauphine Orleans Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't really fault it! Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Laurajaneo
Reviews.Content: We stayed during and after Mardi Gras and it turned out to be pretty much perfect. Great location on Dauphine Street which is very central, a short walk to Bourbon Street and the rest of the French quarter but it is a quiet street so no noise. The reception staff are very friendly and was impressed by free wifi (for 1 week), pc and printer available and water provided in your room each day. The room was spacious - we were 2 friends so had 2 double beds which were comfortable. Breakfast is a help yourself affair but lots of choice and sets you up for the day.Would definitely recommend this hotel. I would rate it personally as 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “If you are heading to Mardi Gras....”
Reviews.Author: Loverfrom
Reviews.Content: DISCLAIMER; Stayed at the hotel 2/17 to 2/23 for Mardi Gras 2012 so was not expecting quiet. First, if you have never been, Do It! Second, if you need a place to stay, I recommend Dauphine Orleans. It is close enough to Boubon St. (1 block) and close enough to Canal St (4 blocks) and very safe, well lit street. Third, the front desk staff, Cynthia and Roderick, under the management of Aisha Adams (former VA girl!) were Outstanding!! Can't say enough about them. They were informative, pleasant and somehow always knew our names when we walked in the door. The one time we asked for additional towels, the response was courteous and extremely quick. Upon check-in our room wasn't quite ready so we were provided additional free drink coupons. We left our cell phone number and went to get something to eat; when the room was ready they gave us a call. I didn't care for the wristbands (not sure of the purpose). Our room was across the street with a view of the courtyard, very quiet and had a nice sitting area and water fountain feature, well manicured. Area had a southern charm with wooden shutters on the doors and windows but provided enough darkness for sleeping. Large room with king size bed, desk, dresser drawers, night stands, exposed brick walls and wooden beam ceiling. Also had a safe and refrigerator along with a jacuzzi bath, central air/heat. Considering the amount of time we spent in the room, it was perfect. Continental breakfast was provided with the waffle maker, juices, breads/muffins, coffee, fresh fruit, breakfast meat. They only offered boiled eggs. If you want something more, go to Krystals at Bourbon and Canal streets. Mae Bailey's bar is attached to the hotel, convenient but drinks were slightly pricey. Didn't use the pool. Night before leaving we requested a cab to the airport at a specific time, They ensured the cab was there on the dot! Next personal trip to New Orleans, I will definitely stay here! Hope you do as well,

Reviews.Title: “On location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Statoj
Reviews.Content: The website of the Dauphine Orleans makes it look like a luxury accommodation. To see it in person, it is a bit more modest, very down to earth. The room (2 beds) was not huge, but it had a nice balcony overlooking Dauphine St. It was very clean and the beds were comfortable. There is a computer for guest's use in the lobby. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Like so many buildings in the French Quarter, this one has a private courtyard only accessible to guests. There is a nice little pool (my January visit was surprisingly chilly so I did not swim), and also off the courtyard is the coffee room,w hich is used for their delicious, free breakfasts. Tablecloths, lots of cooked warm choices, good coffee and plenty of fruit juice. The coffee room is one end of an elbow-shaped area in which the other end is the bar. Also very personal and cosy, with free chips offered with a drink. Off the entrance ist he hotel library, with lots of reading material which you are free to take with you if you wish. The location is a perfect walking distance from all points in the French Quarter, the waterfront, and even the Marigny neighborhood (where the local musicians do their gigs on Frenchmen St.) I would have gone for more "local color" in a hotel, but I feared bedbugs. This hotel was the perfect solution.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wheretonxt
Reviews.Content: I thought this property was located close enough to the action but was not noisey during the late night hours. The pool area was small but nice and the rooms were nicely updated and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location.”
Reviews.Author: chrisolum
Reviews.Content: Just a block from Bourbon St so a great location if you want to be based in the Quarter. We made the mistake of choosing a balcony room overlooking the street - nice room, but noisy. So we asked to be moved and the girls on the desk were SO nice and helpful. We got a room overlooking the courtyard and a reduction on the bill. The free breakfast is nice enough compared to those we've had similar elsewhere. We thought the connected bar "May Baily's Place" was expensive and too dark. The same two drinks which cost us $22 there were $12.50 at the "Deja Vu" bar/diner across the street. Overall a nice hotel for the price and we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate0110
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Perfect location - one block from Bourbon street in a safe area. You can't hear the noise on Bourbon street either, which is great. We walked everywhere in the two days we stayed and only took a cab one time. -The price is awesome for the location. Other hotels in the same area were a lot more expensive -Fantastic customer service. Everyone working was very friendly -Free drink coupons upon check-in and free bottled water in the room; this became very handy! -Free continental breakfast - wasn't amazing by any means, but good enough to grab if you need something quick and don't want to walk to another place. Waffles, sausage, hard boiled eggs, pastries, fruit, etc -Rooms are very clean and the beds are so comfortable! Lots of towels provided (you don't see this very often) The ONLY con: -The noise. Our room was on the second floor facing the parking garage - big mistake. Both mornings (Friday and Saturday) around 7 AM it because very noisy right outside our window. Loud, screeching noises (maybe the garbage truck and/or construction, we had no idea what it was) and valet guys talking and yelling at each other in extremely loud voices. It didn't seem like they had any regard for the guests in their hotel that were sleeping just a few feet away from the garage. This caused us to be unable to fall back asleep at all, which was disappointing considering we were on vacation and had stayed up into the wee hours the night before. In hindsight we should have asked to move rooms, but we were only there two days and didn't want to mess with it. Overall we had a great time and will stay there again next time, but request a quieter room! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: georgiaStatenIsland
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. We were 2 adults, a teenager, and a 5 year old. Our room was in the back and it was perfectly quiet and clean. Not terribly large, but comfortable. The breakfast was nothing to write home about but we were satisfied. The location was good and close to everything we wanted to see and do. There was a discrepency on our bill when we checked out. Make sure you you print out the confirmation with discounted rate if you have one, if booking in advance. It was fixed immediately and easily with that one piece of paper! The staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN Comfortable Stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: laranicole25
Reviews.Content: I was just in New Orleans the last weekend of Jan 2012. I chose the Dauphine off of Trip Advisor and I wasn't dissappointed! The outside was charming in the typical French Quarter style. The Pool area was quite charming as well and was located in the interior courtyard with balconies looking down on the pool. I stayed in the main part of the hotel and the room was modern and above all CLEAN!!!!! and was nicely furnished. The maid service was great, and very attentive when you call. The coffee and bottled water was a great amenity. They gave us towels aplenty, a blowdryer and a safe (which we didn't need because we felt that safe in this hotel). I can't stress enough how clean and new everything was. Our room was ready when we arrived at 11AM on a Saturday morning. It is 2 streets away from Bourbon Street, so close enough to be near the craziness but far enough to not even hear the night life. Staff was very friendly and got us cabs when needed. It is about 7 minutes from Jackson Square if you walk fast, 15 minutes if you walk slow. We slept through the night and morning without any noise waking us up. The 'Deluxe Continental Breakfast' was a little lacking, but it was free and the coffee was good, and they had 'to go' coffee cups.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: crzcrzy
Reviews.Content: Spent a total of 13 nights at the Dauphine, pre and post cruise with NCL. Most staff were excellent, friendly, and willling to stop for a quick chat. Had some small issues with our room and both were attended to quickly. We spent our pre cruise nights in a balcony room over Dauphine Street...too noisy most nights for my liking but our pre teens slept through the bar crowds heading home. The weather was also a bit lower than average some day so to sit on the balcony required a blanket. Nothing special about the continental breakfast, waffles, hard boiled eggs, sausage, breads and pastries, fresh fruit, cold cereals, yogurt, juices and coffee/tea/hot chocolate. Almost no variety in the choice of fruits or pastries over the 10 days we initially spent. The rooms were clean, quiet in terms of hotel noise, but unfortunately the balcony doors do not keep out the street noise very well. Regular room amenities...coffee, free wi-fi, refrigerator (in the balcony room), robes, hairdryer, soaps and shampoos (no body/hand lotion). The beds were very comforable! We found the location great, close to everything we needed. The most disappointing part of our stay was THE POOL IS NOT HEATED as advertised! While in NOLA we rode the trollery cars to uptown/garden district as well as to City Park for Celebration in the Oaks (ok, was expecting more spectacular), made a visit to the zoo (excellent), the aquarium (interesting), the insectarium (very educational), took a plantation/airboat tour (well worth the money), managed to see the Saints at the Superdome (wow, but not impressed with the fan who blew his noise maker in front of us and wouldn't stay seated), ate at many great restaurants and heard alot of great music! I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Jwallmtz
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NO. Wanted to find a hotel close to Bourbon St. This was perfect! Pleasantly suprised by how big the room and bathroom were! The continental breakfast was one of the better ones we've had. The coffee was awesome too! Staff was very helpful as well! Can't wait to get back to NO and looking foward to staying at the Dauphine again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy comfort in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms in the main hotel are of a typical modern standard. Good value with the included continental breakfast, and great location. You might want to beware of the rooms that face the brick wall of the alley; there will be some noise from garbage pickup early in the morning, though none from the street partiers. Best bet for quiet might be one of the pool-facing rooms. You'll get a free drink ticket for the attached May Bailey's bar, a nice way to start your foray into the Quarter for the evening. It is also located immediately by one of the city's (and the country's) top dining spots, Bayona. But the whole Quarter is within easy walking distance, as is Congo Square/Louis Armstrong Park. No restaurant, so no room service, though I'd imagine the desk knows which places will deliver, if that's what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting better”
Reviews.Author: nikki545
Reviews.Content: 've stayed several places in the French Quarter and I was surprised that this place got such great ratings. While the service was great and there were some nice touches like the welcome drink tickets and free water, the bathroom was scuzzy. There was mildew on the ceiling which I reported, and the 'fix' was to paint over part of it with a swipe of a different color and leave the rest. There were several large chips out of the toilet. The TV took several on/off tries to get it going. The rest of the room was nice but there was a lot of noise being right over the interior parking area. I had to use earplugs to keep from being woken up in the morning. If they put out as much effort keeping the rooms up as they do with the service, they'd be a 5-star rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelinmama13
Reviews.Content: The room and location of this hotel are great. The beds are very comfortable and the pillows too. There is a fridge in the room which is great for leftovers. The staff is very friendly and Mike the valet guy is also very nice. We had a balcony room with two queen beds. The balcony overlooked Dauphine Street and it is a long balcony so you have about four or five other rooms that share the same one. When you exit your balcony doors you step out on the balcony and there is a bench you can sit on in front of each room. I didn't see anyone else on the balcony for the few times I went out there but it was nice to go out one more and see filming right in front of the hotel. The only complaint I would have about this hotel is that the doors leading out to the balcony are old and seem to not have any sealant left in them. I could feel the coldness coming through the crack of the doors and luckily it wasn't too cold. The blinds on the doors were starting to come apart as well so I would recommend the hotel invest in either new doors or at least resealant and some new blinds. But i would still stay here again because it was a great place to stay.. Oh yeah, I do wear earplugs so I couldn't hear any noises coming from the balcony. My friend could hear a little noise but I have learned if I don't want to hear noises in a hotel invest in earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhh the Dauphine Orleans. We LOVED the Dauphine.”
Reviews.Author: barbwire2004
Reviews.Content: IN A NUTSHELL: This hotel has great old world New Orleans charm and architecture without feeling dirty or dated. We quickly referred to it as â€œhomeâ€� during our stay. The May Bailey bar is a little musty smelling but HEY this is a old brothel from around 1857! It oozes history and boy if those walls could talk!! The Dauphine is in a great location away from all the shenaniganâ€™s of Bourbon street but a quick walk to it if you are looking for excitement. There is a beautiful salt water pool with lounge chairs and fresh towels to use. Grab a cocktail at the May Bailey and go lounge by the pool for a quick â€œrefreshâ€�. So quiet but accessible to all. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. The husband and I are going back in March and will be trying out the Herman House section of the Dauphine! Stay tuned! The ROOM: Our room was LARGE. We had a King size bed/balcony room. First, THE BED is a tempurpedic. This WILL be the next bed we ownâ€¦I donâ€™t think I have ever slept so well (we were down in August and were on the edge of heat exhaustion ever day so that could have helped!). The beds are heaven! Wonderful pillows and crisp clean sheets. There is a lovely fluffy robe to use in the bathroom that I will be â€œstealingâ€� next time we are there (they charge your card). There is a coffee machine with ok coffee (I think it is Wolfgang Puck brand?) and a small refrigeratorâ€¦no microwave. The fridge is quite handy for water and BEER! ï�Š There was a nice couch sitting area. It was very roomy feeling! I did not spend as much time on the balcony as I thought I would. I was insistent on having a balcony if I could get one and thought I would be out there daily drinking coffee and a cocktail, but really didnâ€™t. So, if you are traveling on a budget, and you are looking to stay at the Dauphine, I would say that you could omit this additional cost (20-30 dollars extra a night depending). Dauphine street is a bit more quiet in regards to pedestrian traffic than say Bourbon or Royal so there isnâ€™t much â€œactionâ€� to sit and people watch. It is a LOVELY view however. Also, no matter what hotel you are staying at, trash is picked up at 3 AM so if you are a light sleeper this will wake you up nightly. HAUNTED â€“ The Dauphine is on the â€œ10 most haunted hotels in New Orleansâ€�. We did not run into any spirits however, unfortunately. http://goneworleans.about.com/od/hotels/tp/hauntedhotels.htm VALUE: There is a â€œcoffee barâ€� in the morning with a decent coffee and tea selection, continental breakfast and you get a coupon on check in for a free wine or beer at the May Bailey. The breakfast is basic, fresh fruit, cereal, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, assortment of juices, etc. and cool waffle maker. Even though basic, we found it to be a great way to start the morning for FREE knowing we would be spending probably a hundred dollars or so later on lunch and dinner. It was clean and well stocked. There is valet parking right at the hotel, however, we did not rent a carâ€¦there isnâ€™t much of a need if you are visiting specifically the French Quarter or anywhere in the Garden District. You can grab a cab for a flat fee right outside of the airport luggage pick up area. The STAFF: When my husband and I arrived at NOLA for our first visit way before our check-in time. (yes we were back within two months of our first arrival and will be back in a monthâ€¦we are obsessed! We stayed a different hotel on this second stay and regretted it within minutes of check in.) We called ahead and the front desk told us we could check our bags with the valet and walk around until check-inâ€¦so there we stood waiting for the valet and one of the staff ladies â€œCan I help you allâ€� in the BEST Southern accent EVER...â€�We are early and would like to leave our bagsâ€�â€�What are your namesâ€� We told her and she promptly disappeared and reappeared a few minutes laterâ€¦â€�Your room is readyâ€¦you all go and check inâ€�. Perfect way to start to the stay. Now I am not saying you will be able to check in early, but the staff was very friendly and helpful! I know there are many of choices of places to stay in the Quarter. I have probably done all the same research you have, searched all the sites and read all of the reviews. The Dauphine is a safe bet for the money if you are looking for comfort, class and history without spending 300-500 dollars a night!

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RobynMM
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect - one street over from Bourbon on Dauphine. This way we couldn't hear the partiers from our room, but could still walk easily to anywhere we wanted to go. The rooms were nice, we had a balcony which I recommend! The staff here were so friendly (especially Ayesha)! They helped us out with recommendations and general directions on multiple occasions! The breakfast wasn't super, but it was free so you can't really complain too much. The rates were reasonable as well. They give you a free drink ticket for the hotel bar when you check in as well. Overall, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Laurel L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a couple nights while traveling through New Orleans. It was a great place to stay and it was in a nice convenient location just far enough from the noise of Bourbon Street. The room was clean, the staff was very friendly, the parking was convenient and I would definitely stay there again. They also offer a free breakfast and wifi. Parking at the time was 32 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “It was better 16 years ago”
Reviews.Author: Natasha_R_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I stayed there during my first trip to NOLA back in 1985 and at that time it was great. That's why I was deeply disappointed. The room was OK though looked a bit worn. We booked for 3 but there was only one set of toiletries and they never put the replacement next day. I don't know, maybe it is not done in the USA but it is strange for Europeans. As for breakfast, you need to come really well to get everything that is offered. All in all, just an average hotel and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CMM-LA
Reviews.Content: I was quite disappointed with this hotel. I do not think I would stay there again. Pros: location cannot be beat, walking distance to everything, we even walked out to the Garden District and the WWII Museum very comfortable mattress breakfast was fine- good choice of cold cereals, yogurt, fruit, rolls/toast etc. go early however because it appears that when they run out they do not replace it. same with the coffee urns. We went at 9:30 for coffee and it was out, we tried again at 10:00... still out. friendly staff Cons: barely met my lowest standards of cleanliness- the floor had not been well vacuumed, the duvet cover had stains, glitter and hair all over it. the bathroom was reasonable but needed a deep cleaning. the inner duvet corner was hanging out and it was unutterably filthy. I took a photo but I won't shock you with it. It was clear it had not been cleaned in a very, very long time. very small, but that's understandable in a historic hotel and it was ok very noisy- despite my request for a quiet room (well, as quiet as possible given the locale) we were put next to the coffee area and people slammed the door and talked loudly outside our room starting very early in the morning. In general I found the hotel to be very overpriced given the above. We were there on a holiday weekend so perhaps it was not as good a value as it normally is. I won't be back however to find out.

Reviews.Title: “January in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: silver_but_active
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel The room was in the main hotel - we had asked for a quiet room after reading some of the reviews and ours certainly was. It was a little dark but then in January that suited us fine. The town was extremely busy with revellers as there was a key match on at the dome but we heard none of it. The front desk were most helpful we had arrived very late after a delayed flight but they could not do enough for us. Also when asked about trips etc. The hotel was advertised as bed only but the complimentary breakfast was more than adequate and beautifully fresh. A real bonus. Altogether this hotel made our break most enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: LynnS55
Reviews.Content: really nice hotel, and friendly staff, we had a nice quiet room at the back of the hotel so certainly no noise issues, superbly located for Bourbon Street and a couple of minutes walk from the Mississippi and all the tours - definately recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine is pretty good”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: i've stayed here about 12 times or so for 35-40 nights over last 20 years. It's not 5 star and it's not perfect but it's a fair value and it's clean. The bar is nice between 4-7pm and the free breakfast is quite nice, though not lavish.

Reviews.Title: “Long time favorite”
Reviews.Author: IxchelLufkin_TX
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Dauphine off and on for almost 20 years. We've never been disappointed. The last two times we have stayed at the Hermann House and the rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The courtyard makes for a cozy feel. The location makes it easy to park and walk to most of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Staff saved the day!”
Reviews.Author: DeadXCanXDance
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - one street back from Bourbon St. Close to transport and entertainment, but we felt safe and noise wasn't an issue. We had a few issues with our room and had to be moved twice, but the staff were so friendly and accommodating - they upgraded us, gave us a discount and even sent a bottle of champagne to our room. It is the kind of service you would like to receive everywhere, but can be so hard to find. The Dauphine was clean, comfortable and quiet, but it was the people that made it a place to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect French Quarter location.”
Reviews.Author: HobieMeow
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans located in the French Quarter a block off of Bourbon Street and easy walking distance to everything in the quarter. The staff is welcoming and friendly. Our room was a king balcony on the Dauphine Street side and it was great. Comfy bed, refrigerator, spacious room. Negatives are the small bathrooms (plenty fine for us but relatively small) and the rooms do show some minor wear. The biggest positive is that you get plenty of bang for your buck. We paid an extremely fair price for a great room in the best hotel in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Older with Character Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gigiparis
Reviews.Content: Best Location one block off Bourbon St so noise is not a problem but all of French Quarter and access to street car within walking distance. Great Tempurpedic beds. Could use some refreshment (decor) but good value including free drink coupons for the (smoky) quaint and quiet bar attached: May Baily's Place.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Anita C
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the Dauphine, we were greeted with a warm, friendly hostess at the desk. (Betty). Our rooms were just right, quiet, away from the madding crowd of Bourbon Street, which we liked. From there we could get everywhere. The hotel is charming with a lovely courtside pool. The hotel puts out a large spread for breakfast and thanks to Dawn and the whole staff, we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “loved the dauphine”
Reviews.Author: tina f
Reviews.Content: As a last minute choice, we were pleasantly surprised. This is a beautiful hotel with a lot of character. The location was perfect for walking on Bourbon Street, Royal Street, or to Jefferson Square. Yet far enough away so you do not hear any of the noise from Bourbon. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was perfect. You also get 2 drink tickets for their lounge and free water in the room. Will stay here again next time in NOLA. Also, highly recommend the Ghosts of the Garden District walking tour. This was a great tour starting at 2:30. You meet at the cemetery, see beautiful homes, and learn about the ghosts that occupy some of them. Loved It!!!! you can check it out on line at www.hauntedhistorytours.com

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: LATaz
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine is just great! We had rooms on the 4th floor facing the parking garage and they were extremely quiet. The memory foam bed was very comfortable and the room was immaculately clean. Missed the convenience of a mini-fridge, but no big deal. They even give you free water, which I have never seen in a New Orleans hotel before. The salt water pool would be great in the summer. The fitness room was adequate and the complimentary breakfast as well(on the order of La Quinta-boiled eggs, pastries, bagels, waffles, sausage, plenty of coffee and hot water for tea, juice.) The best thing about this charming place is the location. Two blocks to the Ritz Carlton and the Davenport Lounge, which is then right across from the Roosevelt and the Sazerac Bar, and close to everything in the Quarter. The little restaurant right down the street called Vacherie is great as is EAT-see my review. The $30 parking fee is ridiculous, but less than some places in NO-the attendants are super friendly and get your car quickly. The funny thing is that they did not know where anything was located, just kept telling us to get a cab-but we had a car! Luckily we had maps. The front desk folks were very nice, even calling after check-in to see if the room was ok. They also give you drink coupons for wine and beer in the onsite bar. For $120 per night this place is a steal and my new favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: alwayssneezy
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed three nights at this property. Our room was spacious and very clean, not something you often find the French Quarter. Bathroom was a bit small and lacked counter space, but it made up for that with a great shower. You could hear your neighbors through the walls - we're guessing due to the age of the building - but we're from a metropolitan area, so we didn't mind a little nosie. The staff were always friendly and helpful, especially Cynthia at the front desk. We spent some time at May Bailey's, the bar next to the hotel. Small, quiet, and laid-back, though you will smell like smoke afterward. (But that's true for most bars in the French Quarter) Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would both stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, pleasant, non-smoking, clean and convenient just off Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: BarbGrae
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this non-smoking hotel - the rooms were delightful without a hint of smoke smell. People could smoke in the pool area and the bar, however, these weren't issues for us. We were checked in smoothly by very friendly staff, breakfast was substantial with many choices in a pleasant breakfast room - real cutlery and crockery. The location was great because the French Quarter can be quite hectic and noisy late into the night / am hours, so Dauphine is an oasis away from all of that. We had free wifi in our room but also there was a computer in the lobby if you are not carrying your laptop; including a printer which was very useful for us.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable reasonably priced hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: nomad052
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a very good hotel. As other reviewers have mentioned, it's in a great location (although I'd prefer to stay on the south side of Bourbon street). The rooms are clean and comfortable. The front-desk staff are polite and helpful. And I appreciated the complimentary drink at the bar next door. On the down-side, the bed linens need upgrading and the rooms are fairly small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Hermann house rooms private but need updating”
Reviews.Author: Dan A
Reviews.Content: The good: As stated by others the location is very good - in the quarter and walking distance to all the interesting sights. We stayed in the Hermann house recommended for being quieter which they were. A nice private courtyard to sit in if you are so inclined. Other complaints here about the quality of the free breakfast but it seemed average to above average for these type of breakfasts. The mediocre: While the Hermann house room was interesting architecturally - old restored building - it had a well used feel to it and was somewhat outdated stylistically - especially the bathroom - cracks in the jetted tub and a beat up toilet. Why do people ever want a jetted tub in a hotel unless you know they have some super-sanitization process for it?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mermaid820
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful Hotel located in the French quarter. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The room was very small and rather dark but it was clean and the bed was super comfortable. The free breakfast was filling with a good selection of items. May Baileys was once a bordello and is now the bar. Each room has a copy of the license dated 1857. I forgot to keep my copy but it says something about lewd and abandoned women. The hotel is supposed to be haunted, although I'm not sure how one would be able to tell considering the strange things one might see any night, anywhere in the French quarter. Nice stay, I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small but clean and updated rooms!”
Reviews.Author: cnd2227
Reviews.Content: Great location close to bourbon st, very reasonably priced, clean, charming breakfast area

Reviews.Title: “close but not quite "all dat"”
Reviews.Author: simplegifts
Reviews.Content: First what was good: the location in the french quarter yet on a quiet street was perfect. the bed was quite comfortable, and the room charming though small (I felt the lack of a real window) and the cleaning staff did a fantastic job. breakfast however was lacking (even continental you can set out some goodies, and how hard would it have been to make some grits), the staff was friendly but sort of bumbllingly clueless (unable to recommend a place to eat on our arrival -they should have had a list of different types of restaurants and directions available to hand out). also a personal gripe - at that price level they should have nicer towels and two ply toilet paper. bathroom was small (though great shower/jacuzzi/bath) and the sink was in a separate room which was a bit weird. don't get me wrong, we had a perfectly nice stay - it just wasn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Gordon2112
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Dauphine Orleans after much research into where to stay in New Orleans. Overall we were satisfied with this decision and enjoyed our stay. By far the best thing about this hotel is its FQ location, which is within easy walking distance of all the FQ attractions, even right down to the St Charles streetcar and the Aquarium (about 15 mins walk). Although the hotel is only 1 block away from the madness of Bourbon St, we were amazed to find how quiet it was. Perhaps helped by the fact we had a courtyard facing room on the top floor, we never noticed any disturbance at all while in our room so slept very well. Our room was pretty much as we'd expected it to be: a bit bland and not luxurious, but clean, comfortable and with all usual facilities. Our king bed was large and comfortable, and standards of house-keeping were high. The quiet but effective aircon was appreciated as even in November we discovered it can be warm and humid in NOLA. Our room had only one very small window with shutters, so the amount of daylight entering the room was very limited. The complementary breakfast was fine, though if busy, you have to sit in the bar area as an overspill (which has a rather damp musty smell to it). Choices included croissants, bagels, toast, cereal and self-made waffles (which were very good). If I had any real criticism of this hotel it would be that the whole experience felt very impersonal - as you might expect in a 700-room airport hotel not a 120-room historic hotel like the Dauphine . Although we stayed for 5 days, I don't think any of the staff acknowledged us at all beyond a perfunctory "good morning". On arrival after a long connecting flight from London, we waited several minutes while the single receptionist went to answer a phone call without even acknowledging our presence.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and not very clean, but a good value.”
Reviews.Author: Shwynn2
Reviews.Content: We paid $119/night which was the most I would have paid for this slightly below average experience. Room was very small with no dresser and no exterior window. The Hermann House side has doors with cracks at the top letting in all noise from the housekeeping staff's work in the mornings. Housekeeping was sub par as they failed to pick up a condom wrapper from a previous guest-- not a fun thing to find on the last day of a three night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and great location”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan212
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans has beautiful rustic courtyards and includes an extensive continental breakfast. You can't beat the location! Only a block from Bourbon Street, yet distanced from the noise at night. In walking distance from Canal Street and the Canal Streetcar and St. Charles Streetcar. In comfortable walking distance from most sights in the French Quarter. We had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloAjax
Reviews.Content: Great Location with secure parking. Very clean with all the amenities. The only drawbacks were it was very noisy by Thursday/Friday ( expected but the noise came from the parking garage that the public can use as well) and our TV was fuzzy/not as new as you'd expect. Overall a 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a crazy weekend”
Reviews.Author: Phil2589
Reviews.Content: I was only in New Orleans for 36, maybe 40 hours. This said, the Dauphine was well presented, very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Crabcake_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at this conveniently located hotel in the Quarter. Nothing fancy, but very good value, large rooms, and friendly, helpful staff. No restaurant, but very good breakfast is included, nice pool and courtyard, and great bar.

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine Orleans”
Reviews.Author: TexTravelerUS
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Has a true New Orleans Feel. The first night has a free drink at the hotel bar. Valet parking with in and out priviledges. I recoomend a room in the carriage house.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Quiet, Friendly Staff !”
Reviews.Author: woogster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back, went with 2 other couples . Had Reservations at another hotel for 5 months. Was informed a few weeks before we were to be there that our hotel was closed due to problems with renovation. Accomodations were an upgrade, glad of that. Hotel is in great location,very clean, staff is great. Mattresses are to die for. Only thing is the Continental breakfast isn't the best, so many Rest. to eat at we did not care. Would stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Convenient, Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: MiMolly
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans Hotel is well located, the staff goes beyond what is expected to be helpful, and the rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet. They occasionally offer specials on accommodations with parking included. We'll be returning to New Orleans and plan to stay at the Dauphine Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “The Dauphine Orleans, perfect hotel & location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jody500
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was the one of the best I have ever stayed at in our travels! Our reservations were a little different than I had planned due to a few physical problems I was experiencing at the time of our trip. I must give a special thanks to Betty White & management for the extra effort that was given to make our stay comfortable. Dauphine Orleans is one block off Bourbon Street, you can also walk to any part of the French Quarter from the hotel. They arranged all of our tours for us and the continental breakfast included in the stay was a great way to start the morning. This is the place to stay on your French Quarter experience.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: taylogvacations11
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans in August 2011 -great time. The food and music is absolutely fabulous. Of course the lodging is key to a good time. We stayed at the Dauphine New Orleans after lengthy research on places to stay in the French Quarter. When we arrived at the room it did not look like the one I had reserved on-line so I reluctantly called the front desk. The supervisor called me back immediately and offered to change the room. She then came to our room with keys to look at three other cottages to pick from. We were thrilled, the cottage was great, very comfortable and large. We couldn't have been happier. The continental breakfast was better than the average.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: harleymomma74
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed during the week in the French Quarter. There were plenty of great qualities about this hotel. It was clean with modern furnishings, the staff was very attentive and service was excellent. They even cooperated with us about a slight misunderstanding. That was very cool. They use Tempur-PedicÂ® mattresses which were the main reason I booked this hotel. We have one at home and my husband cannot sleep well on a spring mattress. However, if sleep is what you are after so close to Bourbon Street, then you might wish to reconsider this location. The street is active 24/7. We stayed in room 214 which was not our original booking. I had read other reviews about the noise so originally I booked the Hermann House across the street in a room that was off of the street. Upon our arrival they informed us that the room we booked had a/c issues and was unavailable. They upgraded us to the suite in the main hotel which is directly on Dauphine St above the garage entrance. This would have been beyond cool if we wanted to party all night. But sleeping proved difficult especially with the garbage trucks that seemed to show up between 3am and 4am. Super loud. Also, being that this hotel is a block from Bourbon Street, you see all kinds come by. Keep in mind that you will definitely hear drunken people with very colorful language yelling in the street below all night if you stay on a street side room. You can take advantage of this free entertainment by setting out some drinks on the balcony table and just enjoying the show. We did just that the night my husband unfortunately broke his toe while exiting the bathroom door. Speaking of bathroom; it was pretty small and really only practical for brushing your teeth or washing your hands. Make up and hair styling was awkward with no real room to spread out all of the products most women require. Bring a mirror with you if you can. Donâ€™t forget to visit May Baileyâ€™s for drinks at the bar and in the morning for a continental breakfastâ€¦.with waffles, breads, cereal and fruit. There is no room service at this hotel but the bartender at May Bailey's has a ton of menus for local delivery options. Just ask them and they should be glad to help. Overall, this is a great choice hotel for being in the French Quarter. You can walk just about everywhere and easily walk to hop on a street car for a short ride into the Garden District. Worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chapina71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 days in September to celebrate my big 4 Ohh! Found the staff pleasant, the room clean and comfortable. The continental bfast was lacking, coffee bad, but I never expect much from continentals, however it does include fresh fruit and yogurt. One thing that really frustrated me, not specific to the Dauphine but rather to most of NOLA is that there were no recycling bins anywhere and almost everything 'to go' is served in a styrofoam container! Let's keep the green, green people! But I digress, the hotel is one block away from Bourbon, smack in the middle of the FQ, walking distance to all the action ! I found the beds very comfortable and enjoyed the all cotton bed linens. The 2 complimentary drinks @ their infamous May Bailey's bar (used to be a brothel) were a nice touch. It's not the best deal, not the fanciest but if you want clean, comfy and a pleasant staff that is walking distance from everything then the Dauphine is for you. Note to staff - please think about going Green, and get some recycling and compost bins and stop using non-recycable styrofoam containers! For the love of all that is good and green. :)

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of quiet, as promised”
Reviews.Author: Sommelier12
Reviews.Content: We had booked the cottages, as space and quiet was at a premium, and were dismayed to find our booking cancelled a month later, due to renovations. Dawn promised us the suite in Hermann House would be quiet, and it was. (She also gave us the suite at a much discounted rate).We indeed had a cool quiet spacious spot of our own, in the midst of hot noisy wonderful NOLA. All staff were most obliging, which helped in fixing a few maintenece issues which came up, as they do in old buildings. The standard of cleanliness was most impressive, especially considering the age of the building again. The only truly annoying problem was the WiFi didn't work in our room, possibly because our suite was physically the furthest from the main building. It worked fine closer in.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad, and the UGLY”
Reviews.Author: Andrea H
Reviews.Content: My husband I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary in NOLA this past weekend. We booked a Superior Carriage House room with a large jacuzzi for 2 nights, September 30-October 1 2011. The Good: The hotel could not be better situated to all the best the French Quarter has to offer. If you live close enough to make the trip by car, the Dauphine offers valet parking on site for an acceptable fee, this is one reason we chose the Dauphine. The rooms are tastefully decorated, and the toiletries provided were better quality. Additionally, we had plenty of towels to last us our entire stay, and I use a lot of towels. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were nice. The saltwater pool is small but lovely. The complimentary continental breakfast was good. We were provided a bottle of complimentary champagne upon our arrival. The hotel bar May bailey's is sweetly glamorous. The Bad: After we unpacked and sank into the jacuzzi tub after our eight hour drive from DFW, TX, the phone rang. We ignored it. Then it rang again. We ignored it. Then there was a knock at the door. Seems our use of the tub was causing a leak into the bar May Bailey's below. After verifying that the tub was the source of the leak, the maintenance man gave us a pained look and fled. No one apologized to us or instructed us re: future jacuzzi use. The UGLY: The room was dirty when we arrived, the tub unscrubbed and the floor unvacuumed, and coffee supplies were unreplineshed. My husband scrubbed the tub with a washcloth and some shower gel. The mirrors were smudged, the shower door filthy, there were cigarette burns on the bathroom sink's edge. It was really disappointing. The ceiling vents were covered with a hideous amount of mold. The whole place smelled very musty and smoked in, and the hotel is supposed to be non-smoking. However, when we went into the hotel bar below our room people were smoking, and the worst is....when we got home ALL of the belongings we returned with had to be immediately laundered or dry cleaned as they smelled like cigarette smoke. I understand that standards of cleanliness might be more lax in the quarter, but much of this filth was easily preventable with normal routine cleaning one would expect for $279.00 per night. not sure we will stay here again. I expected much more for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Stay at the Dauphine Orleans”
Reviews.Author: MichSummer
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Dauphine Orleans was for six nights the end of August 2011. My husband and I have stayed here many times over the years and always keep coming back. We love the character and the location and we have always had great service. We have found that we prefer the Hermann House, across the street from the main hotel. It is quiet and secluded with large rooms. This time we traveled with my best friend and her husband. They were celebrating their honeymoon and had booked a standard room, and we upgraded them to a Hermann House suite as part of their wedding gift. I called a couple of weeks before arrival and the hotel was so helpful in the upgrade and making sure that is was applied to my bill as opposed to theirs. And they even remembered to send a complimentary bottle of champagne to their room the night we arrived, and I hadn't even requested one. Rooms were cool, quiet and the beds so comfortable. The continental breakfast each morning is a nice touch, as it's free, and so are the two complimentary drink tickets they give you upon arrival. Staying at the Dauphine Orleans is part of what we look forward to when visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lynncl2004
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be ideal for those just interested in going out on the town and using the hotel for nothing but sleeping. We had the main house king room. When we arrived the front desk was quick in checking us in and told us exactly where to go. We got to our room and it was a bit small but still had walking room. It was a king size bed that was SSSOOOOO comfortable, a table and chair with mirror and a mini fridge. We also liked the free wifi because we brought our lab top. The bathroom was spacious but not a lot of counter space. I didn't like the small tub/shower but it was good enough to take a shower every morning. The tv had HBO and was nice when you need a little down time. I do have to say that the valet and people working at this hotel was very nice. I lost my key and was no trouble with getting me a new one. It is convienient because it was one street a way from bourbon and was not noise at all. The only noise I had was the first night but that as because some lady liked to talk right outside our door and slammed her door for an hour (in and out, in and out). The hotel is close to a convienient store and there are places to eat all around. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Comfortable Beds!”
Reviews.Author: Donna K
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe you could walk a block and be on Bourbon Street where things are totally rocking, yet at the Dauphine it was quiet and comfy. The beds were the best we have slept in by far, including the pillows. We walked everywhere. The front desk provided us with a map and good suggestions. The continental breakfast was decent - much better than what we have had at other hotels. The coupon they give you for a free drink in the bar is a nice touch, but if you don't like smoking I would not recommmend the bar. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Such a peaceful place!”
Reviews.Author: judy3338
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe how quiet this lovely hotel was, being only a block from Bourbon Street in the French Quarter! We stayed in the Hermann House, a converted residence across from the main building. Our room opened out onto a beautiful courtyard and we believe that it was worth the extra to stay in the location. Valet parking is inside and is attended by very courteous people. Our room was very clean, with a wonderful bed. And the convenience to the French Quarter couldn't be better, with everything in walking distance. We would say that, for the money, our room was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: h2oworks2000
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans is located in a safe and convenient location in the Quarter and is fairly priced. Rates change regularly so tag it well before your trip and buy in at the right price. Our room was quiet at all times. It was clean. The beds super comfortable. Everything worked and was clean. Garage people were very helpful and courteous. Desk people were just desk people, some were polite and helpful, the women, while others were watching the clock and couldn't wait to leave. The pool is wonderful and while we were there under used. The attached May Baileys is a must go to. The hotel provides you with a complimentary drink. Jeffery, is a wealth of good information as is Lisa, the barkeeps. The bar is quiet and frequented by locals and restaurant service people after work. You might just meet the person who helped you pick out that great wine at Bayona. A great place to start your evening or have the nightcap before you saunter off to your room. Early in the morning they have an included with the cost of your room, Bagels, Waffels, Croissants, Sausage, Coffee, and the fixin's to go with them. A nice add on. You do not need a car here. Walk, take the trolley, or a taxi, to where you are going. This is a great location. Next time we visit New Orleans we will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Beds!”
Reviews.Author: 393Maria
Reviews.Content: The memory foam beds at this hotel were amazing. Quiet location even though it is right down in the french quarter. Great Location, we walked everywhere. The parking garage could be a bit noisy early in the morning if your room was on that side, but we never had an issue. Slept like a baby. Typical continental breakfast, but the belgian waffles were a pleasant surprise bonus to the cold cereals, fruit, juice, coffee, and pastries. The dining area coule use a little TLC though. Staff was helpful. Pleasant stay. Some previous reviews have mentioned the musty smell, but I only noticed it downstairs through the bar, not in the guest rooms. And hey, this is New Orleans, everything is damp all the time, you're in a swamp! Bartender was great!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: JetsetTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Labor Day weekend, first time. From the start the service was excellent, everyone was friendly and genuine. We got a room on the fourth floor, I asked for one not facing a street and the lady at the front desk had already assigned us one. The room was very clean. I noticed a bit of a musty odor but when we turned down the thermostat, the AC was able to eliminate it. As with most hotels in the French Quarter, the building's very old so this usually happens at all hotels. My only improvements to the room would be curtains over the plantation shutters which let just enough light in to wake me up too early. Also with the wonderful beds, the pillows were just so-so. The beds had extremely comfortable temperpedic mattresses. First time I've ever slept on one. Once I layed down on it I didn't want to get up.
