These beds were especially welcomed after I broke my arm at the end of a Segway tour on our second day there. After the weekend was over and I got back home, I missed the hotel bed. The housekeeping staff, especially our housekeeper was wonderful. The day after I spent the day in the room resting from the "incident" she asked about cleaning the room and was genuinely concerned about how I was feeling, as my friend had told her about my arm. She was so kind, I always forget to tip the housekeepers but I remembered this time. If I could specifically request her next time I would, though I didn't get her name. The inluded breakfast was served until 10, a little later than many hotels and there was a good variety from cereals to croisssants to hard boiled eggs and a Belgian waffle iron to make your own. First time I've seen one of those with a hotel continental breakfast. Stay away from the English Muffins though, not very good. We didn't use the complimentary beer/wine coupons we got t check in, but the don't have a date on them so we'll use them next time. At check in we were told a lot of people return them unused, not us! Even though we didn't use them on this trip. Check in and out was very quick and they were just as courteous at check out as they were at check in. I would definitely recommend staying at the Dauphine Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Charming choice in the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: RuggerDog2
Reviews.Content: Great location with plenty of character in a great location. It's really got the kind of charm that people go for in a B&B, but the amenities and service of a hotel. the location can't be beat. Right in the quarter, but in a relatively quiet nook. Have stayed there before and would stay there again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aussiewill
Reviews.Content: Great location just off Bourbon Street. Right in the centre of it all. We were on the 3rd floor at the rear and was very quiet. The rooms are a good size, the beds comfortable and everything clean. It was Southern Decadence when we were there so very busy and rained and rained and rained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Buddies Weekend Despite the rain”
Reviews.Author: AndreMcBride
Reviews.Content: This is a charming and quaint little hotel in the quieter part of the french quarter. Clean rooms, friendly staff, all of whom made me feel welcome and made my stay enjoyable. Hotel had all of the amenities I look for at a decent price. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to stay in the French quarter, but don't want to be in the heart of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you want to be close to the action but not directly in it”
Reviews.Author: redbl00m
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Dauphine for nearly a week (Mon-Fri) and were very pleased with our experience. Check-in was fast and easy, we were in our room in no time. We booked a standard double room, the room was large and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was especially nice and really spacious. The room also had two small balconies (you could set out and that was about it). Midway through our stay, our door lock was malfunctioning and the staff tried to fix it but ultimately moved us to another room (a nicer double room with a balcony overlooking the street) and were very accommodating. The pool is very, very small and can get crowded. They have a nice fitness room (also small so hope that no one is working out at the same time as you). The hotel also has a great breakfast bar full of options and afternoon tea (coffee, tea, cookies) which was a nice touch. The staff was always very friendly and very helpful. We were able to get directions to restaurants and were able to order a taxi for the morning of our departure without a problem. A note on the location: this hotel is perfect for people who want to experience the French Quarter but also don't want to be smack dab in the middle of the craziness. The Dauphine is literally one block away from Bourbon so it's easy to get there if you want a night out, but even having a room on the street, you can't hear any of the noise (which is great when you actually want to sleep at night). The neighborhood also felt pretty safe, though we didn't venture further north as the north part of the French Quarter is bordered by the housing projects. Overall, this is a great hotel that makes it convenient to experience the French Quarter (we walked everywhere) with nice touches (friendly staff, breakfast and snacks). I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: bjack830
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! Charming older property with recent updates. We stayed in the Herman House which is across the street from the main building. Very quiet and tucked away. One block over from Burbon, walking distance to all things great in the FQ. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with balcony”
Reviews.Author: DenaGayle
Reviews.Content: The double room with balcony facing Dauphine was nice. There were 3 patio chairs on the balcony. The street traffic was a little noisy but to be expected with balcony rooms. We have stayed all over the quarter and garden district and I would rate this an A- nice. The room was very clean and the bathroom was very small. Our room had a fridge so that was nice. Never ate the breakfast we ate out. Very nice restaurant on Conti towards bourbon that had b/l/d very inexpensive . It was german, the Jagerhause and it had the best inexpensive breakfast, and a great hamburger- cheap for lunch so after spending $$$ on dinner it was a nice break. Dejavue bar and grill is on the corner of Conti so we ate there- food was very good & cheap but it is a smoking bar and everyone has to be over 21 so we only ate there once due to the smoke. You will find most all bars in New Orleans are smoking bars so be prepared. We go down at least once a month and try to stay at different places every 3 months or so. I always read the reviews before I go. so I am trying to detail what I look for. You just have to remember that everything in the quarter is old and it is noisy. I always take my sound machine and a couple glasses of wine tend to lessen the noise. If you want an inexpensive but nice balcony hotel then this is it. The balcony hotels on Bourbon tend to be not so nice and very expensive and extremely noisy. Remember a lot of kids destroy those rooms during mardi gras. So when I find very clean and not torn up balcony room- it rates high...weare older so like to drink on the balcony after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: hobbitette
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in New Orleans as part of our road trip and was recommended the Dauphine Orleans. It did live up to expectations and offered good value for money. The staff were helpful and friendly. The only small annoyances were that they did charge me more for parking than I had been informed and only offered me a phone number to query this, which would probably cost more than the charge (on my mobile telephone or from the UK on return). The bottled water in the room was $2.50 a bottle(500ml) which seems outrageous for a hotel as we stayed in tiny B&Bs that were giving it away. Overall it is a good choice for all the attractions New Orleans has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike A
Reviews.Content: 1st off let me say we would stay here again. They have on site parking which is nice but it is limited and it's $30 per day plus tax. ($33.60 a day). Our room (201) was nice. It only had a full size bed. (Can't remember the last time I stayed in a hotel with a full size bad), and the room was a little noisy (balcony doors don't close tight, and over looked the motor court). It has a nice little pool with seating around. The bar (an old bordello) is very nice. It is on Dauphine St which is 1 block away from Bourbon St. That helps it be a little quieter but it is still easy to enjoy the night life.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Samtscotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week for my birthday. Our room was in the Herman house across the road from the main building and it was quiet and comfortable. Great beds and a nice little room that opened out onto the courtyard. It has a hot tub that we used and was very clean and tidy. The service staff who cleaned the room were great as was the guy who valet parked our car. My only criticism is of the front desk staff who 'welcomed us'. You guy who was rude and ineffectual. Luckily we didn't see him again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in quarter, perfect beds, great location”
Reviews.Author: firefly_stars81
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 5 nights, reserved through bookit.com The beds are phenomenal! They are Tempur-pedic beds, I've never sleep so soundly and woke up with no back pain. I promptly received the fridge requested and was pleased to see it wasn't a tiny dorm fridge. Rooms were clean, quiet, and pest-free! The staff was very friendly, car park evening employees most helpful on where to go. This hotel is one block above Bourbon, so you won't hear all that noise. I feel it's a great location for a variety of things to do in the quarter. Will definitely stay here again! (P.S. I used to work front desk at hotels, this is a comfortable and great place to stay in the quarter)

Reviews.Title: “I will totally stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Lor213
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New Orleans and it definitely won't be my last! My friend and I went to New Orleans to celebrate our 30th birthdays this past week and we stayed at the Dauphine Orleans, what a wonderful choice! This hotel has the perfect location and is only one block from Bourbon Street for those who are interested. I loved how the hotel had some history behind it and rumors of ghosts, although we didn't experience anything. Breakfast every morning was simple but great; fresh made waffles, breads, cereal, fruit, sausage, grits and yogurt. We didn't get the chance to use our free drink ticket for the bar but it was a nice welcome touch. The beds were divine!!! All the walking we did and i never once woke up with a sore back, yay for tempur-pedic beds! The valets were wonderful and extremely helpful, make sure you ask them for recommendations for dining and attractions. This will for sure be my place to stay in New Orleans for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! Stayed aug 4-7 and had the best romeantic vaca ever!! this is the perfect spot and is so nice! thanks to Nick!”
Reviews.Author: Sungi420
Reviews.Content: stay in room 306! take a dip in the pool, and ask about the hot tub across the street that is available to you!

Reviews.Title: “Jazzy Dauphine Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Vincentvangogh18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dauphine Orleans for 3 days.... the most comfortable bed I've slept in while at a hotel. Clean, and A/C worked great. 2 arrival drinks were provided upon arrival. Morning breakfast was fully stocked. 12pm check out time fit right in with our late night touring and partying in the city. It is very hot in NOLA during the month of August. The bars that lined the streets were a welcomed spot to sip on cold drinks and A/C during the day. Local shops are used to people bringing in their beers, hurricanes, etc.... they just ask if you can put them on the counter while you look at their clothes. Locals are so easy going. I guess this is why they call it "The Big Easy". Dauphine Orleans is within walking distance to everything. Will stay here again because of the comfort of the beds and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: booffy
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue and I'm glad I picked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. It certainly wasn't the cheapest and was slightly on the higher end in terms of price but I liked the location, the intimacy of the hotel due to it being smaller in size. Location is right in the middle of the french quarter so it's easy to get around the area and not too close to bourbon street if that's not your thing. I was mostly out on tours, dining or exploring new orleans during the 4 days I was there so I can't comment on the normal facilities but in general service is brisk, fast & polite. They provide free internet access in the room and if you don't have your own laptop, you can use the PC in the reception area. The room was clean, neat with a pleasant decor, I wouldn't say it was too roomy but comfortable enough. I would definitely return but when I booked this hotel, Omni Royal was more or less the same price and when I walked passed it, it exuded grandeur, so next time I'm in NOLA I might give that a shot first.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: mwalker78
Reviews.Content: I could see from the photos that it looked nice and I was not disappointed. The staff were very friendly even to the valet person. The pool area and grounds are very clean and has a historic look and feel that we loved! Beds were very comfortable and breakfast was perfect,,,waffles,sausage, etc....The ONLY thing neg I could say is the nose from the street but if you are staying in New Orleans you probably arent there for the peace and quiet anyway. Deanie's restaurant was just down the street and it was super. I would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Rach002
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Dauphine Orleans. The staff were always very courteous and when we arrived early for check-in they had no problem giving us our room straight away. We paid for the cheapest room, being on a budget, and so we had no view and were over the garage (albeit on the sixth floor so we couldn't hear the cars underneath). The room had a bit of a damp smell to it and there were niggling issues we had - the light-bulb in the main room blew as soon as we entered it and this was never fixed by housekeeping and the main accessible plug socket for the room was practically hanging off the wall so it didn't feel very safe!! Oh, and breakfast wasn't anything special. The bed was very comfortable though and I would choose to stay here again if I return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “My go to hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JenL198
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location, great room. Everything about our hotel experience was fantastic. So much charm and the staff was very accommodating. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My 2nd Time at Dauphine. Great value, location, and charm.”
Reviews.Author: mjohns7861
Reviews.Content: In March I stayed for my second time at Dauphine Orleans in a year. It is really a fantastic hotel and well located. The hotel is basically 1-2 blocks off Bourbon Street but in a very quiet area. Note my review is of the Courtyard rooms they offer. We once again stayed on the Courtyard side of the hotel - which is across the street from the main building. The room is spacious, seemingly larger due to its vault ceilings, and quite comfortable. The room had exposed old red brick on one wall and the king bed was very comfortable with quality linens. The sink area of the bathroom faces towards the bed with the toilet and shower behind a closed door - not a set-up I particularly liked but functional. The room has a mini-fridge, which is almost essential for a city like New Orleans. The room has two french doors that open into a very pleasant courtyard with a fountain. The breakfast buffet is very basic but provides all the essentials. I have not used the pool either time I have stayed here but the pool seems to be active and pleasant, albeit a bit small. Overall, from a value, location, and quality standpoint - Dauphine Orleans is one of the best things going in the city. Its a great base of operation for relaxing and touring the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Relaxing in the Heart of The French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: kegshome
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay close to French Quarter activity, yet have a peaceful retreat with old-time New Orelans charm, this is the place for you. The staff is welcoming & accommodating. If you don't require all the nuances of a modern facilty - you'll love this place. The bar/lounge is an unexpected retreat and the courtyard(s) are well tended. Walking distance to Bourbon Street, Trolley lines, and great music, shopping and people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Loved our Herman House Room!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CoopJen
Reviews.Content: Last week of March 2011. My hubby and I decided it was about time we visited NOLA! So I spent about 3 weeks reaching and reading reviews about the city, where to stay, where to eat, what to do, etc. I decided on the Dauphine Orleans Hotel...The Herman House....because of some of the great reviews I read. All i can say is that we LOVED LOVED LOVED our room and the whole vibe of the Herman House (its across the street from the actual hotel...very safe and private). I requested room on the 2nd floor (#238 to be exact) and away from the street. It was perfect. After a long drive from Ohio, our check-in was a breeze thanks to Becky at the reception desk. As as soon was we crossed the street to the Herman House, we knew me made the right choice. We loved the exposed wood and brick on the inside of our room. Really gave it a cool feel. Our room was very clean, smelled great and was quite and dark. Loved it!!!!! The bed was SUPER Comfy...no joke! The complimentary breakfast was very good. The onsite parking garage was a nice feature and Paul in the garage was awesome! He always asked if we needed directions, told us to have a good time, asked us how or days was when we returned. Truly a great guy! All in All....we truly enjoyed our NOLA trip. We spent 4 days total in the French Quarter....we walked around everywhere. The hotels location is PERFECT. Close to everything but far enough away so that the chaos and noise don't follow you home at night. :-0 Check out my pictures and all my other reviews about our trip (places we ate, things we did, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Great location right off bourbon”
Reviews.Author: cajun1882
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in New Orleans for my birthday. We stayed at Dauphne Orleans and it was great. The beds are comfortable and the location is close enough to walk to everything without the noise of bourbon street. Small but very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, peaceful, charming”
Reviews.Author: Dybis
Reviews.Content: Totally loved the Dauphine. Cozy, romantic, great service. Nicely decorated rooms, nice pool area, romantic courtyards and gardens and a terrific bar. One street off Bourbon but you would never know it. Peaceful. Rooms across the main building which I got to see are even more secluded with exposed bricks and wooden beamed ceilings with an even more private courtyard. Perfect place for a honeymmon or a romantic getaway. Good for business too as well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rizan22
Reviews.Content: Loved the Dauphine - for the price and location (1 block from Bourbon St.) its and excellent value. Very comfy beds/pillows, nice room decor, great quite location (except for room being over garage), breakfast was fine and the bar area was really cozy - was told thats all furnishings are original and this used to be bordello! Reception and bell people very nice and helpful. Only complaint was housekeeping did not replenish coffee and cups, had to call receptions but, they did have them up in mere minutes. So all in all an excellent experience. I would definitely recommend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: cabenner
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Tempurpedic mattress was probably the only bonus to the room, but it's a fairly standard hotel room - you don't travel for the rooms. We had a problem that was reported to the front desk twice, and was never resolved. But other than that the stay was nice, friendly staff, the pool is small but clean, and the breakfast was nothing fancy but was good. We left the fan running in the bathroom at night to combat noise in the hall and garage.

Reviews.Title: “cant beat it”
Reviews.Author: TimboTexan
Reviews.Content: other than a few cars honking outside this place in the morning..it is a gem. great price, superb location, friendly staff and nice comp breakfast. this will be our new orleans spot.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: librarychick
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here 3 nights in a room with a shared balcony (that we always had to ourselves) overlooking Dauphine Street. The room was larger than I had anticipated-not huge, but I was expecting small and besides the beds there was a nice armchair and large desk. Fridge in room, Tempurpedic mattresses, plush towels, high quality pillows and comforter. I was worried about it being loud based on previous reviews and it was a little, but only from the too early garbage trucks, not the staff and not people on the streets. Valets were great. Front staff was efficient although not very personable. Housekeeping was excellent. Parking was expensive but par for the course in the Quarter. Pool was nice-not too small and never crowded, good temp, and high end outdoor furniture. Satisfying continental breakfast with loads of fresh fruit. Location, one block from Bourbon, was excellent. No complaints-we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: travguy
Reviews.Content: Good value summer package, excellent location,comfortable clean bed and adequate breakfast. What more could I want? Possibly only that the front desk staff knew a little more about the area!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Location”
Reviews.Author: VailErika
Reviews.Content: This is not my first time staying at Dauphine. The hotel is one street away from Bourbon, so it's a little quieter. The rooms are standard hotel rooms, but they have a nice little pool. The breakfast is great every morning. And they also give you drink tickets for the bar when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Ingram-Stahl
Reviews.Content: I will confess I am a bit of a hotel snob especially when it comes to service. We stayed at the hotel 5 nights and had to fight to have our room made up for 2 days in a row! It is not like we awoke at 0900 and expected the room made up while we had breakfast . . . on our trips my wife and I typically leave the hotel early in the morning and do not get back until early afternoon (around 1430) for a "siesta" before enjoying the evening. The final straw, for me, was when we were told the maid was on a break and we would need to allow her to finish sometime in the next 2 hours! Apparently, you cannot request your room to be made up early but it is up to the maids to clean each room as they choose. They clean from 0800 to 1700 . . . I have never heard of such a loose schedule in a quality hotel . . . I realize this is New Orleans and we must laissez le bon temp rouler but for me a good time is getting good service when paying for it.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: standingwatch
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! In a great location. The staff was outstanding. The bar was very nice with outstanding service from the bartender. The valet parking is a little over priced. But well worth it. The only thing wrong. I went a person who does not understands the culture, people, history and beauty of New Orleans. I'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ekimoh
Reviews.Content: I stay in lots og hotels and rarely am I impressed at this level. First of all it's well located, secondly it neat, unique and a nice place to stay. Upgrade to a balcony room, it's worth it. The breakfast is basic but adequate. The only downside is they smoke in the bar. But as there are more bars per area than almost anywhere else in the world within metres of the hotel, it didn't matter. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Many Issues”
Reviews.Author: jennybento
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Location: It's close to Bourbon and close to Canal, but quiet. Property: Pretty! Courtyard is nice, everything was new. Breakfast: Decent! TV Stations: Pretty large variety THE BAD: Service: The maids leave VERY early, so if you sleep late, there'll be none. I had to wait a very long time for the front desk person to show up when I checked in. We had a problem in our room with our TV and I called them to fix it, which they said they would. They did not. Shower: We were in room 212 I think? It was a handicapped room. We did not ask for a handicapped room. The shower was not really suitable for a non-handicapped person as the head was at my chest level (and I am 5'6"). There was no bathtub. Noise: The handicapped room is located right next to some employees only section. I don't know what's stored there but it involves a lot of moving things around loudly. Every morning at exactly 6:29AM, the tv went off at FULL BLAST. We have no idea how that happened or how to change it, but the staff said they'd fix it and it was not fixed. Pool: The pool looks way larger on the website. it's pretty small. I've only been in a saltwater pool on a cruise ship and this was definitely not salty like seawater (as that was). It was also kind of dirty--stuff floated in it. It was usually very crowded and although it's tiny it would have been okay for laps if people hadn't been in it.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: CAB062709
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dauphine on our first trip to New Orleans and we couldn't have been more pleased. We stayed in the Hermann House and our room was wonderful...comfortable bed, balcony overlooking the street, and great decor. The location is PERFECT...close to everything but far enough away so that the noise is not as much of an issue (we did have some street noise since our balcony overlooked the street but it wasn't enough to deter us from going back). We will definitely be staying here on our next trip to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: ColinInHants
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews I feel we stayed in the same room as DallasTxTravel but with a different experience, perhaps we're just heavier sleepers? Granted it was annoying having to negotiate our way around the pool users to get to our room but aprt from that there were no issues of noice or nuisance. I found the hotel's location to be superb only one block from Bourbon but amazingly quiet. Staff were really helpful and although the wobbly shower tap's still wobbly it was fixed within 10mins of us raising it with the front desk. Only real letdown was breakfast where the amount of hot food on offer was extremely limited and variety wasn't great, I like American breakfasts hence only 3*.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeaStone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Dauphine Orleans for one week and it was the most relaxing, comfortable and accommodating travel experience ever, and my husband and I travel quite a bit. The service is impeccable, the rooms are super clean and cozy, the bathroom was enormous and so was the bed. The staff are so friendly and you'll always get a warm greeting whenever you pass one of them. The best part about the hotel is May Baileys, the attached pub that used to be a bordello. When you walk through those doors, you're whisked away to times past. It's just so charming and historic and the bartenders will talk the night away with you. The free breakfast is great â€”Â cereal, hard boiled eggs, lots of fresh fruit, yoghurt, croissants, bagels, toast, make-it-yourself waffles, coffee, tea, etc. It'll be your healthiest meal of the day in New Orleans, so fill up! :) The pool is lovely (salt water) and so is the courtyard, with lots of space to chill and unwind after a long day. There's even a fabulous fitness room just off the courtyard for those who are keen on keeping up with their routine. What's the fun in that, though? Oh, and what makes this place really shine is that it's a two minute walk from all the action. It's located in the heart of the French Quarter on such a beautiful street. You seriously can not ask for a more prime location. Two minute walk to Bourbon for those who like to party and two minute walk to St. Peter Street (Where Preservation Hall and Pat O'Brian's is) and two minutes from Decatur and Royal Street, Jackson Square, etc, etc.. you get the picture. Fabulous place, super affordable and such character and charm! Book this hotel and you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cosy”
Reviews.Author: pinkturquoise
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel walking distance to everything. Staff very helpful. Breakfast good. Little bar attached to Hotel very quaint and cosy. Beds super comfortable. Room size very large. Lighting could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: shenmebby
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 4th floor,everything was going great a housekepper was on duty she was doing a pretty good,but her supervisor insisted her to work harder her supervisor yelled & yelled for no apparent reason as I stood there & watched walking up the hall the young housekeeper was pregnant the supervisor made her clean me & my husband's room over after we told her we didn't want service,I know this is none of my business but I think its real wrong for someone to be on someones back like that the young gril wasn't even able to get her work done without the supervisor in her ear it was an elderly lady who was the supervisor,but overall my stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy restful sleep while on vacation? Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: DallasTxTravel
Reviews.Content: I don't like to write reviews on online sites, but my experience with this supposedly great hotel was so awful, I had to share it with others to give a balanced view with the other opinions of this hotel. I'll start with the positive things about this hotel: - Price for the French Quarter is pretty good, especially the mid-week rates. - Location is wonderful - it is centrally located in the French Quarter and most everything we wanted to do and see in the Quarter was within good walking distance. - Canal and St. Louis line streetcar stops were very close by. Here are the negative things: - Noise, noise, and more noise. Now, I've stayed in other French Quarter hotels before, even on right on Bourbon, and this hotel was MUCH worse. We stayed for 5 nights, and didn't get through one night without being woken up by loud, drunken, raucous shouting and laughing. That, combined with guests AND staff dragging metal-framed outdoor furniture across the bricks surrounding the pool throughout the night, equaled terrible sleep conditions. Turns out that the hotel bar allows customers to hang out by the pool whether they are guests of the hotel or not, making the tiny pool courtyard an extremely popular, extremely noisy hangout until dawn. - Customer service was lacking. On the last night of our stay, as we were trying to fall asleep amid the noise, we suddenly caught the scent of something burning. We briefly investigated our room and balcony, determined it was not cigarette smoke, and then called the front desk to report the smell. The lady on the line first insisted it was cigarette smoke wafting up from the courtyard. I told her that no, it definitely was NOT cigarette smoke, and she then said she would send the "engineer" to come check it out. We waited outside of our room (which has a full view of the pool courtyard) for said engineer to arrive. We waited 30 minutes and no one came. By that time were we so exasperated with our entire stay, we decided to go back to sleep (as best as we could with the noise) and leave early the next morning. - Complimentary newspaper that the hotel's website claims is delivered to your door each morning was nowhere to be seen. - Hotel also claims to be "fully non-smoking," but that must not include the courtyard areas, where guests and bar hoppers can smoke all they want, and where we had to consciously avoid stepping on cigarette butts as we made our way to and from our room each day. - Plumbing in our room's bathroom could desperately use updating. It was hard to get hot water in the shower, not because there wasn't any available (easily got hot water out of the sink), but because the shower knob was loose/broken. Bathroom also smelled moldy and dank. We were afraid to use the tub Jacuzzi because it looked moldy and unhygienic. Mold in the grout and growing on the shower curtain - gross! Overall, this hotel was one of the worst we've stayed in. I cannot recommend it and I wish I had chosen a different hotel for our stay. While its location was awesome, and the price was affordable, I'd have been willing to pay more to stay somewhere cleaner, quieter, and more relaxing on my vacation. Hotelâ€™s website claims it is an â€œunforgettable hotelâ€� â€“ boy, thatâ€™s for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine Orleans Hotel is a must stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: PhxTraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: Five friends and I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel while celebrating our milestone birthdays. We chose the Dauphine Orleans based on our desire to stay in the French Quarter and on Trip Advisor recommendations. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. The location of the hotel, within walking distance of everything we wanted to experience (and eat) in the French Quarter as well as access to public transportation, was ideal. The rooms were large, nicely furnished, and had very comfortable beds. The breakfast buffet included in our room rate had enough variety to satisfy all of us. A glass of wine in the onsite bar was a nice way to finish each of the delightful days we spent in New Orleans. The frosting on this french pastry of a hotel was the customer service. The desk clerk we primarily dealt with was the epitome of excellent customer service. And, all this at a reasonable rate!

Reviews.Title: “This is It-My Permanent Home Base in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: dgl20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our 7th trip to New Orleans. We've always stayed in different hotels and areas to get the total feeling of this great city. This time, though, we wanted to stay right in the middle of the French Quarter again. After checking out other TA reviews and pictures, decided on the Dauphine Orleans-that's it! No more searching for us-whenever we come back, we are staying here! From our first communication with sales to the hotel manager all employees were great. the bellmen courteous and helpful, front desk always ready with a smile and willing to help answer any and all needs. The hotel manager even took time to show us the cottages a block away-that's how proud he is of this hotel! We opted to stay across the street at the Hermann House and were able to get our first three nights in the balcony room overlooking Dauphine Street. It is by far, the coolest room in which we have stayed. There is street noise in the early hours, but we expected it. There are quieter rooms in the back of the courtyard. Other reviews complain about the noise from the garage-my suggestion-talk to the management,don't stew over it. If they can do something, they will. Our last night, we moved across the street to the main hotel as this room was reserved already, but management went out of their way to make sure our accommodations were great. we got a third floor room with 2 balconies! Once again, the management 's goal was to make sure our stay was the best it could be. The location as stated in many other reviews is one short block off of Bourbon St. We always felt safe walking around the area.(hey, you're in the middle of the French Quarter,just be aware of your surroundings). Next time down, we may opt for the cottages which are unbelievable-a totally different experience but you won't go wrong anywhere at the Dauphine. This is the first review I have written. That's how highly I feel about the Dauphine. Thanks for making our week in Nola so great. We will see you again!

Reviews.Title: “A few quirks, but great hotel all-around”
Reviews.Author: scrg06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans for four days this past Easter weekend with my husband and another couple. We chose the Dauphine based on a combination of the low price and the high ratings, and we were very pleased with our choice. We booked the reservation on Expedia and pre-paid for the trip to guarantee a double bed room. We arrived late at night due to our flight being delayed, and the person at the desk let us know that they no longer had any double bed rooms due to overbooking, so they upgraded us to one of their cottages. We only got to stay in Cottage 5 for one night, which was a complete tease because it was incredible! Stashed away in a lovely courtyard with a semi-private pool, high ceilings, a big private patio, TVs in every room, big jacuzzi bathtubs, and probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Getting into that bed after a long day of traveling was like heaven. There were two bedrooms so both couples got some unexpected privacy that night, which was great. The next day we were moved to a regular double room located on the third floor overlooking the street (Room 318). Since Dauphine Street is one block north from Bourbon, it was relatively quiet, and we never had any issues with street noise waking us up. We had a great balcony with three chairs and a table that we unfortunately never had time to take advantage of. It would have been nice if the guys had been able to sit out there and smoke cigars, but the hotel understandably asked us not to, so we didn't. The room was very elegantly decorated, as nice as any other hotel room in its class. Everything was clean and pretty. We loved the bar, May Bailey's, and the people at the front desk kept giving us tons of drink tickets so we spent a good amount of time there (their hurricanes are really good, as well as their St Germain). The pools and courtyards were always nice and clean (and well shaded, which was nice during the hot days). Every staff member was incredibly nice and helpful and we never had a bad experience with any employee. The hotel had FREE WIRELESS INTERNET, which was high quality and fast (and not often found at nicer hotels, oddly enough). The free breakfast was an unexpected perk and it was really really good. There was a waffle-maker, lots of pastries (we loved all the fresh croissants), sausage (which looked gross but actually tasted amazing), hard-boiled eggs, oranges and apples, yogurt, a small collection of cereals (mostly healthy cereals, nothing kid-friendly like Fruit Loops or Frosted Flakes), and a variety of drink options. Everything was refilled quickly so it was always warm, and there were plenty of tables to sit at. We went every morning and loved it. We have a few complaints, but they are minor ones. The beds were not very comfortable. Maybe we were just spoiled by the amazing beds in the cottage, but the ones in the hotel rooms were hard as a rock - almost literally. They used those memory foam mattresses, but not the soft cushy ones, the really firm ones that barely have any give to them. They also don't breathe very well, so we all got very hot at night, despite the AC being as low as it could possibly go. We all slept well regardless, but after reading reviews about how great the beds were, I was disappointed. We also had an issue with our TV remote not working properly. We wanted to order a movie one night, and we were unable to do so because the remote in the room didn't have the appropriate buttons. We called the front desk and they brought us a different remote, but that one didn't work either, and the staff member messed with it for awhile but didn't know what else to do so we just watched regular TV. A minor annoyance, but it did take up an hour of our night trying to figure out. The cold water in the faucet did not work very well. It came out as a trickle, with no ability to adjust the flow. A bit frustrating when brushing our teeth, but otherwise not a big deal. We did, however, love that there was always an abundance of hot water. All four of us would shower each day and there was still plenty of hot water to go around. The area around the hotel is not the best. We saw a few shady characters hanging around that street when walking back late at night. Generally, as a tourist, you want to stay between Bourbon and the river, and the Dauphine is one block off Bourbon on the other side of the river. It's not that it's a high crime area, it's just much quieter and more secluded than other streets, so there's more of an opportunity for someone to do you harm without being seen. If you're traveling alone you might feel more comfortable staying in more of a highly populated area. As I said, these are all very small complaints. In general, we really liked the hotel and we would definitely stay there again if the price was right. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: motes3
Reviews.Content: I dont think I could say enough about this hotel, we loved it!! The rooms were great, beds amazing, everything was perfect.. Everyone was so nice and helpful and the hotel is very well taken care of.. Cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & comfortable - but lousy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: skeeterbait
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans has the European feel of an aging boutique hotel being given life-support from an American hotel management corporation. Yin and Yang. Friendly and personable staff but terribly long & inefficient check-in because the electronic card-key machine malfunctioned (AGAIN, we were told). Clean & comfortable, but small. Quiet location one block from raunchy all night Bourbon Street with a cute balcony but all night car alarms and revelry of street drunks contradicted the advertised "serenity" and made closed windows essential (no jazz wafting through our windows as they claim). The hotel's location turned out to be a relatively long walking distance from restaurants, shopping, jazz clubs, streetcars, & exploration compared to other locations. "Deluxe continental breakfast" means cold cereal, muffins, instant grits, or instant oatmeal in a styrofoam bowl & coffee/ tea in a styrofoam cup. Our "fresh fruit" included old, moldy strawberries. Breakfast was nothing at all like the china & wine glass pictured on their web-site! Friendly staffers told me things were better when the hotel was family run for 40 years but now a hotel corporation has taken over with a new ball-game . Overall: friendly & pleasant place to stay, relatively far from sights, poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific atmosphere and location, good value”
Reviews.Author: An0nym0us555
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what I was looking for and just what I expected based on previous postings I read. I was looking for a romantic property with great character in the French Quarter. We stayed 4 nights (Th-Sun) in room 105, which I requested upon check-in after doing some research. The front desk personnel were very helpful and accommodating. The room was great. It had a huge, corner jacuzzi tub (that worked great) along with a small shower in the separate toilet area. The room was spacious but not huge. It had a vaulted ceiling with exposed beams. There was no room above us, but the exercise room was adjacent (very few folks actually used the exercise room). The king bed was very comfortable. There was a small refrigerator and a key-operated safe. Water bottles were available but would incur a $3 charge each. I found the tap water more than adequate to drink, although I'm not really particular about that. The closet was quite small, and luckily my guy let me use all the hangers. I brought 2 sets of clothes for each day of our 4-day stay, as well as 3 swimsuits, 4 pairs of shoes and tons of toiletries, and I found the storage drawers to be too few and too small for my needs, but I made them work (again, I have to thank my guy for letting me have all but two of the drawers). I think there were a total of 10 small drawers between the night tables and the TV console area. The room looks to be recently renovated with marble counters and tile in the bathroom. There are wall mirrors in the bathroom area, as well. The area with the sink (there is only one sink, but plenty of counter space for all my junk) and jacuzzi is a part of the main room and does not offer privacy. The toilet and shower are in a private area with a pocket door that does not lock (that door was a little tricky to open and close; you have to lift it a little bit as you pull it closed and push it open). There was also a desk of reasonable size with a chair and a mirror. I found that area too dark to use as a vanity, though. The sink area has great lighting. The room also had a comfortable chair w/ottoman. The door to the room was actually french-style doors that had plantation shutters as well as decorative outdoor shutters. The other window had wide-slat wood blinds. This room is in the Carriage House area, which is just behind the front desk area; you have to walk past the pool to get to the room. The area with the pool and the Carriage House courtyards is cozy. If you happen to be the only one using it, you will love it. When you add other folks to "cozy" areas, however, their presence can feel intrusive. While I expected that at the pool, I didn't really expect that feeling while sitting in the courtyard drinking my coffee in the morning. It turns out that the entrance to the breakfast/coffee area is in the Carriage House area, so everyone had to walk past our room (and through the courtyard area) to get breakfast. That setup added some noise and detracted from the feeling of privacy I was hoping for. However, it was not bad, and everyone who was staying at the hotel during the time we were there was quiet and considerate. This room is very close to the pool. There were a couple of vending machines with sodas and snacks on the 2nd floor of the main house, but that was the only food available in the hotel outside of breakfast times. The breakfast offered several selections of cold cereals, instant oatmeal, yogurt cups, fresh fruit salad, bananas, oranges, apples, bagels, english muffins, croissants, mini-muffins and make-your-own waffles. There was also coffee, hot tea, milk, OJ, apple juice. A couple of days, there were breakfast sausage patties and hard-boiled eggs. The expected condiments were also available. Of course, the location was fabulous. The sounds of Bourbon street DID creep in at times, but they did not keep us from sleeping. I thought this was a great property!

Reviews.Title: “great value/pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grandbob&grandmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my teenaged granddaughter and it was perfect. Good location (not on Bourbon St), staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice pool for late afternoons. Quiet at night. The breakfast is mediocre, middle US motel quality, but there are always the French Market beignets out there if one wants a good breakfast. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Group Get-Together”
Reviews.Author: FGScott
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans was just perfect for this college friends' get-together. As the organizer for this every 4 year event (to a different city each time), the staff, before and during, could not have been more helpful. We all agreed the beds were about the most comfortable hotels beds any of us have slept in. Great location and with its own little bar was a great place to congregate and catch up on old times. Look forward to returning some day.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be back”
Reviews.Author: wrfoxx
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was not pleasurable at all, I know they call New Orleans the city that never sleeps, but I do like to sleep in while on vacation. Our room was located over the parking garage, not sure what they are doing down there but around 6:00 am you will be woke up by very loud noices, sounds as if they are dropping about 10 dumpsters, as well as very loud talking employees, they seem to not care about their sleeping guest at all. I thought I would give the hotel the beneifit of a doubt and not base my opinion on that, The next morning the same thing, very loud between 6:00 am and 6:30 . The air conditioner rattled so bad every time it came on, I was awaken so many times by this, I was about to give up sleep at this hotel at all. I have stayed at various hotels in the french quarter and I have never taken my own bags to my room, which is not really that big of a deal to do so, but the bell hops in the french quarter in my mind have always been known for their hospitility, Not at this hotel. The bellsman acted very rude and aggitated, there was a couple of elderly people in the lobby with luggage asking the clerk for some help with their luggage, she told them to talk to the bellsman and he would help them, at this point the bellsman walked in the lobby and the clerk asked him to help with the guest with their luggage, he replied I'll help anyone who needs help as he walked out the door, with the clerk steadly calling him back. He did not return.I also received an online coupon for $25.00 off a night, in which I presented to the desk clerk at the time of check in, she informed me that was a bogus coupon and does not know why it is still circulating. The website does not mention there is a $30.00 charge per day for parking. The rooms were very clean, but the pictures on the website make this hotel look a lot better than it really does. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone nor will I ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting, but still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: whytelightnin2
Reviews.Content: First of all, the Dauphine actually owns several properties in addition to its main location. Based on other reviewers' pictures, I expected a small boutique hotel, but the Dauphine Orleans main property is really about 100 rooms. It has a parking garage attached to it, which I suppose would be convenient if you need a place to park, but that detracted from the historic ambience somewhat for me. We arrived around midnight and the staff were waxing the floors by the front desk with a noisy machine. Our room was on the fourth floor overlooking the garage. So my first impressions were not great, but it was actually quite nice. The room was large, clean, and had an especially comfortable bed. There was a beautiful courtyard with a pool and some outdoor seating. May Bailey's bar was charmingly old fashioned (though the wine list is somewhat lacking). The breakfast spread was pretty decent as well. And while it's only one tiny block away from the all-night vomit fest on Bourbon Street, Dauphine Street is very quiet at night. I would the Dauphine Orleans to a friend. If we return, I think we'll try to stay at the Hermann House or Audubon Cottages, which are the historic properties that the hotel owns. I'd recommend checking out the various options at the Dauphine before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Betty370
Reviews.Content: Arrived Sunday early morning, transfer from another hotel. Our room was not ready yet but early 9:00 a.m. I was particular about where I wanted our room to be. Wanted a quiet room and not above parking garage. First room was above parking garage, called and said did not want this room. They were bringing up our bags. Went back down. Finally figured out a room which was #426. It was street side but not above parking garage. Told us that there would be noise anyway with cars, garbage trucks etc, but we slept well. Some noise but to be expected in NO. They were very accommodating in helping us with the room. May Bailey's is quite a nice bar. Used to be a bordello. We used our coupons for the free drinks. You can only get beer or wine, which was just fine. One night we saw one of the musicians from Steamboat Willie going in there and he said this place was his hang-out when he was done playing. Around the corner from the bar is the breakfast room. It is nice size with plenty of tables. Breakfast consisted of sausage, make your own waffles, boiled eggs, croissants, bagels, pastries, cold cereal, apples, yogurt, oranges, bananas, juice, milk, coffee and tea and fresh fruit salad cantaloupe, strawberries, honey dew. You can get coffee and tea all day. You can eat inside or outside. Depending on the day of the week, I would get there early in the morning. Fresh fruit especially would run out and have to be refreshed. There is tea and cookies in the afternoon. Worked out great for us. We never went out for breakfast and we had early tours booked so we did not have to worry about going out and finding something for breakfast. We could eat outside, read and relax. Saved money for lunch and dinner. We were in main hotel, which is sort of a maze. The pool is not heated and is small, but salt water and very clean. There were people in it. There are tables and lounge chairs. Sometimes at night we would sit outside with our drinks. The staff was very nice and helped us whenever asked. You can print your airplane tickets on the computer in the lobby. Lobby is not big but remember this is an old building. Beds were good. We asked for a blanket as comforter was too heavy for us and maid brought it the next day. We had a safe. No refrigerator. There was shampoo and conditioner and a hair dryer. Our room was very clean. No complaints with the room. If you step outside in front of hotel is Bayona Restaurant. Go to the right and you find Louisiana Bistro, down a little farther Le Chateau LeMoyne and further down Deanies Seafood. Around the corner on the right is Deja Vu Restaurant on Conti. Dive bar open 24/7 with good food. Don't be afraid to go in there. Next to that is Jagerhaus. If you want a side street to walk up after dark, try Conti. Pretty well lite. Prince Conti Hotel is there, Broussard's Restaurant, a great little bar Erin Rose, stop in and have a drink there. Very friendly. One street off Bourbon but very quiet. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ambiance, Service, History, Comfort”
Reviews.Author: AJMF
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on Dauphine Street on the north side of the French Quarter, this boutique hotel was a great find. It is dripping with history, the main building dating to the 1700s -- John James Audubon was said to have lived here (many of his bird painitings decorate the walls throughout.) There is a lovely courtyard with a small pool. Dauphine Street itself is very quiet. However, at night, some of the raucous music can be heard from Bourbon Street, which is the next street over. The staff were very helpful, the continental breakfast quite nice. Our room was in the main building and had a king bed. The bathroom was spacious. The room and bathroom were a little dark, but overall everything was great. After all -- it is not a spanking new mass produced hotel, but a very old building with lots of character!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans charm at its finest”
Reviews.Author: pattygdev
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to New Orleans and the first I stayed at the Sheraton on Canal St. Where it was a chain I knew what I'd be getting so when friends of mine booked the Dauphine and asked my fiance and I to come along I was a little skeptical. I have NOT one complaint and neither does my fiance. This place has so much to offer (great drinks, great pool, GREAT beds, and loads of charm. If you want to stay somewhere a little quieter than Bourbon and off the beaten path this is the place to go. Also I know that some of the reviews and the hotels website does mention ghostly experiences. I am the largest scaredy-cat out there and didn't know about this until after I booked the hotel. Some strange things definitely happened (random knocking on our door, a picture I took in the bar came out purple, my friend saw a shadow walk by her) but NOTHING made me feel uneasy or scared. I actually ended up looking for things and talking with the bartender and front desk staffs about it. All I have left to say is STAY HERE... it's no Ritz Carlton but it is amazing. One more tip when you check in they will give a complimentary drink ticket for your stay but if you go down everyday and ask for one they will be more than happy to accommodate.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but getting a little tired looking”
Reviews.Author: deb6869
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to NOLA about every other year. This was our third stay at Dauphine Orleans. We always stay in the rooms across the streed from the hotel because they are quite in the morning and we can sleep in. The only exception was our first night. At 5:00 AM in the morning, a young couple who was staying in the room above us decide to have a knock down drag out fight that lasted over an hour. I called the desk and they came over and the noise did get better. We did not hear anything else for our stay. That is no fault of the hotels. Our room had a bad smell to it at times that I had not noiticed on our other trips. The carpet was dirty and the place just wasn't up to par as our previos visits. But the thing I love most is that the beds are always so comfortable. We stay out late and sleep in and it's nice to get into a comfy bed with nice linens. The staff at the front desk are just ok. Not super friendly and not rude, just kind of there. It was a good stay, but the hotel needs some sprucing up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Decent Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DugMan
Reviews.Content: think the 'check in' process is what tainted my view of this hotel. We called the hotel a few days before we left to see if it was 'OK' if we arrived earlier than 3 to check in, they said it was no problem, they would have rooms available. We arrived at approx 1:30pm and tried to check in, no rooms available. I can understand, actual check in time is 3(ish?), we we're told rooms would be available around 3:15; so we left our bags and went walking. We booked a walking tour which we had to meet back at 4pm, so we returned to the hotel at 3:30 to check in and change/leave. Upon our arrival, the check in line was out the door. After waiting for 15 or so minutes in line, and having every person ahead of us check in, we were told no rooms were available. I explained our situation, and we were told we could use the bathroom to change in... The girl at the desk was never rude, it was just a bad situation that was not her fault, so we left for our tour without changing or checking in. We returned from our tour at approximately 8pm. There were only 2 people ahead of us, but it still took another 15 minutes to get checked in. While we were checking in, a young woman in a wheel chair came into the lobby (visibly upset) and told them that had given her a room that is only accessible by stair. The girl behind the desk told her she didn't know what she could do, she wasn't showing any other rooms available. I don't know how the situation was resolved, but it seems like the hotel needs to revist/revamp their check in and booking system. The room was OK, nothing amazing, the lights were a little weird; 5 adjustable knobs that controlled 2 lights each. My wife complained it was bad for putting on make-up. The location is great, one street off Bourbon, and equal distance from Canal Street and Jackson Square. Overall, I don't know if there is anything wrong with this hotel, as I said before, I think the check in tainted my opinion; but I don't think I will be returning. I think this would be a good hotel for a group of people who are just looking to party and pass out somewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, cosy, clean hotel with great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jilebee
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but very comfortable. We were on the third floor which may explain why we never had a noise problem. The beds are super comfortable (I am very picky about beds) and the bedding is cleaner than in a lot of higher end hotels I've been to. The bathroom is also small but clean and perfectly serviceable, with a shower that was NOT one of those weak trickles you get at a lot of hotels. The staff at the front desk, both in the morning and evening, were friendly. Breakfast is generous (others here have listed the items). For tea drinkers, this is the best I've had in the US because the hot water dispenser has a "boil" button which means you don't have to suffer the luke warm tea you get in most places. We didn't try the pool (too cold), but the area around it in the courtyard, though tiny, was quite cosy. There's free wifi. Across the street is a restaurant called Bayona or something like that, which has some of the most delicious food. Another restaurant we liked was Red Fish Grill. The hotel has a wonderful location, close to everything in the French Quarter. Though we had no time to go on any tours, we saw the front desk people being very helpful to other guests about arranging tours. I would gladly go back to this affordable, cosy hotel. I think the place would also be family friendly. We saw several families with small children at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at Dauphine Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: millisynth
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, and this trip my partner and I opted for a full suite in the Herrman House, across the road from the main hotel. We got room 243 which is the entire upper floor of a lone standing house. The steps up to the room were sloping and a bit of a concern, and probably not the best for any elderly (or similar) guests. The suite was huge, but dont expect The Hilton. It has character and is lowly lit, which suited the atmosphere of the place. The suite contained a large sitting room, a wet bar with fridge and small sink, a large bedroom with King sized bed, and ensuite. A flat screen TV was located in the bedroom and one in the sitting room. The maid service during our stay was very good and when we requested that the fridge be cleaned, it was attended to promptly. The location is excellent as it is right in the heart of the French Quarter, close to Bourbon Street. Everything is in easy walking distance. The free continental breakfast (served at Mae Baileys across the street) was always tasty with good tea and coffee. We got to share a cab back to the airport which cost about $17 each.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cozy, Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Minnesota123
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for Mardi Gras and stayed in this hotel for four days. We had a very positive experience with this hotel and would definitely recommend it. -The room was very clean. -For an old building, everything worked really well: good water temperature and pressure, no leaks. -Very comfy bed. -Pretty quiet - yes, it was Mardi Gras and there were sirens galore outside and drunk people in the halls occasionally. But we were surprised at how quiet and serene it was in our room. -Friendly, helpful front desk staff and bell man. -Great location. -Cozy hotel bar. -Free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, small, clean, great location, good price, friendly, know the drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: MRoss849
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans is a quaint (and somewhat small) hotel located one block SW of Bourbon Street. It's a GREAT location â€“ except that navigating New Orleans (referred to by locals as NOLA) by car can be a nightmare if you don't have GPS and/or a good map. You have to deal with narrow one-way streets which are either under construction or poorly maintained, sometimes requiring U-turns to get where you're going. Except on the Interstates, don't expect traffic direction signs â€“ New Orleans is about as informative to drivers as Boston, and sometimes street-name signs are missing, unreadable, or rotated by a prankster. Keep in mind that NOLA is expensive. Rooms at the Dauphine are comparatively reasonable, so the "value" in staying there is by comparison to other hotels in the area. The Dauphine was, by the way, booked when we arrived, so make reservations early. The main building is U-shaped. To the SE of the main building, there are a somewhat smallish pool, a patio, and additional first floor rooms. The buffet food area is off the SE pool area. We had four rooms on the 2nd floor, SW wing. Rooms are sufficiently spacious, and there is no difficulty moving about the room. In addition to two queen-size beds (in our rooms), there is a desk & chair, night table, and TV stand with drawers. The bathrooms are average size, with a tub/shower. Water is hot enough, but not as hot as in upscale hotels. There are the typical amenities, such as hair dryer, shampoo/conditioner/bodygel bottlettes. They also provide a $2.99 thinish monogramed bathrobe, which you can keep for $39. Also available are 79Â¢ bottles of water which cost you $3 if opened (or which you can get from the vending machine for $1.50). The rooms were CLEAN, and we are picky about that. I wouldn't eat off the floors, but then I wouldn't do that at a 5-star, either. The beds are comfortable, but not plush. The mattresses appear to be some kind of firm foam, slightly on the firm side. There were four foam-filled (not solid foam) pillows per bed (not much of a problem for a feather-pillow lover). Sheets were slightly thinnish (i.e., not high quality), but comfortable enough. When it comes to quiet, you have to understand the environs and layout. On the 2nd floor, even-numbered rooms from 202-212 face a back alley, have no view worth seeing, and are quiet â€“ ideal for people who want to sleep. Even-numbered rooms 214-224 face Dauphine Street, which has traffic, but there are usually no loud parties along the street - not too bad for people who want to sleep. Odd-numbered rooms face each other, and the parking area below. The parking crew (which appear to be there 24/7) can be a bit raucous, and unless you are a very sound sleeper, you may find sleeping to be a challenge. All the rooms have tiny balconies (except 207 and its opposite - 217, I think), which open onto a spacious "community" balcony. There are 4 floors, and I believe the 3rd and 4th floor layouts are identical to the 2nd floor. First floor rooms are adjacent to the pool (which saw little use during our stay) and a courtyard, where there were sometimes guests lounging in chairs with a drink or something from the breakfast buffet. The courtyard did not appear to be noisy. The breakfast buffet was a bit more generous than the typical fast-food breakfast buffets seen at some motel chains. There was fresh fruit, juice, milk, coffee (Columbian, dark roast, and decaffeinated), tea, eggs, sausage (surely pork, but who knows), cereals, make-your-own-waffles, cereals - overall pretty good, although not something you'd go to a restaurant to get. Parking is pricey ($28/day + 12% tax), but parking in NOLA is slightly better than non-existent. At least it's in-and-out, and it takes but a minute before your car is delivered. Tourists are the chief economy of the French Quarter, and everyone seems to know that. Friendliness to tourists is almost ubiquitous, and the Dauphine hotel staff was no exception. There is no room service in the Dauphine, but why would you want room service in NOLA? Rooms have wi-fi, and there are two computers for guests in the check-in/lobby area. The fitness center is sparse (at best) with a treadmill, an elliptical, and a bike-machine. There are a variety of weights. There are also towels and water (dispenser with cups). The desk (like much of the French Quarter) is tended 24/7. Plan on walking to the various "attractions", which extend from Bourbon Street NE to the river. There is a plethora of restaurants/eateries, and many are quite small. Nearly all post their menus, so you can see what's available without going inside. Expect things to be expensive (would you believe $180 for 6 and not at an upscale place), with some exceptions. Expect Bourbon Street to be a bit sleezy. Even Hustler has a joint. And every watering hole and every other vendor-type is looking to get you to part with your money. There are even mimes and singers (some of whom can't) posing or playing on sidewalks (and even in the streets), looking for a donation. In summary, New Orleans is a place to visit (I wouldn't want to live there), and the Dauphine Orleans is an excellent choice, provided you understand the little caveats about staying there. Would we pick another place next time - maybe, but we would definitely consider the Dauphine if we can get the quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Shellz78
Reviews.Content: In planning our first trip to NOLA I had been reviewing hotels for months. To make a long story short after thinking about where we wanted to be and what we wanted to do, I chose The Dauphine and we were not dissappointed. We flew into NOLA from Wisconsin. Took a cab ride to The Dauphine, arrived about 5pm on a Thursday. Becky was the nice young lady who checked us in. She was friendly and very efficient. There was other hotel staff around who were also very friendly. I had asked for a nice room with a balcony if possible so after she checked, she said that was available and sent us off to room 218. When we got there our room was clean and neat, not super large but big enough. We loved our balcony. The beds were super comfy even though they were only full size. The street noise in the early morning hours was minor. I had purchased a little fan which really helped the background noise. Breakfast was awesome. Mae Baileys was ok (just didn't spend much time there) I can't say enough good things about the hotel and the staff. On our first nite out we asked Becky 1000 questions and finally she just said, "I don't want to sound rude but just go out there and GET LOST!" Best advice she could have given us. We had a great time! ALL THE STAFF WAS EXCELLENT!!!! I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses=Value”
Reviews.Author: GinMcG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights. The location was very good - Close to the craziness of Bourbon Street, but quiet overall. The general neighborhood didn't feel quite as safe as other parts of the Quarter, however. The staff was friendly - check-in and out was very efficient. Our room was typical French Quarter dingy, but clean enough and larger that expected. I am a light sleeper and was not bothered by noise from the parking area below our balcony, but I agree with other reviewers that the heat was hard to regulate. TV reception was fuzzy - but that's not why you go to New Orleans. Bed was comfortable. Elevators were a bit scary - lots of bumping and lurching! The breakfast was a nice bonus. Overall, the proximity to the Quarter restaurants and clubs and to the casino and downtown make this a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: jdubstl
Reviews.Content: French Quarter hotel that won't break the bank, is comfortable and clean? Mission accomplished. Location: exactly what we wanted - NOT on Bourbon but close to everything. People who think it's too far to Jackson Square should have looked at a map. It's a few blocks but a very easy walk, especially to all of the shopping on Royal and the streetcar on Canal. Check-in: incorrectly had us booked into a king room, but upgraded us to a two bed room with a balcony (228) for no extra charge. Room: balcony was nice for reading and the street noise wasn't too bad (it is nearly Mardi Gras, after all!). Room was not brand new or super fancy, but it was clean and the beds were fabulously comfortable. Water pressure was very good, as was the available hot water. Having a fridge for the drinks we brought was convenient. TV reception was fuzzy on some channels. I know for a fact that the rooms were vaccummed every day. My one complaint is that there are cards in the bathroom saying that if you hang your towels, they won't be replaced for enviromental reasons, yet every hanging towel was replaced every day. I appreciate the effort, but would have preferred to do my part to help save the world. Food and drink: breakfast was great, as was our beer at May Bailey's. Hotel: elevators were old, dark and a bit fragrant, but we never got stuck! Check-out: bellman kidly held our bags for us for several hours and arranged for a cab to the airport that was clean and on time. Staff: every employee we met was helpful and efficient. Thanks for making my first trip back since Katrina so special.

Reviews.Title: “Not NEARLY as Good as Rated”
Reviews.Author: HouCuseChickie
Reviews.Content: To Start - Check in was a bit slow and not nearly as courteous as other hotels in the quarter. We had just spent two nights at the Marriott (the one at 555 Canal), and while I wasn't expecting Marriott level service or accomodations at the Dauphine, I was expecting the front desk staff to be a bit more friendly. I mean- they weren't rude or mean, but I get a warmer greeting when checking in for an annual visit at the dr's office. Our room was ready, so we took our bags up. The elevators were loud, small, had mats on the floors and smelled like rotting mushrooms (both elevators), but they worked. I still didn't want to touch the walls in there and found myself taking the stairs when I could. At first glance our room looked nice, but after a few minutes- I started noting issues. The most unsettling was the lack of wall hangings. There were NONE...just lots of empty wall space. I guess if they want to make people feel creeped out in their haunted hotel- this is one way to do it. It just made the whole room feel- well, off. Think sink and toilet both looked like the maid was in a rush when cleaning, the a/c vent was loaded with dust, and there were chunky cobwebs hanging from the smoke detector. TV reception was also horrible. Half of the channels were fuzzy. I paid for the cheapest room, but I guess I wasn't expecting that to mean we'd be staying over the valet area. The only "view" I got was the morning of our checkout- the guy staying in the room across from us decided to leave his French doors open and walked around in a towel for an hour. We also only had one bathrobe in the bathroom and it looked dirty. YUCK! So, we ventured over to May Bailey's to get our free drinks. It is a pretty neat place and the bartender on staff that day was excellent, but it is definitely more of a "locals" bar. Which is fine- except - it just made for a few very awkward drinks. Fast forward to us trying to sleep...I was pretty exhausted and was out like a light only to wake up scared out of my mind at exactly 12:38am. I swear that it sounds like three loud raps on our door that woke me up, but the reality- it was likely the valets/passengers slamming doors to a car getting ready to be parked. And for the next few hours- I could hear the valets talking, laughing, parking cars, etc. Not Fun! Another thing that freaked me out- when I woke up in the middle of the night- I noticed that the smoke detector flashes like a strobe light...seriously. So, it was about 4am when I got back to sleep. I'm also not a fan of the location. Yes, I know it's only a block off of Bourbon, but the closer you get to Rampart, the less safe things start to feel. Granted, we were approached by people trying to get $ from us everywhere this trip - and more than any other past trip - but there just didn't seem to be as many non-panhandling people and not nearly as much police presence once you ventured below Bourbon. The gym has nice cardio machines, but too few for the morning rush. There is also too little space for people to really do much with the weights. Finally, the continental breakfast was pretty awesome. It was in the Audobon room and they had a variety of juices, cereals, fruit, bagels, croissants, muffins, sausage, hard boiled eggs, English muffins, and make your own waffles. Good stuff! - but, not good enough for us to return. We'll probably just spend the extra $ and go back to the Royal Sonesta or Monteleone if we want more traditional lodging. I know the Dauphine is not on the same star level with those, but I think there was enough wrong with our stay that has nothing to do with star level to justify my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilnelle21
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to New Orleans many times since it's one of my favorite travel destinations. Upon my various stays, I've had the chance to sample many different French Quarter hotels and Dauphine Orleans is by far my favorite for the price. We stayed at the Dauphine Orleans for 3 nights during our wedding. We had the actual ceremony at the Maison Dupuy, which has a gorgeous courtyard, but having stayed in one their guestrooms during a previous trip, I knew not to return to the actual hotel. We had a group of 15 people joining us and half of the group joined us at the Dauphine and the others were down the street at the Holiday Inn since the Dauphine is non smoking. The Lobby is nice, but small. Check- in was easy and pleasant. We stayed at the Hermann House across the street and the rest of the group stayed in the main hotel. Nobody had any complaints! We loved our Hermann House room, my only complaint was that it was pretty dark and I wanted more natural light for wedding pictures. I asked the front desk if we could switch and they were kind enough let me look at a few different rooms. We ended up staying where we were and took lots of pictures in the courtyard. The room was a good size, especially for New Orleans. Great bed, one of the main reasons I chose the Dauphine in the first place, it did not disappoint! The other amenity I enjoyed was the jacuzzi tub. It was only large enough for one person, but was so very relaxing. The location was perfect. May Bailey's bar was typical of New Orleans and just added to the charm. It was also the final stop of our Haunted Pub Crawl and we used our free drink coupons there. They were also kind enough to lend us a wine key when I needed to open a bottle of wine we purchased at the little liquor store down the street. Everyone we came in contact with was very nice and accommodating. The morning of our wedding, I realized that I couldn't find my travel partner, my teddy bear named Granola. I assumed he got washed with the bedding and the front desk had him waiting for us when I sent my Maid of Honor to search for him. :) Upon leaving, our Best Man, arranged a cab with front desk since we were departing at 5:00 am for our Honeymoon. Check out was so easy. The cab was waiting, took our luggage as we crossed the street for the lobby and quickly checked out. Awesome stay. Couldn't be happier. We're planning our 1st anniversary trip and we're returning to the Dauphine Orleans for our hotel accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, a bit far, but overall nice”
Reviews.Author: MDcouple
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister, and myself stayed here in June 2010. The outside of the hotel is so nice and the check in process was very fast and easy. Rooms are small but they have great beds and linens. I was very pleasantly surprised by that. We had a room over the wonderful parking lot. This is where hell began!! The first night, we got NO sleep. And I'm talking NO sleep. The parking attendants are SO loud. First of all they leave cars idling so you can hear them because they are echoing throughout the building.
