The parking attendants themselves were talking and yelling so loud we could hear their entire offensive conversation. I called down to the front desk but that did not deter them. I don't remember if it got better the rest of the week. After walking around New Orleans in 100 degree heat with a heat index of 120 degrees, you pass out. Good thing the beds are comfortable. The continental breakfast was nice. Bagels, yogurt, fruit, and oatmeal. Perfect light breakfast to get the day started. We did not use the pool though it was small and very inviting. The location is good but it is the furthest hotel from Jackson square. You do NOT want to go any further north than Dauphine Street. Bourbon St is one block away but the noise stays on that side, you don't hear it. I would recommend this hotel but request a room that is NOT over the parking lot if you want to get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: czdancer
Reviews.Content: I would definately come back to this place. The rooms were so clean and the staff was great. We had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “So Glad We Stayed Here!”
Reviews.Author: gotitlikethat
Reviews.Content: I visited the Dauphine Orleans Hotel with some friends in mid-January of 2011. We arrived a little late on a Friday evening and were greeted at the front desk by Becky. She was so pleasant and friendly and checked us in very quickly. We stayed in a room on the second floor and had a balcony over Dauphine Street. The room was very nice and clean and we didn't have any trouble with street noise. The beds were super comfortable, which was so perfect after a long day of walking around the French Quarter. Great location, friendly staff and comfy beds- we all agreed that we would definitely stay here again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: AlicynD
Reviews.Content: Dauphine Orleans is one block away from Bourbon Street....perfect location because it is close enough to get to everything, but you can escape the noise late at night. When I was searching for a hotel it was important for me to find one that was unique and gave me the real feel of being in the French Quarter (as opposed to what I otherwise felt I'd get in a major hotel chain). The Dauphine is quaint, offers a courtyard, and also offers rooms with balconies (either overlooking the courtyard or Dauphine Street). The hotel had recently undergone a renovation, which was nice. Our room had two double beds with amazing mattresses (I think they were memory foam). Most of the bathroom had been renovated. The room itself had everything you'd need (a good size mini fridge, computer desk, sitting chair, dresser, flat screen tv, and free wi-fi). Our room also had double plantation doors leading to a shared balcony that overlooked Dauphine Street (my favorite part about the hotel). There is breakfast served until 10am every morning which offers waffles, cereal, oatmeal, sausage, bagels, muffins, fruit, etc. You receive a free complimentary drink ticket when you arrive for May Bailey's which is right next door. For the most part, the staff was friendly and helpful. The only "complaint" I have about the hotel is that the dresser drawers were very small and couldn't really fit anything more than socks (totally fine living out of a suitcase though). The tub faucet was also on full blast during the shower but I know a lot of tubs are like that. The trash trucks in the morning did serve as our alarm clocks! Otherwise, the stay was perfect. The Dauphine Orleans made my stay in New Orleans that much better. Hands down, when I return to the area, I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Traveler53051
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay near Bourbon street but not on it for our first trip to New Orleans and the French Quarter. After much research, we picked the Dauphine Orleans. It turned out to be an excellent choice. The location for activities and access turned out to be perfect. The room was great and the bar was a nice peaceful retreat from the other noisy bars in the area. There was even a quaint used bookstore across the street that was worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: kriptonian7
Reviews.Content: My wife an I stayed here for two nights for our 3 year anniversary. (Sunday evening thru Tues Morning) We stayed in the Herman house which is across the street from the main building. THE PROPERTY: Well groomed an maintained, nothing stood out. Everything was clean. They have a nice little breakfast room with decent enough free breakfast. Make your own waffle, sausage, breads, fruit, milk, coffe, cereal. Work out room (we did not go into) a pool with complimentary towels. Parking garage is multi-story with a valet that was vey nice. Many small courtyards interlinked throughout. Across the street was the Herman House where we stayed. One large courtyard that was very nice with small fountains and patio furniture. Everything had the "feel" we were looking for. Old world French charm. Wooden shutters instead of blinds or curtains on all windows. Wooden balconies, black iron trims. THE SERVICE: This is part I always find fascinating in other people's reviews. People's exspectations vary so much. My wife and I are pretty easy going and do not need alot when we stay out of town. Now was the front desk overy helpful? That is a loaded question. Everytime I asked a question I received an answer and they were nice about it. I can see how some others would have issue. The staff is of the younger generation (like us) maybe why we communicated better with them, you never know. We did arrive about 4 hours ealry, but they took our car and asked if we could give them an hour to get the room ready. No problem, we were early. Did they go completely out of their way to suggest something for us to do? No, but then again we didnt ask. I do not expect the Hotel to give me all this information. It is my trip and I do all my own research. Id rather them tell me places not to go. But that's what Tripadvisor.com is for right? Our door battery went out and they had a gentleman there with-in minutes to correct it. We usually do not ask the hotel for suggestions to eat or drink because they usually have something set up with businesses in the area, so we pretty much fend for ourselves. Valet was good, but little pricey. $30 a night on the parking. We could have stayed in the regular rooms and had free parking, but the rooms did not meet my needs. Cabs were called for other guests promptly and arrived quickly. LOCATION: Was absolutely perfect. One block over from Bourbon Street in the heart of the French Quarters. Everything is in walking distance. We strolled over to the casino off of Canal street which was only 5 black or so away. Maybe took us 10 minutes. We never took a cab anywhere. Many restaurants around the corner n both directions and there was a neighborhood grocery close by. Forgive me but I cannot remember where, but it was only a block away heading towards downtown on Dauphine St. THE ROOM: We really liked our room. It had exposed red brick with vaulted ceilings and rafters. Decor was pleasant and jazz themed. My wife was pleased and said it was romantic. I also picked this room because the had mini fridge. We like to bring our own drinks and small foods when we travel so for us this is a must. Also great for left overs from a great dinner the night before to munch on. The bed was a king size tempurpedic. Never slept on one of these before, and it was amazing! Tons of pillows, more than two people would need so of course my wife loved it. Super comfortable. Small flat screen T.V. with basic cable. Jaccuzzi tub, marbled floor, iron board, hair dryer and a safe with key. Good size room, lots of room to move around. We have definately stayed in smaller. A/C has electronic climate control. Track lightingfor main light with dimmer switch was nice. Lamps in room were not a good source of light at all. i do not remember a phone being in the room , but im sure there was one. GRIPES: My only gripes were in my opinion there was not enough drawyer space for clothes. There was a large closet for hanging jackets. We basically kept all of our casual clothing and sleep clothes in our suit case on the floor. Socks and underware could fit in the dresser under the TV. The toilettries were basic. Soap, shampoo. Wished they had Q-tips though. Beware of the bottled water in the room. They are three bucks a piece. Easy to chug these down after a long night on Bourbon St without thinking. Walls were a little thin. We didn't hear any of the neighbors, but you do get an ear full of the Bikers that frequent the Quarters on their motorcycles. So basically road noise. We are hard sleepers, but i can see how someone else would have a problem. Definately request a room closer to the center of the courtyards and away from the street. WRAP UP: If you are looking for a romantic short stay in NOLA then Dauphine is a great choice. Clean room, authentic looking at a great price. Will you get 4 star treatment? No of course not. if you wanted that you should have stayed at the Double Tree downtown. It was hard to leave the comfort of he bed, and the free wifi made it easy to plan our days. When we did leavethe room, it was easy enough to get around due to location. Our valuables were always safe, our car was always parked and protected, and the one little issue with the door was fixed immediately. We may stay here again when we go back. The only reason we wouldn't is because we like to mix it up a little. We say you cannot go wrong with Hotel Dauphine.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed, quiet, comfy beds, really nice people!”
Reviews.Author: BBarbie47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a weekend. Loved the helpful people at the front desk and parking was a breeze. Our room decor was very nice, uncluttered and elegant. I like a hotel room in which I get a great night's sleep, this was it - very quiet with nice sheets and pillows; nice shower too. The Dauphine was a fabulous hotel experience in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs attention”
Reviews.Author: Wendy_2449
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights over new years in the Herman House suite, room 243. Pros and cons, based on our experience. Pros: Exceptional location in the FQ, lovely courtyards, and a decent free breakfast. The hotel had very interesting architectural features. The parking staff was very attentive and would promptly call you a taxi when you needed one. Cons: 1) Upon arrival after a long flight, we had to wait for over an hour for our room to be â€œcleanedâ€�. We arrived after the 3pm check in time. Not too much of a big deal much, but we were tired and the wait was irritating after traveling all day and being up since 3am to make our flight. The front desk gave us some extra drink tickets for Mae Baileys to compensate for the wait. 2) One of the main reasons I choose this hotel is because many reviewers said it was very clean. I couldnâ€™t disagree more. The place scared me; it had a slight port-o-potty odor. I went to the Walgreen's on Decatur and Wilkinson and bought Lysol disinfecting spray and gave the entire room a once over. If you stay in this room, I left the remainder of the disinfectant in the TV cabinet in the bedroom. 3) We came back to our room after being out and about all day to find our room door left OPEN, yes wide open! Iâ€™m sure the housekeeping staff just didnâ€™t pull the door shut to latch it, and being an old building the door wonâ€™t stay closed unless closed properly. Nothing was missing from our room, and Iâ€™m sure it was an innocent oversight, but OUR ROOM DOOR WAS LEFT WIDE OPEN FOR SEVERAL HOURS. 4) Upon checkout, the front desk didnâ€™t bother to ask us how our stay was.

Reviews.Title: “Maid stole our prescription medications.”
Reviews.Author: WiscMike
Reviews.Content: We satyed there in early January and like the hotel. The only complaint was that the maid stole both my sleeping pills and my wifes anxiety medications, I would never thought that you would have to lock them in the safe. Lesson learned. Front desk was apologetic and offered to cover the cost if we send them a prescription. Big deal they were generic prescriptions bought at Wal Mart for $3.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, quiet, and clean!!.”
Reviews.Author: dustqueen
Reviews.Content: At first I was apprehensive....but then I realized that if you want to get away from the noise, this is the perfect place. You can walk anywhere from this location. I thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast everyday....and the staff was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful! If you get a room near the garage...it can be a bit noisy. Overall, we were very pleased with our accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: yusi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 214 with balcony and it was really lovely. The hotel is situated in a quite street, and very accessible to all the lovely jazz bars / Mississippi River / Jackson Square / Flea market etc. As a big jazz lover, I was a little shocked to encounter many very noisy clubs on Bourbon street ( I'm really glad that we were not staying on Bourbon Street, that's for sure!). The staff were very friendly. The only thing I would say is that considering the high standard of the hotel, the quality of the breakfast could be improved more - with freshly baked French croissants etc. However, the staff in the breakfast area was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Quiet, Good value”
Reviews.Author: johnnyb510
Reviews.Content: Been here before....nice place. It's in a quiet area of the French Quarter. The rooms are comfortable ....beds great. Free wi-fi, free breakfast OK. Very friendly staff...Looks like it has some very interesting rooms....I had basic..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: doubleomatt
Reviews.Content: Pleas disregard all negative reviews about this place. The location was perfect; the staff was very friendly; the rooms were clean and comfortable and QUIET; the breakfast was extensive and delicious. It really exceeded all of my expectations. One heads-up, however-- parking is $28 per night, so we parked at a lot around the corner for $10/night. Aside from that, however, I couldn't have been more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: kushta
Reviews.Content: While I have been to NO before, this was my first time staying in the French Quarter. This is the place to be - park the car and you don't need to get it out your entire visit. So much in walking distance - including the Streetcar to the Garden District. The rooms were clean, staff was friendly. Climate control worked excellent - strong showers. Breakfast area is quite large - plenty of tables available and for a free breakfast pretty good. This street is one block off Bourbon - you don't hear the noise from there, but still noisy in my opinion - but to be expected staying in this area. Our room had a balcony on Daulphin, which was nice, but probably will pass on that next time and get a courtyard room.

Reviews.Title: “employees very helpful but......”
Reviews.Author: hayminor
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for four nights in three different rooms, not cause we wanted to. when we arrived we looked at three rooms picked one that had a shower and you could see the tv from the bed. it was across the street and fine. too bad the heating system broke and we had to move the next day to the room downstairs. too bad that room shares a wall with the kitchen of the restaurant next door. banging pots and pans till 4 am was not helpful in trying to sleep. so we move again to a small room in the main building which was fine. when we got the bill we were surprised to see the second room which they moved us to because of no heat in the first was more expensive. seemed to us that night could have been adjusted or even comped. they know all about the shared wall because other people have complained. would we go back , no.

Reviews.Title: “There Is Not a Better Value In the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MDGW
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel. The first time I stayed in the main buliding with a room facing the street with a balcony. I was very pleased with the exception of the nightly street noise. This New Orleans after all, so when I planned my stay this time I requested a room in the Herman House. I also requested that the room be away from the street. We stayed in room 140 and it was perfect. There was a lovely gated courtyard jsut outside our door. The room was described by someone who had stayed at the Sheraton as much nicer and I agree. The bed has convinced me that my next bed at home will be a Tempurpedic! The staff was helpful. The entire hotel is extermely clean! The breakfast was better than average: waffles, breakfast meats, and a variety of other offerings. Mae Baileys is a little gem of a bar! Location is perfect for all French Quarter and CBD activiites. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,great service and staff.”
Reviews.Author: brewerbarr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very fortunate as we happened upon the Dauphine Orleans Hotel quite by accident. We were supposed to stay at a local bed and breakfast, but upon viewing it,we left because it was one of the most disgusting places to stay that we had ever seen. We were then stuck without a place to stay for the night. It was my husband's first time in New Orleans. First, we went to The Bourbon Orleans Hotel nearby, but all rooms were booked. But the staff there was amazingly helpful and kind after I told them our problem. They called their sister property The Dauphine Orleans Hotel and reserved us a room. I can't say enough about the staff at the Dauphine Orleans. I don't know the women's name who checked us in, but she was so wonderful about everything and felt badly about our dilemma. Since she did not want us to have a bad experience in New Orleans, she cut the rate down considerably to $10.00 less than we would have paid at the bed and breakfast. The room was cozy and just perfect. Very clean and the mattress was a Temperpedic,which we had never slept in but liked a great deal. My husband and I are so very grareful to The Dauphine Orleans for their hospitality and understanding at a time that could have turned into a disaster for us.On another positive note, the hotel has a great bar and a delicious expanded continental breakfast. At only a block away from Bourbon Street it was the perfect location.All in all an outstanding experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: justkeepm0ving
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights having booked online and were really pleased with it - the street runs parallel to Bourbon Street, which is the centre of all the NO action, so it was only a couple of minutes walk away yet we couldn't hear any of the partying from the room - ideal. Room was really spacious and the bed was extra large and comfortable; we only had one problem which was a really dubious handprint (?!) on the suedette headboard but when we made the staff aware it was cleaned straight away. The buffet breakfast was a real bonus as it saves time when starting a day of sightseeing, and the courtyard with pool was a nice surprise, as was the adjacent bar and free "welcome drink" voucher we got whilst checking in. All in all, just what we were looking for and great value for money - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful bed!”
Reviews.Author: ajjonesehc
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans is in a great location that's one block off Bourbon, but incredibly quiet. We walked everywhere we needed to go while there from the location. The bed was incredible. We got the upgraded King room which has a tempurpedic bed. It was worth the extra $5 a night. We did have a slight problem with an inattentive front desk clerk, but otherwise we had wonderful service from the hotel. I will say that it is an older hotel and all the usual plumbing issues can crop up from time to time. We had a poor draining shower, but it wasn't that big of a deal. Overall a great buy for the location and the bed and will definitely be back! Be sure to eat at Jagerhous (just around the corner). Best German food we have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Were Looking For!”
Reviews.Author: StephenBD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from an extended weekend trip to New Orleans. The Dauphine Orleans Hotel was exactly what we were looking for. We stayed in the Herman House. It's the separate building with the private courtyard across the street from the main building. From the moment we opened the door to the room, we knew we made the right choice. The room was charming with brick walls and exposed wood-beam ceilings. The king bed was unbelievalby comfortable. The staff was knowledgable and courteous and gave us several dining recommendations. The breakfast was more than ample to start the day before hitting the streets in search of good New Olreans fare. Our package came with two complimentary drinks at the attached hotel bar May Bailey's. The location of the hotel was great. We valet parked at the hotel and then walked everywhere in the French Quarter. You're only a block off Bourbon and few blocks from great art galleries and antique stores on Royal Street. All in all, I would recommend the hotel with "old world charm" to anyone looking for a romantic getaway. We would return in a heart beat. Only one word of caution, the walls are a little thin, which was to be expected in an older building.

Reviews.Title: “THE VERY BEST HOTEL IN TOWN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: trish1018
Reviews.Content: After searching all over the internet, reading other's reviews I chose this one. I am a very picky travellor and to my surprise it was truly a jewel. The staff was superb, friendly and helpful. Right off the bat you felt as if they had known you forever as part of their family.And, let me tell you about the bed!!! It was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. So much that I didn't want to get out of it in the morning. Just like sleeping on a cloud. The day we arrived I requested another bedside table. It was delivered within 15 minutes. The saltwater pool in the courtside was an additional treat. It is just one block off of Bourbon Street but you would never know it by how quiet it was. Do not miss out on this jewel because you will be very glad you do.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of problems, indifferent service: they just don't care”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler27
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent traveler and have very few complaints about the vast majority of the places I stay - generally thanks to the great recommendations I get on tripadvisor. I always roll with the punches when things are a little off, as every place has its quirks and drawbacks. But I have to note this B&B's problems. We booked a 'standard' room for 2 people on expedia, and it was a dingy, dark room with one FULL-SIZED bed. Not queen, not king, just a full/double. It was absolutely tiny and haven't seen a hotel of this price (or even motels!) have rooms with only one full-sized bed before. The room didn't have a dresser, and was much dingier than showed on the website. When we asked about this -- extremely politely -- we were told that there was nothing they could do by a defensive manager; she told us the hotel was booked so we couldn't switch rooms, and that we'd have to call expedia about the problem. After we spoke to Expedia and asked to be let out of the 2nd two nights of our reservation at least, so we could find another hotel, the expedia staffer called the Dauphine - and the manager refused to let us out of the reservation. You would think that they would want to keep up a good relationship with expedia, if not us as their guests. The next morning, a much friendlier front-desk worker switched our rooms to one with a king bed for no extra charge (so apparently there was room). Both rooms were poorly lit, and looked over their parking lot. You can hear every word that the parking lot attendants say , and it is sometimes quite loud when cars go in and out. We ordered a movie on our tv and it didn't work. The hair dryers in the rooms are absolutely ancient and one of them stopped working on me. I called and asked for a new one, but no one came in the 15 minutes I waited, until I had to leave to go to an interview with a half-dried head of hair. The air conditioning switches on very infrequently, so the room would get very hot and then cold for only a little while. The bathroom was not very clean in our second room; there was gross schmutz on the shower curtain and the toilet hadn't been scrubbed all the way. one night we came home and the toilet wouldn't stop flushing! They sent 2 people very quickly to fix it. The stairwell smelled of urine (seriously). And while we were there, the city had a water outage in the area, and there was a 24-hour "boil advisory" (to only use boiled or bottled water). The hotel only stated this advisory in the lobby - they didn't notify all the guests in their rooms or give us a call or anything, so only when I was checking out did I see a flyer at the front desk saying that guests shouldn't drink the water or even shower with it. Some of these things on their own would have been fine, but all together it was pretty bad. It's really unfortunate, but it seemed like they just didn't care if their guests had a good stay or not. On the good side, the pool is very pretty (though not heated), there's free wi-fi, the folks at the bar were very friendly (and the bar has a nice ambiance), they stored our bags for us with no problem and called us a cab when we needed one. The location is good if you like the Quarter, and it's also a short walk to the Central Business District. A recommendation: if you do end up staying at Dauphine, make a reservation for a meal at Bayona, the very highly rated restaurant across the street, as soon as possible as they don't take walk-ins when they are really busy.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Honor Reservation - Ruined a full day of Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: jodi_123
Reviews.Content: After much research we reserved a Hermann House room for 3 nights. I'm a light sleeper and wanted a fairly quiet room. Our reservation stated Hermann House Premium King clearly on it. When we arrived, they acted surprised that we wanted a Hermann House room and said that was unavaiable, but they were putting us in a comperable room that would be quiet. Before we were settled we went to the bar to pick up our free drinks and a lovely lady there stated, "I just decided to come down today and they gave me one of the rooms in the Hermann House, I just love it." Unfortunately for us - room 103, where they put us, was over the pool and bar area is the noisiest room in the place and that is where they put us. There wer e3 wedding parties in the hotel and they were in the pool courtyard until 2:30. That is when I called the manager and asked if we could please get some sleep, we had started our day at 6 am to travel. The overflow from the bar continued in the courtyard until after 4 am and you could hear everything that was going on - there was little to no sleeping that night, every time you'd nod off someone would start slamming glassware or talking loudly - it was probably the worst room I've ever stayed in while in New Orleans. The following day I went to the front desk to ask about a move (the night manager said she would set this up - she lied, seemed to be the trend there). So, I very calmly asked about our move and also stated that we had paid for and reserved the Hermann House and that I did not feel we had a comparable room - I was told "OH no, that room is a class above what you reserved - it has a balcony - so no discount (wait this gets better). Eventually we spent most of our afternoon moving. No-one would help us, we were exhausted, there were no carts available, it was hot and sweaty. We finally got to collapse in our new room around 4:30. We spent the next 2 nights in room 141 in the Hermann House and it was almost like night and day. Except.....we went to bed early that night - and at 11:30 they moved people in the room above us. At this point we are laughing hysterically because they are "suitcase droppers" It was comical, we'd almost get to sleep and BAM they would drop a suitcase. This only lasted about 45 minutes, but really - it was starting to feel like a conspiracy against sleep! One other note about room 141 - the AC blows directly onto your face on the bed. My DH ended up sick from the constant blowing on his face (too hot to not run the AC). Our last night ended up being fine, of course the entire trip we were drop dead exhausted which took a lot of pleasure out of it. Then we go to checkout and I find they are trying to charge us an extra $88 for the pool room (remember - it's a class above), they did take the additional charge off, but that took a chat with the manager Sean. There were a couple of things that were nice about the hotel. The beds are temperpedic and divine, if you can sleep in them. The linens are nice. The maids were some of the nicest people we've ever met in New Orleans and the only reason this is 2 stars instead of 1. The bartenders were pleasant and even when lying to us about the quiet room they were pleasant about it. We'll stay elsewhere on our next trip, there are many places that you can actually get sleep at night that honor the reservations you make. Oh - and no WiFi the entire time we were there - good thing we weren't on business!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: 16Margaret
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel one block off Bourbon Street, excellent location, quiet but close to the action. The beds were extremely comfortable, room was plain but very clean. Beautiful little courtyard area with pool. Breakfast was very good. Bellman was very helpful with recommendations. Would recommend this hotel if you are looking for something smaller that really feels like you are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: glow4011
Reviews.Content: We had the Fall special which included the room, parking and tax! Free parking is rare in the french quarters. Hotel: The location was great, it was one block from Bourbon and four blocks to Canal Street (for Canal Street and St. Charles trolley). This is more like a boutique hotel, it's quaint and quiet. There's two elevators and it works most of the time. Front desk was helpful depending on who and what you ask. No express checkout, but checkout is at Noon. Small pool and a small fitness center. Parking: The valet was helpful and friendly. Room. The room was standard room, it was on the fourth floor with small window overlooking a pool (not the hotel's pool). Room was kinda dark, but we didn't plan to stay in the room all day. The bathroom was not large, but a good size...recently updated. The bed sagged, so I slept in the middle which was fine it was comfortable enough. My friend on the other hand didn't have any problems sleeping. Bar: The bartender arrived half hour late but we got our free drink which was a deal. Not fully stock, but enough to get you started. Breakfast: Make your own waffle and an assortment of bread, fruit, cereal, juice, hardboiled eggs, instant oatmeal, coffee and one day, they had sausage. Pretty basic, but hey it's included! Area was not too small, decent in size, has a TV. Only entrance is through the bar or through the entrance near the fitness center. Free Wifi!! Tip: If you have a smart phone, use an app to help you find good restaurants nearby. Acme was a few blocks away and Louisiana Bistro was the next block (which had great review, but we didn't eat there). This hotel is quiet a bit away from Cafe Du Monde, Jackson Square, but not too far if you like to walk. There is a 24-hour restaurant across the street, cheap eats, but didn't eat there either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull experience”
Reviews.Author: 111111smallbird
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, relaxing atmosphere, friendly staff, location within French Quarter but on somewhat quieter block.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: southernbelle80
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, staff was friendly and so proud of their city and how it's bounced back. Great location! Walk to all sorts of restos and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance of everything, yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: SkysTheLimit_10
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the flavor of the French Quarter without the noise, this is the place for you! Loved the historical feel of the hotel. Was very quaint and comfortable. The only amenity I would have liked was a small refrigerator in the room. Otherwise, I will definitely stay at the Dauphine again the next time I am in NOLA. Thanks for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Bronx_boy_1937
Reviews.Content: Aside from resident ghost, hard to come up with negatives. TV turned itself on every morning at 1:30 during our three night stay. When we complained to the Maintenance and front desk folks, we were told this was due to para-normal activities. They claim that they are a certified haunted place. The desk clerk will be happy to tell you about her ghost sightings. Staff is friendly, Continental breakfast more than adequate. Bourbon Street around corner but middle of block location blocks most noise. Police were called to silence a very noisy argument on the street one night. Streetcars a few blocks away. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: TheJack4780
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location for a weekend getaway in New Orleans. Walked everywhere! Fantastic restaurant next door and curious staff!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot for exploring my new favorite city”
Reviews.Author: CarrieRM
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs. It was close to the action, but quiet enough that we could sleep at night. We traveled to New Orleans for the food and we were never more than a walk away from world-class restaurants. (Which if you are thinking about going to New Orleans and are a foodie, stop what you're doing and book your trip. It was amazing on the food tip.) The hotel had a pool in a cute courtyard, and we were gutted that it was just a bit too cold for a dip. There was a small gym with a treadmill, elliptical and TVs which was nice. Again, the location was killer. The rooms were tidy, the beds were super comfy and the linens crisp. We even had terry robes! (We usually travel no-frills so it's the little things that excite us.) We snagged a room on the street side of the building with a small balcony (ask for one at booking) and LOVED grabbing a bottle of wine from one of the close wine shops and sitting on the balcony before heading out for dinner. We were only two stories up, so the view was nothing to write home about - but we just love watching cities go by. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and the bartender at the bar was personable and awesome. When we go back to Nola (note I say, "when" - we love this town) we will definitely be staying here again. No questions. Value was great, location awesome, and rooms were just what we needed. (Note: Foodies must go to Kitchen Witch - an AMAZING cookbook shop with even more amazing owners. It was one of the highlights of our trip and we ended up visiting it daily.)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: AndreToronto
Reviews.Content: Amazingly for being one block away from Bourbon Street, it's on a quiet street. Excellent location all around, just a few blocks from Canal Street as well. We really could not find any faults with this hotel. It's obviously an old hotel being in the middle of the Quarter but it's been completely renovated. Looks more like a Sheraton or Marriott in the passages and room areas. Has a nice bar and pool area too. We stayed in the main building so not sure what the part of the hotel over the road looks like. Great staff, helpful, no problems at all with checkin or checkout. Free internet access in the lobby. Room was spotlessly clean. No problems with the bed or the bathroom, although drainage in the washbasin was a little slow. Not sure if it's the standard but self-serve breakfast was included and there were plenty of choices. Rate was reasonable compared to other hotels we've stayed in in the area. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in the Quarter to stay”
Reviews.Author: Done_with_shoveling
Reviews.Content: I searched and read reviews and searched and read reviews and then did some more of both before deciding on the Dauphine Orleans. I am here to tell you to stop and just go to their website and book a room. I traveled with a preschool aged child and this location is a fine one to stay at with children. The breakfast is ample, the rooms very clean and beds super comfortable. Tthe courtyards and seasoned bar give this place a nice NOLA feel. I wanted some charm, plus the comforts of an updated room and the Dauphine delivered on these points. I found the bellman and front desk staff very helpful and friendly too. If I had to list a flaw, it is the noise level from the street, not horrible, but there. We were on the 4th floor and heard plenty, however I believe this is due to the proximitiy to Bourbon and not a fault of the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Quality affordable acccomodation in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: captden
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were very attentive and helpful. Room was clean and pleasant. Cleaning staff very cordial. Pool area and outdoor courtyard areas really add to the ambience and comfort. Breakfast was ample (loved the fresh waffles). This hotel is within walking distance of all the French Quarter attractions and only a few blocks from the streetcar on Canal St. I would recommend this hotel. Be careful on the Sept longweekend sue to the close proximity to Bourbon St. It was very disruptive on Sat night my last night.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: AusTexTraveller
Reviews.Content: I love this place! It's the only place I stay when I'm in town. The service is great and friendly, the beds are soooo comfortable, and nothing beats having a free welcome drink while you lounge by the pool. It's an authentic New Orleans experience - very charming! And you really can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “STREET NOISE”
Reviews.Author: katmelina
Reviews.Content: PROS: This is a nice and clean hotel one block from Bourbon. Large room with balcony, fridge, couch, excellant mattress. Free cont. bkfst. CONS: Very small bathroom and basin area. $28.00 parking. Located on a one way street parelling Bourbon so when Bourbon is blocked a lot of traffic passes in front of hotel. Garbage truck(s) early every Sat/Sun morning, people yelling, loud auto music and one that went by at 2:00 a.m. booming so loudly that it set off auto alarms as well as the ever so loud Harleys. Get an inside room. Regards.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, service even better!”
Reviews.Author: Tribecarocks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and I had a fantastic time. I got a great deal on a King room with a lovely balcony, the bed was so big, you could have had 3 people in it with room to spare! The bathroom was spotless as was the entire room. The internet speed was extremely fast! But for me, the highlight was the service. The evening desk clerk, Aaron, was amazing, always so helpful with some great suggestions on where to hang out other than Bourbon St! Jeffery at May Bailey's was also a joy. I left something at the hotel and it was forwarded to me within a day, no problems. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, authentic NOLA hotel”
Reviews.Author: TampaNugget
Reviews.Content: My stay was during Labor Day weekend. My room was in the Hermann House which is located directly across the street from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel for an authentic old New Orleans experience. The room, while a bit small, was charming and well laid out; it faced directly out to the tidy courtyard. It was very clean, with a comfortable bed. Noise was minimal and made for nice sleeping. Maid service was efficient and accommodating. The property is well maintained. The lobby itself was small, but that is to be expected in an historic building that was made into a hotel. A continental breakfast was available in the dining room each morning. A variety of juices, yogurt, milk, coffee, muffins, croissants, cereals, hot waffles etc. were nicely placed out and attentively monitored by the staff. Anyone who complains about this breakfast must not understand what a continental breakfast is. The pool area is at the main hotel. The saltwater pool itself is nice enough, but the deck is small and can only accommodate a small number of persons. The bar is adjacent to the pool area, but you must enter the bar to get a drink, no poolside service. The hotel location was very convenient to everything, but far enough from Bourbon St. to escape the mayhem.

Reviews.Title: “Both thumbs down on Dauphine Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Markgdallas
Reviews.Content: After my labor day stay, I won't be deciding future hotel choices based on Tripadvisor ratings !!! This hotel was rated #16. I've stayed at #40, the Maison Dupuy, and for the life of me I can't figure out how the Dauphine carries such a lofty rating. Only two things, stand out about this hotel. The bed and the location. If that's all you want in a hotel, the Dauphine Orleans might suffice. Let's start with the lobby. It looks like a Best Western check-in desk, then you're off to the one working elevator with the cracked floor that sits outside the lobby area and in the garage with all the car fumes. The pool was actually OK, but forget sitting anywhere or laying out. There are about 4 deck chairs and 2 tables in an awfully cramped pool area. The bar/lounge smelled like a wet ash tray and looks like it hasn't been updated since the late 70s. One has to cross the damp ashtray bar/lounge to get to an equally horrible and dated breakfast buffet dining room. The dated and dank ambiance is surpassed only by what I would call the worst breakfast buffet I've experienced in years. There wasn't one hot item, if you exclude the coffee and waffle's you make yourself. The staff was decent. I feel bad they don't have a better environment in which to work. Bottom line, the public spaces of this hotel need a complete redo. There are far better choices in the French Quarter at more reasonable or equal prices.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what i was after”
Reviews.Author: Nicole M
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, apart from a shampoo lid still in the bathroom from previous guest. The bed was amazingly comfortable. In the heart of the French quater close to EVERYTHING could walk everywhere. The pool was lovely area to sit and relax. The bar area fairly quiet at night. Restaurants and bars a pleanty a good convience store right on the corner which only charged $0.99 per a transaction. Highly recommend this place.The lifts were out one afternoon so it kinda sucked being on the top floor but they were fixed in short period of time

Reviews.Title: “A charming little hotel in a great French Qtr. location”
Reviews.Author: gregandbon
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our recent stay at this hotel, less than a two minute walk from all the Bourbon St. fun. Our room was on the small side but clean, modern-looking, and quiet. The bed ranked right up there with those at some of the best hotels we've stayed at. The salt water pool and surrounding courtyard were relaxing. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The complimentary welcome beverage and breakfast at the adjoining bar were excellent. Overall, we felt that we got an excellent value for a very reasonable rate, and would definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Will gladly return!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTwosome08
Reviews.Content: We were beyond pleased with the Dauphine. We stayed in Room 316 and it was huge.(Just to note I don't think all rooms are this big but not sure. This room might have been a larger one due to it being on the end.) Check in was easy and our room was very clean. We had not one, but two private balconies overlooking Dauphine Street. Bathroom was plenty big. We even had a small refrigerator in our room. The only complaint I have is that we were by the elevator which was loud (but it would be that way at any hotel with this type of layout). Also if you are a light sleeper you will not want a room facing Dauphine Street. There was some street noise but that's not the hotel's fault. It's New Orleans, so what can you expect? We ran the fan in the bathroom at night to drown out the noise. The location is perfect. One block over from Bourbon (if that's where to plan to spend your time, although we didn't). Close enough to walk to everything in the French Quarter including the Aquarium and the French Market. Also close enough to Canal Street to where you can get on the streetcar to take you to the area the Audubon Zoo is in. The pool and surrounding deck area are on the small side, but it was fine. Plenty of pool to cool off in and relax in a hot afternoon. Continental breakfast was like everyone else has said on here. It's basic stuff like oatmeal, toast, waffles. We only ate it one day. We chose to eat breakfast other places. I was hesitant to stay at the Dauphine because we always stay at a Marriott when we travel. We previously stayed at the JW Marriott on Canal. But wanted something different for this trip. We will be staying at the Dauphine every trip from now on. BTW, we had trouble at first booking a room with a balcony over Dauphine Street. We even called the hotel and were told told they could not guarantee a balcony overlooking Dauphine. But as time got closer to our planned visit, the website did allow us to specifically book a room with a balcony over Dauphine Street. Not sure if it was a coincidence that it was closer to our planned visit or the website was just updated to allow that choice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for an Authentic New Orleans experience!”
Reviews.Author: Tansz
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here in mid-July 4 nights and 5 days. We wanted a hotel in the French Quarter, within walking distance to Bourbon Street, restaurants, and Jackson Square. The Dauphine Orleans fit the bill perfectly! All of the above attractions were less than a safe 10 minute walk of our hotel. Bourbon Street was only about a 4 minute walk from The Dauphine Orleans. My flight arrived in NOLA first. I got an airport shuttle for $20 one way (we split a cab back to the airport $33 for 2 people). Upon arrival, I was checked in quickly. I explained that my friend was coming in later and they had a key waiting for her at the desk. There was a minor mix up with the room. I was initially given a huge and beautiful mini suite with a pool view. The only problem is that it was a one king size bed and a sofa bed. There were two of us ladies and we needed a room with two doubles. They handled the change quickly. However, the second room was not as plush and nice. It was very clean and had a great balcony view of the street and city. However, the carpet wasn't as plush and the bathroom was much smaller. We were comfortable and happy with the room, but I think that the first room was nicer. Both rooms were in the main hotel. The salt water pool area was very cozy and nice. It was nice sitting out there after a long day of walking around. Mae Bailey's is an onsite local bar near the pool area. It is cozy and full of locals and fun. The free breakfast is held in there. It was ok. My advice is when coming to NOLA, find any excuse you can to eat anywhere in the French Quarter. Don't waste a meal on hotel food. Check out was smooth, but check your bill. We were charged for 4 days of parking and we had no car. It was taken care of immeadiately. I will definately stay there again! I want to try the Hermann House premium rooms across the street. We booked the main hotel room due to a special online from the hotel. Book this hotel directly, the rates were much cheaper through them directly. We paid $352 for 4 nights with only a credit card to hold the room. You can pay cash or charge upon departure.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: chase2089
Reviews.Content: After much research, I booked at the Dauphine based on price, proximity, free internet, and other reviews. I was really pleased in most areas. The king room at the Hermann House was amazing, with exposed brick walls and a very nice finish. We were near the entry gate, so we heard that bang open/closed all night, but I didnt really mind....other people would find it loud and annoying. Street noise compared to Bourbon was great. Service was great. Free wireless internet. Kinda small bathroom, but it had a nice jacuzzi. Overall I was extremely pleased and would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden French Quarter Gem”
Reviews.Author: CrazyforNawlins
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my first stay in New Orleans for the location in the French Quarter. I was pleasantly pleased by the quality of the hotel and staff. This is a wonderful property to stay at and is competitively priced. The Dauphine is very clean and modern with a lovely courtyard and salt water pool. The Breakfast room was quaint and the complimentary continental breakfast was good... especially the make it yourself Belgium waffles. The Dauphine is one block away from Bourbon Street and all the liveliness but without the noise or congestion which is nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel !!.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sisam
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, good location... Excellent value for we've paid. Very much enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: flygirla
Reviews.Content: After reading alot of reviews about this hotel, my friend and I, along with our children decided to try it out. Upon entering the parking lot, the parking attendant was nowhere to be found, so wanting to check in, I pulled into one of the empty spaces. I fully intended to be done with check-in quickly and come back to my car. As soon as I was exiting my car, the parking lot attendant started screaming at me that I couldn't park there. I explained that I was checking-in and would only be a few minutes and he backed down quickly. Attempting to check-in was another hassle as they could not find my reservation. The front desk clerk seemed to be new or not really sure of his job and it took about 1/2 hour of us going back and forth before he found my reservation. Finally, we get up to the room and there is one double bed for four people. I went back downstairs and he quickly changed my room to another one. All-in-all, this hotel is in a great location. The rooms are small, but very clean. As other guests have mentioned, there was some noise that could be heard all night due to people coming and going from the garage. The pool and the pool area are small as well but looked like a nice place to hang out and have your free drink. Breakfast is enough to get you going to lunch. If you are looking for a hotel with alot of "bells and whistles", this is not the hotel for you. However, if you want to be in the Quarter, close to the action for a decent price, this hotel definitely fits the bill. I paid $95 and this included parking ($28 per night) and hotel taxes.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL WITH AMAZING SERVICE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JustJen0421
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine stayed here for what was supposed to be 4 nights but we ended up staying an extra night which the allowed at the same price we were paying. We arrived early after a 10hr drive and the staff was so kind to let us check in early!!! Everyone at the hotel was SO friendly, Jennifer and Lisa at May Bailey's made us feel like they knew us for years. On top of everything that was amazing at the hotel the beds were to die for!!! Very close to all the action without all the noise!!! We def will be back!! I booked this after countless hours on trip advisor reading through review after review and I was very happy with our choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in New Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: NEZ630
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time in New Orleans and I received great service at the Dauphine Orleans. The rooms were very clean, the staff was very professional and pleasant and most of all, the price was very reasonable. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay by the French Quarter. The great thing about the Dauphine Orleans is that it's a block away from all the commotion that is happening on Bourbon and you don't hear a thing once you are in your hotel room!! AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: peach509
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, clean, quite, good price, you get a free drink at the bar and a so so breakfast. We would stay there again, loved the staff. Bill and Judy Estay Sharpsburg, GA

Reviews.Title: “Fair price for fair accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Saudidmarie
Reviews.Content: While the Dauphine Orleans is nothing to write home about, the staff was friendly, the beds were clean, towels and toiletries were replenished daily. Continential breakfast was enough to get one started in the mornings. Would suggest designing a working lounge/commom area for guests to gather in other than at the bar.....more lounge chairs at the pool.....otherwise, an OK stay.

Reviews.Title: “Let the Good Times Roll...”
Reviews.Author: chgrbill
Reviews.Content: Wow!! Excellent hotel, location & staff. Only downside was a barking dog down the street in the AM hrs. for 1-2 days out of the 5 days we were there. Aside from that, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat! Thought our room was haunted, but that was cool...

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the hectic French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: VioletteStar
Reviews.Content: The BF and I went for a 5-day vacation in New Orleans and we opted to stay at the Dauphine Orleans not only because we got a terrific deal on Priceline, but also because the website made it look divine. We got a room on the 4th floor overlooking past the rooftops and a slight view of the center courtyard with the pool. The room itself was clean, fresh, and modern. The bathroom was huge and the bed was comfortable (Tempurpedic baby!). Our room got straightened up on a daily basis - our beds were made and fresh towels/toiletries were always awaiting us when we got back to our rooms. The hotel itself is in a quiet section of the French Quarter. Although it's very close to Bourbon St, you won't find the bratty frat guys here! It's the perfect walking distance to everything you would want to see. There's a grocery store 1/2 a block away with a .99 cent ATM fee, along with snacks, liquor, and other useful items. There is also a 24-hour diner a couple of steps away from the front hotel entrance. The bar that is connected to the hotel, May Baileys, has a decent selection of booze and the bartenders (especially Lisa!!) are just awesome! Here is where I got many recommendations from locals, that did not disappoint! You can grab your drink and sit out in the courtyard by the pool (the only place where smoking is allowed in the hotel besides the bar). The pool itself is on the small side but perfect for a quick dip to help you recover from your morning hang over. Fresh towels are always available. I would definitely stay in this hotel again, next time making sure to get one of the super fancy suites with a balcony. Excellent decor, cheap prices, great location and a super friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT !”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkAmberLady
Reviews.Content: We checked out of a slightly higher level hotel because I simply couldn't make a decision ! I booked 4 days in each. I booked months in advance for this hotel and got a great rate. In my opinion, a bargain. Location fabulous... SO CLOSE to the crazy action on Bourbon street, with NONE of the noise ! Explain that to me. How is is that I don't hear that craziness ! amazing. Ok, ice machiens on every floor. wonderful. Bedding? outrageous.( memory foam transports me.) I have a two double - bedded room for two. great a/c ..friendly staff. saltwater pool...tiny but friendly. On premises bar that I did not hit yet.. but the breakfast? waffles, yogurt, bagels, cereal,coffee/jice/fruit.. just FINE . Flat screen t.v., very little furniture and drawers true.. but marble and upscale bathroom make this place a winner. Hallways nice...onsite parking at a price.. Free good high speed internet in room... tiny fitness room...I'd come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “First time.... And the last time.”
Reviews.Author: BIGGUNNER845
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, not worth the price. Stayed in a double room. No furniture to place cloths, no closet space, small bathroom. For the money I would have rather stay somewhere else. I don't suggest place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Very Nice. I would stay here again....”
Reviews.Author: mjohns7861
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending 4 nights at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel last week. What a pleasant stay! If you are looking for a hotel in the French Quarter this hotel is extremely well located. You are one block off Bourbon Street and in essence can walk within 15 minutes to any key point in that part of the city you wish. There are two sides to the hotel - the Courtyard and the Inn side. The Courtyard side is across the street and the doors to the rooms open to the outside like a motel. However the courtyard is very secure, with keycard entry, and each room has charming french doors. The room was well appointed with a wonderful king bed. I travel quite a bit and would say its one of the most comfortable beds I have slept on. The room had a 20 foot vault ceiling with exposed beams and brick. I thought it was pretty cool. Room had a nice flat screen TV on the wall. The bathroom is well appointed but its worth noting the wash basin and mirror are part of the bedroom. I tend to not like those set-ups but it somehow worked for us. The frig was very handy for some drinks and snacks we bought nearby. We did try the continental breakfast once and it was fine, if not crowded. Just has the basics - bagels, fruit, juices, milk, and a waffle maker. They did it in the area that doubles as a bar at night. While we did not use it, there is a small but rather nice looking saltwater pool with lounge chairs. I regretted not using it as again, its seemed quite nice. Also, having the free wifi in the room was nice, as I had brought my laptop. I should mention there is a wonderful restaurant next door called Bayona. The caveat of my review is this. Again, I stayed on the Courtyard side. I do believe the rooms are different on the Inn side and I believe the reviews are correct: some rooms are directly over the parking garage and I would perceive that you would want to avoid the 2nd floor rooms, if you can. However, I do not know this from any experience. Overall, I would highly recommend Dauphine Orleans Hotel. It's comfortable, easy, and well located. Despite being one block from Bourbon Street it was VERY quiet. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: flyguyatl
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed two nights at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel and Had three Rooms booked. The stay was one of my best ever. The location is perfect just a block or so from Bourbon St. The Rooms were very clean and well appointed. The beds had to be the most comfortable I have slept in anywhere. The linens and towels were all 1st Quality. The Pool was very nice and was a nice break from the heat of the day. The Bar had lots of local color and fun visitors. The Staff could not have been nicer and provided everything we asked for or needed. I travel for business and this is one truly outstanding hotel and just the right size. I will make many repeat trips to the Dauphine Orleans. Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: OceanBreezesSD
Reviews.Content: Loved the front desk people. They gave great dining recommendations and helpful sightseeing tips. Really went out of their way to make it a special stay for us. We qualified for the "Spring Fling" special rate (Mon-Thurs), which included parking and continental (with waffles!) breakfast. That made it sooo affordable! It also meant that our room was small without a balcony, but that's okay--we were on a budget. The hotel was clean, pretty and quiet, and the bed was comfortable. Location--perfect! Right in the French Quarter, yet quiet -- one block away from the noise of Bourbon street. Only a short walk to the St. Charles Street trolley stop or to the river. And we walked all over the French Quarter and left the car in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: bobfrombc
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Dauphine June 6 - 11. Booked there after researching on T.A. Would have stayted longer than the 5 nights but price jumped considerably Friday and Saturday. Checkin on Sunday around 5:30 pm was flawless. Room very clean and while I had earlier requested a room away from the parking garage we were right above it and never heard a thing all the time we were there. Don't know what others heard or maybe they had their windows open. We didn't as that would have affected the air conditioning. King size bed with super comfortable mattress and pillows. Lots of towels in the bathroom. Continental breakfast is provided each morning in the May Bailey lounge and includes juices, milk, coffee, selection of tea, cold cereal, fruit, bread, bagels, etc for toasting, and a waffle machine where you make your own. Courtyard and pool area not large but quite a few lounges and chairs available. We were generally able to get a lounge when we got back to hotel around 3:00 pm. That seemed to be the popular time to take a swim and pick up some rays. Pool isn't large but enough to cool off and do some laps. I could swim underwater from one end to the other. There was a fitness room but didn't check it out. There is a computer in the lobby area that you can access free to check emails etc. All the staff we met were very friendly. Only complaint I had was one of our lamps next to the bed did not work. Left a note for the maid but nobody did anything about it. Finally on our last evening there I decided to move the night table out and saw that it wasn't plugged in. Why couldn't the maid have done that? Checkout as smooth as checkin. In fact when I saw the bill it didn't have any $1. daily surcharge or tax showing and asked. They said our price was a special package because we stayed five nights. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: CourtneySTL
Reviews.Content: Hotel is one block north of Bourbon Street. There are plenty of great resturaunts and bars nearby. Our rooms was clean, nice, and quite; there were not a lot of kids present during our stay. Hotel is close enought to the night time traffic that I felt safe walking around at night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value”
Reviews.Author: travelgrade
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many NOLA hotels over the years and this hotel is excellent. Yes, the rooms are a little on the smallish side, but all rooms in NO are smaller. Plus this is historic, not built yesterday. Actually its history is part of its charm -- a former bordello inhabited by three resident ghosts. You will even find a copy of the bordello's city license in your room desk drawer. The staff was efficient and the beds were very comfortable. It is a block off of Bourbon St. and within easy walking distance of Jackson Square and the French Market. We walked right around the corner to have lunch at the Jager Haus (very good German food) and then down to the Oceana Grill for dinner. Lots of excellent restaurants within easy walking distance (but that is true all over NO). Parking is expensive, but no more so than any other major city and their parking is very secure. Speaking of security, if you walk down Conti past Bourbon, you will see the NO police station. There's a sign out front saying you can get a t-shirt inside.Since everyone else in NO is selling t-shirts, why not the police??? They have a colorful, bordello-style bar where you can enjoy a complimentary glass of wine or a pint of beer that is connected to the renovated studio where John Audobon painted his bird pictures. In the morning, a very nice continental breakfast is laid out for guests. Aw, New Orleans. There is nothing like seeing packs of people carrying drinks down the street at 7:30 in the morning on their way home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay In NOLA”
Reviews.Author: creeker98
Reviews.Content: My husband and another couple recently stayed at Dauphine. We made our reservations "in the blind". We did not research nor read any reviews of this hotel. Boy, did we make a great decision. The hotel is in an ideal location, lovely, and the staff is above par. I could not believe we had room at this high quality hotel for the small amount of $ we paid. Every member of the staff was wonderful - Shaun at the front desk was EXTREMELY helpful, housekeeper was wonderful (unfortunately I do not remember her name) and the parking attendant was so personable. We highly recommend this hotel. Donna Hicks - Charleston, SC

Reviews.Title: “A great value with unbeatable location and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: 1127kcmac
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel location was perfect with just enough distance from Bourbon street to provide a quiet night sleep. The rooms were small but clean and the bed was very comfortable. Good breakfast buffet every morning. I would most definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: christens02
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the location of this hotel. It was close to everything. We had the romance package, which included gift certificates to a number of local restaurants, which we really enjoyed as well. That brought the cost way down as well. We stayed in a king room in the building across the street. Even though we were about a half a block off Bourbon, the brick walls kept out the noise. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job keeping the room cleaned when we were out of the room. The breakfast was nice, although we were glad to have some eggs at a different restaurant on our last day. Lovely hotel, lovely time. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but far from spectacular”
Reviews.Author: voorheesians
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4-day/3-night "getaway" to our favorite city. It's my 11th time in NOLA, my wife's 5th. We booked here because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. I must admit, however, that we were very disappointed. There are many nice things about the Dauphine Orleans - the staff seems friendly, responsive and helpful; the courtyard and the pool area are pleasant oases; the wireless internet is appreciated; the location in the heart of the French Quarter can't be beat. For us, though, these positives must be weighed against a fairly large number of negatives, and overall, I can only give this hotel an average rating. 1) The room was spacious and reasonably clean, but smelled dank and musty. There was one tiny window. Even with the plantation shutters wide open, the room was dark. We had to use all of the lights even during the high noon hour. 2) The bathroom was marble and also clean, but very small and cramped, with barely enough room for one. Also, there was virtually no water pressure. I couldn't even rinse the shavings out of my shaver. It's a sad situation when you have to flush 2X just to clear out #1. Place one piece of toilet paper in, and we had to flush 3-4X before it would go down. 3) The elevators are a disgrace. During the 4 days we were there, one or the other or both of the elevators were broken down at any time. We frequently had to climb the 4 flights of steps up to our room in the humid 87 degree temperatures. When working, the inside of the elevators were DISGUSTING - cracked, dirty floors; scratched wood walls; rusted metal door-frames. This is NOT what I expect from a hotel ranked as #21 in all of New Orleans. 4) The continental breakfast was complimentary, and while appreciated, was not what I would expect from a "highly rated" hotel. Tepid coffee with only "non-dairy creamer" available. A waffle maker that appeared broken - the waffles came out under-cooked and split in two upon opening the iron. The muffins were tiny and tasteless, and white bread only was available for toasting. The quality was more on the level of a Holiday Inn Express. I really WANTED to like this hotel, and while there are some high points to recommend it, overall I left with a sense of disappointment. I've stayed in numerous hotels in NOLA, including several other more charming boutique hotels in the French Quarter. I will likely return to one of those in the future.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: savoytruffle79
Reviews.Content: I write this as a French Quarter hotel veteran. I have been visiting New Orleans for over 20 years and have stayed at many hotels, one of the better ones being the Chateau Le Moyne just down the street (also fantastic, though a chain and a bit pricier). I highly recommend the Dauphine; it is especially great for what you pay, and it is more authentic than many of the more expensive hotels. That said, I recommend calling for your reservation so that you can request specific rooms. Some rooms have balconies and more windows. From our lovely third-floor room in the main building, we had a view of Dauphine out front and a view of the business district from the side. The Tempur-pedic beds are incredibly comfortable, and the rooms are decorated in clean, light-colored linens. The colors are light and airy, unlike many of the dark boutique hotels in the area, and the morning sun shines in, waking you gently with loads of New Orleans charm. We are not the big Bourbon Street touristy types, but the Cafe Beignet on Bourbon is a very short walk away and is well worth the short morning jaunt. You are also a short walk from everything in the French Quarter, also a short walk from the St. Charles streetcar that will take you to Magazine Street, less touristy and filled with yummy restaurants. This is not the hotel for you if you are going to New Orleans to experience the sameness of a Ritz-Carlton, etc. But if you want a neat, clean, charming, well-located room in the middle of the French Quarter, I very highly recommend this hotel, especially for couples. Also, yes, parking sucks, but you WILL NOT find good parking in the French Quarter. Don't let that be a deciding factor in choosing your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Late sleepers need not apply”
Reviews.Author: MrsJoeyD
Reviews.Content: Well the best part of the hotel is it's location. You really can't beat being one block from Bourbon St. The hotel is in a great spot for restaurants and entertainment, although set back far enough that you aren't in the middle of the chaos. However, the construction that is going on at the hotel is a bummer. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the parking garage (yea I know), and they started up the jackhammer every morning at 8 am. It was impossible to sleep through the noise. Other than that, the room was just fine. The bed was comfortable, and the room was clean. We would stay again, just double check the construction is complete first!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Great Room”
Reviews.Author: magiemay
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying we loved this place arrived the last day of jazz Fest first day of a big convention dropped our bags at noon couldn't get in to the room until 4:00 ok lots to see all day asked if there were ant balconey rooms was told no sorry.got back about 5:30 went up opened the door to our room and JACKPOT we had not one but two balconies the room was just beautiful.The beds were like a cloud the bathroom nice and big and a coffee maker. the pool was great (salt water) The front desk people Nicholas and Christine were so helpful with directions and restruant advise.The location is great also just a block over from Bourbon. Can walk to everything from here Just loved the place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience, Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: pmrunc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans for the 2nd week of Jazz Fest, 5 nights, 6 days and were very happy! The Temperpedic beds are exactly what we needed after a day at the fairgrounds of dancing! We slept wonderfully!! We were on the 4th floor, the room was a perfect size, and very quiet. Not a peep from the parties on the streets (which are actually a couple blocks away, another reason we picked this street), and we slept like babies! The continental breakfast is not huge, but exactly what you need to get your day started, we enjoyed having waffles and some coffee before headig out to JazzFest every day. The housekeeping staff was soooo attentive and catered to all our needs, even allowing us to really sleep in most mornings without coming back! Our room was always spotless upon our return!! We will definitely use this hotel again for any future trips to JazzFest, all the amazing restaurants are a walk away (Recommend GW Fins, Oceana and Deanie's Seafood!). The hotel bar is a great place to unwind after a long day walking around the city or dancin'! People on this website that complain about this hotel honestly wouldn't be happy anywhere!!! "Not getting my balcony" does NOT seem like a good reason to give this hotel 2 stars, if you are planning on spending so much time in your room that a balcony is going to ruin your trip, GET OUT OF NOLA!!!!! The city is bursting and the DAuphine only adds to it's charm!

Reviews.Title: “a mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: 2serendip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the first weekend of the Jazz and Heritage Festival, and the hotel was completely booked. This hotel has the advantage of being in the Quarter and so is close to many attractions. Bayona restaurant is excellent and is right across the street; Bourbon street is a couple of blocks further. We found two other fairly good, moderately priced restaurants -- Deannies and Oceana (great crab cakes!) - within easy walking distance. Our fourth floor room was small and sparsely, though adequately, furnished. Good bed, good shower. The staff at the front desk were helpful and courteous. The downside, however, is the parking lot around which the main hotel is constructed. The attendants shout at each other almost constantly, and the noise comes up through the central atrium -- the shouting began around 7 am and lasted until after midnight on each night of our stay. I would strongly recommend requesting a room that does not look on to the parking lot as the management seems to be nonexistent, and it's clear that the shouting is tolerated. I would also recommend finding your own cab service if you need one to get to the airport. The parking attendant (head shouter) seems to be in charge of booking the taxis. He had told us the taxi would cost between $33 and $40 for our return trip, but Marco (the hotel's "regular" cab driver) charged us $56. He also did a racist antil-Obama rant for much of the trip. Except for those complaints, we were pleased with our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The good point: It's in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nanagee
Reviews.Content: But that's about all. I reserved the room (for 2 adults) and specified we wanted a balcony. Reserved well in advance. Got there at 3:00 p.m. and no balcony rooms available. And the hotel clerk didn't bother to mention it ... When I saw the cramped room with two double beds, a bathroom where the toilet took up most of the floor space, and one tiny window, I called the desk and then he said he reduce our rates to standard rates! The reduced rate was more than I would have paid if I had reserved a standard room to begin with. And I must have had the only really crappy bed in the hotel. Other reviews seem to love the bed... I hated it. My husband and I rolled together from side to side and top to bottom. It was like sleeping (or not) in a hole! And the internet didn't wrk so there was no "business area". Apparently if you can get in the part across the street from the main hotel you get a nice courtyard, etc., Not so in the main building w/o balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TimeToGoInNC
Reviews.Content: The positives: very pleasant staff, good and reasonably quiet location, comfortable beds, nice courtyard with a small pool. The negatives: during busy afternoon, a single person staffed the front desk, meaning lines and delays for check-in. Bathrooms have a "wand" shower that hits you mid-chest, if you're short.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed”
Reviews.Author: Venus-space-traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located. It is only a block off of Bourbon. Would venture toward Rampart though. The bed was a memory foam mattress. Adorable little room. My main problem with the hotel is that the parking garage is on the two bottom floors of the hotel. The noise travels up the courtyards above. Constant noise from parking attendants and cars all night. Maybe not all rooms have this problem, but our's did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Middleton-Sue
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine staying at a better place in NOLA. We stayed in the building across the street from the main hotel and it had a lovely courtyard - it was very peaceful and serene. The room was spacious and newly decorated with a small refrigerator (great for leftover food from the many wonderful restaurants). It was very close to the action, yet it seemed very far removed from the craziness of Bourbon St. The hotel staff is gracious and very good at making restaurant recommendations (Deanie's Seafood is close by and terrific). We also enjoyed our complimentary drink at Mae Baileys and the continental breakfast. A fairly basic continental breakfast, but you could eat it outside in their lovely courtyard near one of their pools. Rates are good - and they sometimes run specials, such as complimentary parking. This is a great place to stay in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice blend of NOLA charm and modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: 4Nola
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend before St. Patrick's Day 2010, which was a very busy weekend. Because many hotels were booked to capacity, we did not get the best rate, but we would be willing to give them another chance in the future because everything else was so great. We were placed in the building across the street from the main hotel (Hermann House, I think they call it). Our room was a bit small for the price. But it was clean and well appointed, the bed was really comfortable, and the bathroom was larger than many places we've stayed in NOLA.
