Once parking, taxes, and fees were added, however, the room was nearly $300/night. And the size of the room warranted a rate of $179 at best. Price was our only complaint. The location is wonderful. The staff was super helpful and friendly. We loved the jacuzzi in the courtyard. Great for soaking tired feet at the end of the day. This hotel is a nice blend of NOLA charm and modern amenities. Furnishings and fixtures are clean and up-to-date (flat screen tv mounted on the wall, bathtub with jacuzzi jets, free WiFi). But charm does not suffer. The room door seemed to be a former window that had been transformed into a door. The courtyard was lush and well-kept. May Bailey's is a great bar and a quiet retreat after the noise of Bourbon Street. Note, however, the free drink with check-in is for beer and wine only.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed!!, very clean and comfy, people were very nice”
Reviews.Author: Nicky069
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a block away from Bourbon (close enough), and far enough from its noise and croud. If you are exploring the French Quarter this is a very good option to stay at. They allowed us to check in as we arrived, 2 hours prior to check in. Room was spacious, and king bed was awsome!. Bathroom very clean, w/ enough room and well equiped. Would definetly stay there next time at NOLA. Bayona restaurant in front of Hotel was excellent!. Also, if you like Tequila, Rita's Tequila about 2 blocks away from hotel had a very good selection, and is also a quite/upscale spot in the middle of the Bourbon Street rumble.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: LibbyL4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights to party in the French Quarter.It was a very clean,nice place,nice people and just a few blocks walk from where we wanted to go. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, lots of amenities excellent breakfast tooo much noise”
Reviews.Author: barbieq318
Reviews.Content: Great hotel potential The complimentary continental breakfast is way more than that and the Ladies that keep it running are great. The group of people that clean the room and supply the amenities in the rooms including a robe do a good job It has an on sight bar May Baileys great escape from the craziness of NO and a lot of locals come in that's always a good sign. Our room was very small for two but decorated very nicely but the really bad part was the noise not from the street from the underground garage and I guess people who walked in and out of that area including anyone who worked there late at night between the beeping locks of cars and the loud voices sleeping was difficult on top of that there were workmen with power tools at 8 a.m. come on even in suburbia people are not allowed to make loud noises until at least after 9 a.m. I wanted to let the management know about this before i left cause I would really like to come back to this hotel it has so much to offer I didn't get that the day guy cared but there was a young guy who comes in around 11 he at least said he was sorry for the noise I still would give this a thumbs up but be careful where your room is and hopefully the people who work there will realize the walls are thin keep your voices down

Reviews.Title: “A great New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bdmaustin
Reviews.Content: We did plenty of research when we selected a hotel and it really paid off. The location is unbeatable, one block north of Bourbon in the heart of the French Quarter. You can walk everywhere. The staff is courteous and helpful. The rooms had a New Orleans flair to them, were clean and had good water pressure. The beds were awesome, it was hard getting out of bed in the morning. The morning breakfast is free and has the standard continental items. When weather is good you can eat outside. The bar on premises is also very nice. I highly recommend. Constructive criticism would be to update the elevator finishes, they were a little beat up, but who goes to New Orleans to critique elevators!

Reviews.Title: “The Dauphine Orleans is lovely”
Reviews.Author: kayaknut
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel! I loved everything about it; location, decor, bar/courtyard, cleanliness, bed linens, and the Tempurpedic mattress. We feel like we got more than our money's worth by staying in this hotel. The one and only negative comment I have is the TV reception was lousy, which didn't bother us too much because we were asleep almost as soon as our heads hit the pillow:-)

Reviews.Title: “A good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: ldny007
Reviews.Content: This location of this hotel was perfect...it was a little off from Bourbon St, yet everything was within walking distance. I had a really really great time in New Orleans and I can't till we visit again. Room: We stayed in one room with 4 girls. We shared two double beds and it was very comfortable. I really liked the pillows, but I tend to like pillows where my head sinks in. Bed was very comfortable and I had no trouble falling asleep. One annoyance is that the smoke detector had a blue light indicator. It was bothersome throughout my first night. We had a nice view of the pool area and the room was very quiet. Service: I really enjoyed the breakfast. It was standard fruits, pastries, meat and eggs, but I was able to get my daily intake of fruits/vitamins. Otherwise, my other meals in New Orleans was far from "healthy". They had a internet in the lobby that all hotel guests can use. Location: Amazing location! It was so convenient to Bourbon St, the farmer's markets, great eateries, etc. We pretty much walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: abw
Reviews.Content: Really nice place. Great location; friendly helpful staff; large comfortable rooms. Was completely happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Close to the Action”
Reviews.Author: CHMurillo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay at the Dauphine Orleans partly because of its proximity to Bourbon Street and partly due to the good reviews we read; we were not disappointed. The hotel is smallish (four floors in the main building and others in adjacent properties), with a small swimming pool we did not use because of the weather. The rooms in the main house were comfortable, with large beds and flat screen TV's. The housekeeping staff was very mindful of our rest, never bothering us until noon if we didn't venture out of the room, and the hotel bar, May Bailey's Place, was charming and intimate. I honestly have no complaints about my stay here (no hidden fees during check-in, friendly staff, good accommodations), but on the contrary, I must say that the hotel was a perfect choice: close enough to walk to the heart of Bourbon Street, yet far enough from the noise to get a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: CWMilo
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor it was absolutely great! The location is perfect one block off Bourbon street and three blocks from Royal Street Shopping. The room was wonderful clean, great sheets, towels and pillows, tasteful colors, great little coffee maker in room, nice toiletries. Wonderful continental breakfast with fresh fruit and also had fresh waffles, cereal, muffins, bagels. We had a room with a balcony it was not noisy (we asked for balcony) Dauphin street is not that busy, but there is some minor street noise. Free wifi (the signal was a little weak so wouldn't plan on working too much!) . Staff was fantastic every single person at counter and valet attendant. Rooms were cleaned thoroughly daily. This was a fabulous boutique hotel and all of us felt we had a wonderful experience, great location, great condition and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonably priced!”
Reviews.Author: SR718
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October. Basically, you get what you pay for. It was very reasonably priced but there were no frillsâ€¦ Clean, close to Bourbon and quiet. Lots of great restaurants and bars within walking distance. Only complaint we had was that there was a chlorine smell in the hallway but at least not in the bedrooms. Even though there are no frills Iâ€™d stay here again, how much time do you really want to spend in a hotel when youâ€™re in NOLA?

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff can't help an old hotel”
Reviews.Author: pictureprincess
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here because just like you we were looking for a hotel in the French Quarter that was close to Bourbon Street and got good reviews. However, now that I stayed here I don't believe the reviews went into enough detail about this hotel. The hotel is old enough that the pipes do not work. This translates into the toilet NOT flushing, tub not draining properly and the sink filling up even when the drain was open. Although the staff was great and quickly moved us into a different room when the toilet practically overflowed - after I had gone no less :( I would have much rather stayed at a place where the staff was snotty but the toilets flushed properly! We are not a high maintenance couple and I never have anything bad to say about anything, but toilets not flushing is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “I fell in love with the Dauphine Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: tartoo
Reviews.Content: This was possibly one of the cutest hotels I've ever stayed in. I was upgraded to one of the historic rooms in the courtyard only to be surprised with the fact that they had a jacuzzi right outside the door. This was not listed as an amenity. The room was small, maybe 250 sf? Very nice clean bathroom with whirlpool tub. Flatscreen mounted on wall. This hotel had so much charm and the bar was my favorite of all the ones I went to during this trip. Very friendly staff as well and perfect location in the french quarter. P.S. I got this room for $89 a night, and it was excellent for that price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic beds!”
Reviews.Author: StarryEyed13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel in April 2009 with 4 friends as part of our road trip and we all loved our stay in New Orleans. We had two bedrooms opposite each other, both had 2 of the biggest beds iv ever seen and the most comfortable bed iv ever slept in. Loved our room and the bathroom was lovely. Our room was cleaned and beds made up each day whilst we were out and although it was overlooking the main room I didn't find traffic a problem. Really enjoyed the breakfast each morning, coffee, cereals, strawberries, muffins and a waffle machine and the breakfast lady was there topping everything up. The room for breakfast was quite small with only a few tables however as a party of 5 we never had any problems being seated. Theres one computer in the reception area which has free internet access. The reception staff organised for us to be picked up by mini bus for a tour of New Orleans, the tour guide took us all over the city and was extremely informative and covered everything we wanted to see in a few hours however cost approx 65 dollars. The hotel is in the heart of New Orleans, nightlife is right on the doorstep, recommend Pat O'Briens outdoor bar, with coloured fountains and you have to buy a hurricane cocktail and you get to keep the glass ;-) Overall a great stay however only bad point was the cost of parking our car for 3 nights which we thought was steep.

Reviews.Title: “Best Possible Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: urbanaUrbanaOhio
Reviews.Content: Tempeurpedic mattress, breakfast included, free internet, two free drinks, down comforter, loads of pillows, new flat screen TV and one block from Bourbon Street. Not noisy at all and we were there when the Saints played undefeated. See Papa Grows Funk at Maple Street Bar on Monday for an amazing music act. Connections big band is great at Funk 541 and the afternoon Zydeco band at Krazy Korner bar was the best. Washbord player was amazing. Eat at Deja Vu and Deanies near by for cheap good food.

Reviews.Title: “Very nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: RetirednurseIndiana
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Dauphine orleans Hotel on our first trip to NOLA! We had some difficulty finding the hotel but when we arrived, Mike, with the valet parking gave us his card and told us to call if we ever again had problems getting lost. The hotel was very luxurious, marble countertops, beautiful brick walls. The first room we were to be given had no windows with a door "overlooking" the housekeeping closet so Mike kindly arranged another room nearby at no charge. It was a very nice room but overlooked the street so we had to keep our blinds closed. I had thought we signed up for a room overlooking the courtyard but everyone was so nice we didn't protest further. Did not have a lot of street noise as you would expect. And not a lot of noise on the street period which we had been worried about since it was only a block from Burbon St. The room had brick on 2 sides which was neat! The linens and bed were very nice quality, and clean and comfortable. The breakfast was nice in a small, pretty room off the courtyard. When we stay again, I would want to make sure I had a 2nd story room or maybe one overlooking the courtyard. The courtyard was beautiful with benches and little tables. Only downside, and most likely because the building was so old, is that the room smelled "earthy"...Maybe due to the brick walls..But not due to cleanliness because it was very clean. Price was good, parking was expensive but was the same as most of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Dauphine was great”
Reviews.Author: SDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 316, overlooking Dauphine with a balcony. It was a great room. Good price too. The front desk was very good, the location was amazing. So close to all in the French Quarter on a slightly quieter street. I wanted glass glasses in our room. That's my only complaint. Maybe because of the balcony we had plastic? It seems like a small thing, now. The May Bailey's bar was a lot of fun. Say hello to Jeffrey for us!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy , comfortable, convenient and elements of chic”
Reviews.Author: fskennedy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay (my first visit to NOLA). The hotel is very well situated in the heart of French Quarter - close to everything, even Bourbon Street, yet quiet enough to get a good night's sleep. Our first room was on the second floor over the parking lot entrance, so there was a little noise - not so bad, but noticeable. On our third night we moved to the courtyard, this was a great move. Extremely quiet and more convenient to the hot tub. Both rooms were recently renovated with an elegant and very tasteful hand. We were very very pleased with both rooms.The beds were AMAZING, we have never been so comfortable...we are now in the market for a Tempur-Pedic bed. Bayona and Louisiana Bistro are right there - they both looked great, and we plan to make reservations so we can actually eat in both places next time. The hotel had a simple but well appointed gym, an elliptical, a treadmill, some free weights, and perhaps a couple of other pieces of equipment. The bubbler had water, the towels and apples were fresh. The elevator in the main building was disappointing (borderline disgusting actually). The breakfast was great- waffles! community coffee, fresh fruit - but given the elgent touches in the rooms, it felt a little cheap to eat off of stryofoam. I would have been much classier to have proper dishes, though it seems recycling has not yet arrived anywhere in New Orleans. I expected the town to be a little more environmentally forward. The bar was a great throw-back to a boisterous era, but as a non-smoker, the smell caught in all the fabrics was a bit too much character to take in for more than duration of a single drink. (My friends who do smoke would have been very happy to be able to stay inside a bar and smoke - this is no longer allowed in New York or New Jersey) We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: LowCountryIslander
Reviews.Content: The location was great, in the French Quarter, but a block away from the craziness that can be New Orleans. It was an easy walk to anything in the French Quarter and just a few blocks from Canal Street where there is a street car stop and also within walking distance to the Central Business District. The staff was pleasant, although we never needed any special requests. The breakfast, which was included with our room rate, was adequate nothing special, and the free wi-fi in the room was a definite plus. The room and bathroom were neat and clean and the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy, Musky Room & Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: alateacher
Reviews.Content: The rooms were booked by a close friend (for her wedding) who had been shown several of Dauphine Orleans' best and most newly renovated rooms. However, what we got was MUCH different. My husband and I were in a "cave" in the Hermann House. It wasn't even the corner room, but it was DARK and fit for vampires. The noise level of other patrons coming in and out of the gate was unbearable. The room smelled like New Orleans several weeks after Hurricane Katrina: a strong, intolerable odor that made it difficult to stay in the room. The refrigerator leaked on the carpet (pleasant to stand in a puddle when you're putting on make-up, right?) and a "Jacuzzi" tub that was hardly modern. (It looked like America's very first attempt at the Jacuzzi: it was as small as a standard tub, appeared filthy, and was quite a disappointment.) Another complaint was that the girl at the front desk magically lost our wedding favor. They specifically had names on them, and after we stressed our disappointment, she tried to give us someone else's gift. (Thanks, but no thanks, sweetie.) Finally, upon checkout, when I asked for a comment card for the hotel, she handed me a card with birds on it that was blank inside. She explained, "These are the old comment cards. You can write whatever." (I politely declined....)

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Your New Orleans Stay”
Reviews.Author: parislover_8
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at this hotel and we enjoyed our stay. Good location, generally quiet, one block from Bourbon Street. Stayed in Room 420, one of the less expensive but adequate rooms. Probably would opt for a balcony the next time. The mattress and bedding were the real stars, equivalent to 4 star or better hotels. Cons were the musty odor in the hallway and no in room frig. Also, charming pool area and very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Wedding---Very N'Awlins”
Reviews.Author: kimmielane
Reviews.Content: Initially I traveled to New Orleans in August in preparation of our upcoming October wedding at the Dauphine Orleans. Our main-guesthouse room was small, clean, updated, and functional with memory foam beds and nice white linens. Our balcony overlooked Dauphine Street. The hotel is non-smoking except for the courtyard and bar areas. (Word to the wise...do NOT let anyone smoke on your balcony or you will be charged a non-negotiable fee of $200 for smoke removal, even if you keep it outside.) Which is good news for non-smokers! Let me say that the staff and valets were always very helpful and courteous. The sales manager, Dawn, was very attentive and helpful as I planned my Big Easy destination wedding online. We were in contact for almost 6months while preparing for the ceremony and she consistently and promptly returned my MANY calls and emails. In order to reserve the courtyard for the wedding in October we were required to fill the 3 surrounding courtyard rooms, all of which were very rustic and charming. The suite was equipped with a slow-draining whirlpool bath (no shower); however, the jets worked nicely. The other 2 courtyard rooms were both equipped with showers only. We encountered a problem with seeing a little mouse in one of the rooms and some unidentified matter on the bed in another courtyard room. Although the thought of sleeping with mice was very unnerving, it is almost understandable that mice would be in the older building surrounded by courtyards. Once we notified the staff, they were very quick to assess the situation. Our other friends and family filled the main-house rooms and all seemed content with their stay. WEDDING FYI: I was allowed the option to personalize the reception and ceremony set-up to my liking. The Audubon Room (which adjoins the courtyard through a hallway corridor) is in need of some serious updating, but the courtyard made for the perfect setting of our ceremony/reception for our party of 50. Food and drinks were set-up in the Audubon Room while dancing & mingling commenced outdoors. I had priced and researched many other local hotel wedding packages and I am glad that we chose the Dauphine. Although certainly not the fanciest of locations, it was perfect to set the mood for the wedding we had in mind...simple ceremony, cocktails, dancing, and mingling in the spirit of New Orleans. Our wedding weekend motto was "WE CAME FOR THE PARTY!" If you have a sparkling, dreamy, pretty-princess wedding in mind you are better suited to host your wedding at one of the larger venues. If you don't mind a building with older character to house a no-frills ceremony for a party of around 50 guests, then the Dauphine is recommended. The courtyard provided a beautiful backdrop while maintaining some flare in our ceremony photos with views of some of the surrounding older buildings in the background. Overall, the hotel is extremely charming and a nice change from the common Super 6 Holiday Micro "we'll leave the light on for ya" hotel chains. Besides having lovely pool/courtyard areas, the "infamous" hotel bar is a great place to have some drinks and meet a few locals. If you are used to staying at upscale- luxury hotels, the Dauphine would not be a perfect fit. But if you are looking for some traditional, older New Orleans pizzazz then the Dauphine should be right up your alley. I have now stayed on two separate occassions and have been pleased with the hotel both times. I had a wonderful wedding weekend and will be back for many anniversaries.

Reviews.Title: “Research pays off!”
Reviews.Author: jymwal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel from September 24 to September 28 2009. My husband and I and his brother and wife had the most wonderful time. We chose the Dauphine after many hours of research about the hotels and even just about the Dauphine itself. We had the 1st floor(upper) suite, room #243, in the Hermann house which is the best room in the hotel i think! It was the entire top floor of the building. The courtyard over in the Hermann house is quiet and peaceful. We had a huge sitting area and a bar with fridge. There is an ice machine right ourside the rooms in the courtyard which makes it great for entertaining in this room. The room has all the old shutters on the windows and doors, great A/C, great comfortable bed, clean bathroom with great shower. My husbands brother and his wife had room # 129, a premium room which was the best smaller room in the Hermann courtyard. Be sure to eat at the some of the best restaurants in town! Oysters were great at Acme, Grilled were wonderful, lots of tasty juices for dunking fresh bread,and the raw were great too. Mmmmm! Opposite the Acme is Felix's used to be good now terrible!!! No, TERRIBLE! So bad not just the flavour and way they cook them but i was litterally ill that night, and would not recommend even trying there. Mr B's, must have the $1.50 Bloody Mary's and Martini's at lunch accompanied by the Fantastic shrimp dish BBQ sauce,. oh my and their fresh unlimited read to saok it all up, you get a bib so don't worry about the mess just enjoy! Bon Tonn, Phew! Turtle soup best in town, better than Commander's, and the Crab au Gratin was amazing. Irene's, just great, atmosphere food everything. Call in advance , early and book, people are not aware you can do this, don't turn up you will wait a long time! Dont leave without having the hazelnut chocolate desert. Lots more to mention but making my mouth water, so i'll stop! The bar in the Dauphine was great after a night out eating etc, quiet and comfortable. Try the Turbodog Ale, especially if you are English or like Guiness or strong beer. GREAT local beer! All in all a great location hotel worth paying extra for better room and definitely stay in the Hermann house.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: bonsonvoyage
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful.The comfortable bed and ability to control room temp. were great after walking around in the heat. We were quite satisfied. While there is no restaurant, the complementary breakfast is nice, there is a bar attached and there are tons of restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “easy to recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: ohiobartender
Reviews.Content: this was the first time I have stayed at the Dauphine. I will cover the negative first. The elevator is in need of an update...other than that it was a wonderful expirence!!!! The staff was all couteous, fun and accomodating. They are definatly the reason we would stay here again. The rooms are clean and roomy. The beds are comfy (although I was not used to the Terapedic mattress).

Reviews.Title: “Just book it; it's awesome”
Reviews.Author: michael c
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect, just a block away from Bourbon street but yet it was quiet. Our reception clerk, Deondra, was very helpful and couteous. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are nicely appointed. The breakfast, included in the price, had a great variety: waffles, toast, yogurt, fresh fruit...just the thought of not having to worry about which restaurant to go for breakfast made the start of the day easy. Tip: DON'T BUY THE AIRPORT SHUTTLE TICKET...it costs only $33 for a taxi from the airport to the hotel, instead of the shuttle that cost $30 but makes lots of stops at other hotels before getting to yours. We were on the shuttle for about one hour after arriving in NOLA. Waste of time. Unfortunately, we had bought the airport shuttle return already. We know better next time. Overall, this hotel is great and has all the amenities needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CelesteD
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred hotel in the French Quarter. It's close to Bourbon, but far away enough that it's quiet. Directly across the street is the Deja Vu bar, which has breakfast 24 hrs., a good thing when you're out late in the Quarter. Rooms are on the small side, but who's staying in their room in the Quarter?! Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. Each time I've stayed, I've been given a coupon for a free drink in the hotel bar. This trip that drink also included complimentary Zapp's potato chips. Breakfast is also provided, but I've never tried it...the one time I looked, it seemed to be mediocre hotel bagel fare, and I'd rather get an omelet across the street at Deja Vu. Valet parking is swift, no wait (long waits at the Monteleone for parking...LONG!). Front desk staff was friendly and upon check in, our room was immediately changed when we discovered it was right next to the elevator. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Close but not too close”
Reviews.Author: l1106410
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this small hotel on previous occasions and keep coming back. The price is right, the service personnel are great, the rooms, although small, are well kept and comfortable. The best part is, you are close to Bourbon St (one block) but not too close. You can't hear the noise, music, shouting or sirens. You are within walking distance to everything in the French Quarter. The room rate includes an adequate continental breakfast. The off street parking, a must in NO, is pricey, as it is with every hotel. We enjoy our stay here eveytime.

Reviews.Title: “Did not dissapoint”
Reviews.Author: joburg_girl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night 4 day stay at this hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the room was large. The bedding was modern and cute. The room had a flat screen tv as well which was a nice touch, although we did not stay in the room all that much to watch it. Pros: I really liked that this hotel is 2 blocks away from Bourbon street, because we could go and have a good time, but we could return to our room and have some peace and quiet. Cons: I agree with other reviewers that it would have been nice to have a fridge in the room. Our room was also over the the courtyard where the garage is. I am a light sleeper, and the sounds of the cars and the people woke me up early. Overall. I would recommend this hotel. This was my first visit to New Orleans, and it wont be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: TimothyMathis
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I led 13 kids from our church youth group to New Orleans to do post-Katrina clean up and rebuilding. The adults loved the charm and character of the hotel, the kids loved the pool. What makes the Dauphine special, aside from its great location, is the terrific staff. From checkin through checkout, the desk staff, parking staff, etc., were sterling. Whether recommending local eateries or advising regarding travel plans, the folks at the Dauphine Orleans proved knowledgeable, eager and tremendously friendly. I will certainly return and make this my home in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience I've had in a long time”
Reviews.Author: lecadeau100
Reviews.Content: After many years of reading reviews on Tripadvisor.com, I finally felt compelled to register so that I could write a review after staying at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel on a recent business trip. No quarrel with the location right in the French Quarter, but I would not recommend staying here unless you have very low standards. The website photos are deceiving and make this place look like a nice boutique hotel -- wrong! It is small, but it's a dump. My first clue was the lobby, which is small and shabby. When I checked in, the desk clerk was on the phone apparently responding to a complaint by explaining that the hotel was known to be "haunted." Next clue was having to go outside in the parking garage to take the cramped, dark elevator to my room -- not exactly first class. Once I got to my room I unpacked and lay down to rest, only to be disturbed a few minutes later by a man unlocking the door and walking into my room! When I called out, he hastily retreated saying he thought no one had checked in yet! OK, not good. When I left to go to dinner I hung the "do not disturb" sign on the door hoping to make clear that the room was occupied. When I returned later that night the "do not disturb" sign was gone! Then I went into the room and noticed that the door to the balcony was open! Now I was worried and quickly checked to make sure no one was in my room (not exactly the feeling you want in a hotel room). Having found no one, I made sure the balcony door was securely locked. Was the desk clerk right? Was this place really haunted? No, just scarily bad. That night I could not sleep because of all the noise in the parking garage directly below my room. First there was honking, then loud yelling, then someone decided to power wash the floor of the parking garage at 1am. That was the last straw and I called the desk to complain. By now I was really sick of this place. Luckily I was only there for one night or I would have checked out and gone somewhere else. It didn't help that the key to my room failed to work not once, but twice, forcing me to go all the way back to the lobby in the scary elevator. Both times the desk clerk looked puzzled and said they thought I had checked out. Why is it so hard to know when the guests have checked in or out? Besides all of that, the bathroom in my room did not look or smell clean and had little flying insects in the bath (yuck). I would say this hotel depends on the myriad tourists who are either too drunk or hungover to care about clean bathrooms and secure rooms. One couple I encountered in the elevator early the next morning was having cigarettes and diet Coke for breakfast, which I would say typifies the guest at this hotel. So basically if you need a place to pass out after a night of drinking on Bourbon Street, by all means book a room here. Otherwise steer clear of this place and don't be taken in by the attractive photos on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but odd staff and very dirty bathrooms....”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddy1000
Reviews.Content: We like to stay near Bourbon street, but not directly on it, so we chose this hotel as we had never stayed here before and it is about 2 blocks off Bourbon. We booked a deluxe king room in the Herman House, which is a seperate building across the street from the main hotel. The rooms in the Herman house (especially those on the second floor) are relatively small but are very nice - exposed brick, high ceilings with beams, etc. The room itself definitely felt very old school New Orleans (note that the main hotel didn't appear to have this type of feel - we could see drop ceilings and flourescent lighting. It did appear that the rooms around the pool were old school as well. The bathrooms are definitely not old school - look more like a remodel occurred in the 80s with no update since. The bathroom was also pretty much filthy when we arrived. The toilet clearly had not even been wiped down (smudges and stains on the rim) and the bathtub still had wet footprints in it from the previous guest. We mentioned this to the desk clerk on duty on our way out for the day and they seemed genuinely surprised and advised that someone would be right up to clean up the bathroom. No such luck. We came back late and the bathroom was still the same - it was clear that no maid had been in our room to do anything. The next morning, we purposely left a small piece of hair on the rim when we went out. We stopped by and mentioned the bathroom situation to the clerk on duty and once again were advised it would be taken care of. Imagine our surprise when we returned and found the exact same problems. We complained at checkout and the manager who was available then acted somewhat put off by our complaint, actually stating that we hadn't specifically asked for the toilet to be wiped down - Since when is this a special request!?! After 20 minutes of dicussion, we were offered a $20 discount per night and sent on our way. It is also worth noting that you get a couple beer/wine coupons to the next door bar, which used to be a brothel. Neat place, but once again a bit too much of the 80s brass and glass re-do remains. We asked two different bartenders for food recommendations and got the lamest most indiferent attitude imaginable from both of them. The only staff members with any personality or of any real help were the valets. If you are looking for a hotel in a location like this with old school rooms, I'd stay at the St. Marie instead. It has the same location (maybe even a bit better for locating after a long night out on the town), also has a pool, has more charming rooms, and has better staff...

Reviews.Title: “Super Location and price”
Reviews.Author: MayiHelpU
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend in room 237. I booked early and got a rate of $79, when I checked in they offered me a $20 night upgrade to courtyard room in the Hermann House. We took it and worth the money for the King room. The hotel is located 1 block off Bourbon St, a super location and quite at night. You do pay $28 per day in parking. The only thing that keeps this from being 5 stars is the room is smaller than a standard hotel room, but who spends time in the room? The water is SUPER HOT, they have a jetted tub for one. The bed is very comfortable and the AC works, 60 degrees in the room. This hotel will be my first choice on every trip. I have been to NO 27 times and stayed all over town. If you are going to the FQ this is the hotel for two people per room.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elliemay72
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Dauphine. We had a double, which faced Dauphine street and had a balcony. The room was very tastefully decorated in contemporary colors and textiles and the bathroom was clean. We also had a flat screen TV in the room, which was nice. The staff was very nice and helpful, and the grounds are beautiful. We got quite a bit of noise from the street, so if you are a light sleeper you might consider requesting a room away from the street. However, I did not hear any noise from other rooms. You get a coupon for a complimentary drink ticket at May Baily's, the bar that's on the grounds of the Dauphine, which I didn't get to use because I couldn't quite figure out the open hours of the bar. I did use the gym, which was really cute--it was small, but contained an elliptical, bike, treadmill and some dumb bells, as well as towels. All of the equipment was in good working order. The saltwater pool looked very inviting, but again, I didn't get to use it--there is so much to see and do! Overall, it was a very comfortable stay. I would have liked to have some pay per view movies, and it would be nice to have better sound insulation on the balcony doors, but I enjoyed my stay at the Dauphine.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: ArkieFoodie
Reviews.Content: I, too, had done extensive research before choosing the Dauphin Orleans. Although we had been to New Orleans numerous times, I was a bit turned off by some of the reviews at places where we had stayed previously. We loved this hotel -- location, ambience, value/price, cleanliness, and service. We had a larger room in the Herman House across the street. It opened off the courtyard and had a small balcony overlooking the street (much too hot outside to enjoy!), a marble bath, a brick wall on one side, a vaulted ceiling, a mini-fridge, and an incredibly comfortable bed. We did not avail ourselves of the free breakfast since we opted to go to Cafe du Monde for beignets, but we did help ourselves to the free class of wine the evening before in the hotel's bar, which was quite charming. The desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful in recommending restaurants and giving directions. Everyone who worked there had a great attitude of customer service. In fact, when a carpenter/painter saw me struggling to get a suitcase down an outside flight of stairs, he stopped what he was doing and insisted on carrying my bag down the stairs. I couldn't believe it -- what service above and beyond! The only drawback is the lack of elevators -- some rooms are not accessible, so if climbing stairs is an issue, be sure to ask for a room you can get to. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jenjay10
Reviews.Content: After extensive searches on the internet, I decided on the Dauphine Orleans. Their website was accurate in information and pictures, and our stay was everything I expected and more. The hotel is well situated, one block from Bourbon Street, with a pleasant breakfast including fresh fruit and waffles. The rooms in the Herman House extension across from the main hotel were especially large, with lovely bed linens and a quiet, charming courtyard. The pool was small but refreshing. Mae Baileys pub on location was perfect for a quiet gathering spot. The staff was very helpful with tours and dining suggestions. And a lovely touch ~ flags out front ~ as a Canadian, I was glad to see ours!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with lots of character. This will be our 1st choice for future visits”
Reviews.Author: Bugsymutt
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Dauphine Orleans. I was in New Orleans to attend a conference at the Ritz Carlton. My husband was tagging along so we turned it into a semi-vacation, and because he was with me, I didn't want to stay at the Ritz since the location was a bit out of the way, and I wanted more amenities. I spent weeks researching French Quarter hotels on TripAdvisor, other sites, and guidebooks, and decided on the Dauphine Orleans. What a great decision! This was our 4th visit to New Orleans in the past 9 years. Previously we stayed at the Sheraton, W French Quarter, and Omni Royal Orleans. Although the Omni has a slight edge on location, the Dauphine Orleans' rooms are twice the size for half the cost. We were only 3 blocks from the conference, which made for an easy walk to and from. My friends who stayed at the Ritz because they didn't know better visited my room and were a bit jealous... they all said they wished they had booked the Dauphine Orleans instead. They loved the charm and character. I had originally booked a Premium King Carriage House room, but called the hotel a week before my stay to upgrade to a Superior King in the Hermann House courtyard, which is right across the street. Another great decision. We arrived before the stated check-in time but our room was ready. We were in room #236, which is the upper level front room with a very large balcony. Amazing! There is a locked gate leading from Dauphine Street into the courtyard-- guests use their room key to open it. There is no elevator, so if you get a 2nd floor room be prepared to use the stairs. The room was huge! There were brick walls on 2 sides, a vaulted/beamed ceiling, and two doors leading to the balcony. A granite-top vanity was outside the bathroom, which made it easy for both of us to get ready in the morning. There was generous storage space in the vanity's drawers and cabinets. There was a closet with 10 hangers and room for more, plus the safe was in the closet. The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub (we didn't use) and good shower pressure. Towels were soft & fluffy. The room had a fridge, LCD TV, track lighting, and the VERY comfy bed. One of my favorite features of the hotel was the Hermann House courtyard. So lush & tropical! Tables, chairs, and benches were provided, which made it a nice place to read or relax... very quiet. I saw a hot tub in a secluded corner, but it was covered so I'm not sure when it is used. We did not use the pool in the main hotel area, but lots of families were taking advantage of it. We didn't use the exercise room, either. We did, however, enjoy some wine in the hotel bar using the free drink coupons. Nice little place, and we wished we had time to go back again. We ate breakfast two mornings in the hotel's breakfast room. Perfectly fine... my husband always enjoys making waffles, and I thought there was a nice variety of breakfast foods & drinks. All of the hotel staff members were very friendly and helpful... from the front desk staff, to the bartender, to the breakfast host, and the parking attendants we passed. Roger, the reservations rep who helped me with my room selection, was great, as well. Some minor inconveniences to mention... Although I loved the room and the balcony, the balcony doors were less insulating than I'd like, and street noise woke me up a lot. I'm a light sleeper anyway, and used to my quiet street at home... so all the delivery trucks, an occasional laying on the horn, and passing groups of motorcycles were a bit too loud for me. Not the hotel's fault, but I'd probably ask for a room in the back of the building next time, although my husband didn't mind the noise as much. Another minor problem was a lack of hot water on day #2 for me. It was only lukewarm, but got hot for my husband's shower 10 minutes later. Also, the hotel's guest computer was out of service during our stay so we weren't able to check the internet. We didn't bring a laptop to use the free Wifi, but just lived without email for a couple of days. No biggie, but if you absolutely need the lobby's computer you may want to call ahead to make sure it's working. From reading earlier reviews, I had been a little concerned about hordes of smokers congregating in the courtyards, but I didn't encounter this at all. I'm very sensitive to smoke so I would have noticed it. Even the bar didn't have any smokers in it when we were there. So overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Dauphine Orleans! I highly recommend it, and it will be our first choice when visiting New Orleans in the future. (This review was edited to correct the room number... I discovered my mistake after my first review was posted. Since the rooms are unique, I wanted to make sure the correct room number was listed.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasZuggie
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Dauphine Orleans. Our room was great, breakfast was good, and the wi-fi in the rooms worked perfectly. The bed was wonderful. Room clean. The location is pefect, just one block behind Bourbon St. We booked on the hotel website for a four night mid-week stay. For the price, we could have not been more pleased. Our large King room (#330) was on the third floor facing the street with a little balcony with table and chairs. Other posters have stated these rooms can be a little noisy at night, and they're right. But we're good sleepers and it was not a problem. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to others and will return on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL "Service oriented"”
Reviews.Author: ikoiko
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Hotel staff was terrific. Hotel is not new but has plenty of character and charm. Hotel has a great location. We walked all over the French Quarter, Riverwalk area from this location. Hotel room has very comfortable beds and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds, Nice, Quiet Hotel yet close to the Action”
Reviews.Author: LittleBirdie13
Reviews.Content: The beds were fluffy and WONDERFUL! I normally don't sleep well when away from home, but these beds were better than home. I slept like a rock! The hotel is one block from Bourbon Street, so you can enjoy the crazy nightlife of Bourbon Street and retire to your nice, quiet hotel just steps away. The hotel was peaceful and quiet and rumored to have guests of the paranormal kind - - although we didn't experience anything. They had a nice breakfast every morning - nothling extravagant but included fresh fruit, fresh cook- yourself waffles, cereals, grits, juices, coffee, etc. The staff was very nice. If you're driving, there is valet parking for a fee. But, you really don't need a car at this location. You can walk to most places if you have a good pair of comfy shoes, or take the trolley. I wouldn't recommend this for business unless you have your own laptop. The pc in the business center was not working, and when the pc was working, the printer was not. Exercise room was very basic with one elliptical, 2 treadmills, and free weights. They offered cold water, clean towels and apples for guests. In spite of the few pieces of equipment, I had no problem getting time on the equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Been Going to NOLA all my life--DNO my new favorite!”
Reviews.Author: CupcakeToo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Dauphine Orleans that was wayyy too short; it was wonderful! Book from their website, and scroll down, to find great deals. Our AAA rate for the Superior King in the Annex (lovely and quiet) was $82.00; the parking was $28.00 a day, but if you take advantage of the welcome drinks, free afternoon tea, and breakfast, it will just about break even. We travel for my husband's business, and I go along, for fun. The Dauphine's King bed was by far one of the most comfortable we have ever been in--it is downright decadent, with the beautiful duvet, pillows, and comfortable sheets! The air conditioning system worked great--which you need, after walking the Quarter, in the afternoon. There is NONE of the "old" or "left over Katrina" smell at this hotel! While it is "quaint", that does Not mean "shabby and dirty", in Any way! The courtyards and grounds are beautiful, and the patio great for morning coffee and free" USA Today" from the main office. There is a small fridge in each room, and if you push your bottled drinks to the back of it, they will be icy in the morning...ahhhh! There is a small 'grocery' located nearby, so stock up on drinks and snacks! (If you have any room left, after Cajun food, burgers and baked potatoes at Yo Mama's Bar, and a 'special" roast beef sub from Johnny's Subs!! Oinkworthy!) I called the hotel directly, and talked to a very nice man. Roger. I asked for a specific room that had been recommended here on TA, but not by room number. I described it to him, and he reserved exactly that room for us: Number 2414--upper floor,last one on the galley porch; with No noise of any kind at night. You'll love the exposed brick and antique style carpet in the room..along with a great flat screen tv and wireless...the perfect combo of old and new! The location is also Great; one street off of Bourbon, so you can walk to everything easily. The next time we go to N.O., we will definitely be staying at the DNO! The staff was friendly and helpful as well, and the little pool great for relaxing in, about 3pm, after a hot day enjoying the sights! Romantic, friendly staff ,excellent location, and heavenly beds...all at a great price...and a free little breakfast that was Plenty to start the day..til you make it down to Cafe DuMonde, that is! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: mssbkp
Reviews.Content: We had a WONDERFUL experience at the Dauphine. We had a room in the building across the street. The courtyard was beautiful, the room was perfectly clean and well appointed, and we were never bothered with noise from other rooms. The front desk folks were very helpful, even offering the hotel computer when I needed to print our boarding passes for the flight home. The breakfast was more than adequate and the pool looked great--we just never had enough time to use it! We highly recommend the Dauphine. Its location is perfect--the heart of the French Quarter without the craziness of Bourbon Street. Also, while we had concerns about safety in New Orleans, we always felt comfortable at the Dauphine and in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: HappyWandererHouston
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New Orleans and we pretty much picked this one in the dark but we were very happy with the choice. Whatever room rate you get factor in in $28 for parking if you drive here but after that the nightlife is 2 minutes walk and we had no issues with noise at the time of our stay. The room was clean and more than acceptable in standard and the small pool is good enough for a relaxing dunk after your indulgences. The bar is adjacent to the pool so if you hate cigarette smoke you will not like the continual stream of smokers dipping out for a quick one by the pool but I had no issue with that. Harrahs casino is open 24 hours and close on Canal Street and is a good visit but we only stayed 2 nights so did not venture far from Bourbon Street or the casino. Would definately use the Dauphin again though.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Revisit!”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl2161
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to New Orleans for the first time in May, and we had no idea where to stay. After checking Trip Advisor, Travelocity and Travelzoo, we found a "3 nights for the price of 2" special running for the Dauphine Orleans Hotel. We figured for that deal we could face whatever we got. Boy, were we surprised! We LOVED the hotel! Our room on the third floor was clean and well air conditioned (a welcome treat after a long day sightseeing), and the housekeeping service was prompt when we requested more towels. The two ladies that worked at the front desk during our stay were happy to recommend places to eat; they also mailed off our postcards for us and answered any questions we had. The breakfast is fantastic--freshly cut strawberries and cantaloupe each morning, along with bagels and cream cheese, assorted danish, cereal, oatmeal, and (my favorite) freshly made Belgian waffles. What a great way to start the day off! The pool was small and used salt water, but it was very pleasant after a hot day walking around New Orleans. The courtyard is attractive and filled with palm trees. I didn't have the same experience that another reviewer had--that the smokers took over the courtyard. Yes, there was the occasional smoker, but usually they were courteous and stepped to the side away from others. The bar attached to the hotel is quaint--full of dark panelling and old New Orleans charm. Great location: just two blocks off Bourbon Street, and three blocks from Royal Street. Very quiet street, but close enough to the action if you want it. VERY expensive parking (like all hotels in New Orleans, so try to avoid bringing a car into the French Quarter if at all possible). I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ralphy57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here May 24-29. The room was quite comfortable, plenty of hangers for our clothes. The bathroom was big, nice little amenities,hair dryer included. The bed was a king and very cushy. We had a balcony overlooking the pool and city buildings, I pulled the room chair out there and enjoyed the view. We did use the pool one afternoon to cool off, they could use a couple more lounge chairs but space is limited. The free continental breakfast consists of waffles,fruit,cereal, assorted breads, coffee,juice and milk. It was a good start to the morning. They charge $28 a day for car parking. We received two complimentary drink coupons to Mae Bailey's bar, beer or wine only, I drink neither, maybe they could add something else. There is free internet use in the lobby which we used. As far as nightly noise, we never heard any.Dauphine Orleans is one block from Bourbon St, the walk is so easy.Many bars and restaurants and shopping are close by.The best part about this hotel is the front desk manager Ryan, from wake up calls, to daily chit chat, advise, this man is superb. If we did make a return trip to NO, we would stay here again. Ryan, thanks for making our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Misleading...”
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey M
Reviews.Content: The hotel lists no smoking rooms - this much is true. Unfortunately, the smoking areas are all around the pools and courtyards. So give up the pool if you want a swim, there's too many desperate smokers sucking down butts to even allow access if you're the least bit bothered by smoking. The other bad part is that the only access to some of the rooms is through the courtyard - which was where our room was. To get to and to exit your room - you have to run a gauntlet of smokers. The other part was that you're awakened at 7:30AM by screaming brats who are tearing around the pool and their parents who don't care. Oh, and the drunk, loud people late into the night - just adds flavor to an already spoiled dish. Not a single thing is mentioned about the "day care center" around the pool. The website only shows how nice it looks. Overall, the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JennieCain
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean. The beds were great. The breakfast was adequate. The courtyard(s) were lovely and the price was right! This is where I will stay when I come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Great Staff, Very Comfortable Beds! Quiet, too!”
Reviews.Author: mimiwiz
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 days, and LOVED the Dauphine. Walking distance to everything, right in the thick of the French Quarter, one street removed from Bourbon, but quiet, quaint, and very comfortable beds! Lots of great pillow, too, which I love. The salt water pool was very refreshing, and a great courtyard for relaxing. May Baily's Bar served excellent Hurricanes! The staff was so friendly, great about giving privacy, very helpful when needed. When the complimentary computer wasn't working, staff helped guests print boarding passes, check email, and gave great service overall. I loved my stay here, and would stay here again, and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location, clean, comfortable, quiet!”
Reviews.Author: oakhillstraveler
Reviews.Content: Our room was very quiet. We were on the 4th floor, main building in the back. The Temperpedic beds were great. The hotel is recently renovatated, clean and the staff is friendly. Rooms are small but charming. Flat screen TV. Lovely pool area. A perfect location, one block from Bourbon and since we were on the north side of the hotel, very quiet. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: cgchica
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservation on priceline and got a very decent price. It did not mention that there was a $28 per night valet parking fee, but this was not unreasonable for the location. The breakfast was decent and the room was nice. It was a little noisy at night, but that can be expected since it was only a block off of Bourbon Street. (I agree with my wife, I want to add that the breakfast was GREAT and had everything you need. What was wrong? Nothing much--the hotel building was a little old, but it was built in the 1700's. Not a problem. Bed was comfy, shower was hot. We really enjoyed our stay. Take it from us--stay here! I am very picky and I liked it).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: queenb4090
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for in our price range. It had an authenic old New Orleans look and feel with close proximity to Bourbon St. The free breakfast was adequate but nothing fancy. Everything was clean and the service was great. The elevator is a little scary, but it did its job none the less. Overall this was a great place to stay if you want something close to everything, I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ER2552
Reviews.Content: I like to stay in a hotel that has character and the Dauphine certainly does. It 's location is perfect for walking the wonderful, historic streets of New Orleans by day and Bourbon street for the night life. Our room was modest but we did not plan to spend much time there anyway. The hotel offered parking tho a few blocks away, it was convenient. I always look forward to going to New Orleans and i'll be back to the Dauphine when I do.

Reviews.Title: “happy we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: voodoodoll
Reviews.Content: we booked here for our honeymoon and it was a good decision. location is close to everything in the french quarter. the front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. upon arrival, i wasn't satisfied with our first room, due to a small stain on the bed sheet. the sweet woman at the front desk had me check out more rooms and went out of her way to make sure we were happy. the 3rd room i saw we took, it was spacious & modern with super-comfortable beds and large bathroom. she totally understood the whole wanting a perfect honeymoon room and also sent us a bottle of champagne. complimentary breakfast in the breakfast room was good, lots of selection, though it would be nice if they switched to real plates/cups, instead of disposable. coming from toronto, where we recycle everything, it was strange to see styrofoam! (i ended up rinsing and re-using my plastic cups). some other people have complained about the elevators, but we quite liked them and felt they gave the place extra character. the old hotel bar also had character, very nice bar staff, and the hotel gives you a voucher for a complimentary drink upon arrival. it's supposed to be haunted and we heard some cool ghost stories! we drank there a few times on our way out or in, as it is a very cool bar that even the locals go to. we had booked into another hotel for the weekend, thinking about having a change of scenery, but ended up cancelling at the other place after checking in (due to lack of customer service because of several weddings going on) and ended up returning to the dauphine for the remainder of our stay. our second room was smaller than the first, but still very spacious with a private balcony. we were so happy to be back after a few hours at the other place. we really liked the laid back vibe, though 'stuffier' types might not. we would definately stay here again! it is seriously in the best location in the french quarter...

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berkana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a hotel in New Orleans that would deliver the charm that the city is known for. I had been to Nola once before, when I was sixteen, but he had never been there before, and I wanted him to feel the magic I remembered the city for. We chose the Dauphine because the descriptions and pictures looked like the kind of traditional hotel we wanted. Upon arrival, however, we were dissapointed to find that they were renovating. Our room was newly renovated, beautiful and very clean. Unfortunately, it was very modern and not exactly what we were looking for. After passing construction workers in the hall several times and walking past the "Please excuse our mess" signs several times, we decided to ask for a different room. She was very happy to show us another option, and we immediately fell in love. The large room was separate from the regular hotel rooms, and looked out into a beautiful area. It had it's own separate entrance and large balcony. The room was large, the bathroom was huge and it was gorgeous. There was also a small wet bar and small refrigerator. Unfortunately, New Orleans in August is stifling, and our air conditioner stopped working our third night. We called several times to have it looked at, and after getting it going again, it again broke. They explained that they couldn't fix it, and offered to move us to another room. This time we were moved to another incredibly private room above Mae Bailey's, the hotel bar. This room was incredibly large in size, had two separate bathrooms (a ladies and a gentleman's, the ladies had a large tub and dressing table area, the gentleman's held the sink, toilet and shower) as well as a huge walk-in closet and a second decent-sized closet. I don't recommend the room to non-smokers, as although you are not permitted to smoke in the room, it reeks of stale smoke. My husband and I attributed this to the fact that it was located directly above the bar. There was no refrigerator in this room, and the staff member who assisted our move offered to attempt to find one to bring up, though we declined the offer. In all, we loved the hotel, though I must say that we were not impressed with the staff overall. One employee was incredibly helpful - unfortunately, she was rarely there. They did give us a complimentary bottle of Champagne in celebration of our marriage (it stated on their site that this was included for all honeymooners), though we had to ask for it. While there isn't an on-site restaurant, there are many within a short walking distance. The hotel is in a great location, right in the French Quarter, but is far enough from Bourbon Street that the noise doesn't really reach the area. The hotel did offer a breakfast (I believe it was $6 per person). They serve it in a little room off of the outdoor area where the pool is located. It's incredibly informal, and things like fresh fruit bagels, toast, waffles, cereal, yogurt, croissants, were offered. The staff places the items there, but it is self serve, and there are toasters, etc. there as well if you choose to have a toasted english muffin, etc. Also, I recall there being orange juice, coffee and milk. The beds were incredibly comfortable (I still intend to call and find out what kind of mattresses they have on those beds!). The pool is not large, though it is a quaint little hotel with lots of charm. Take a look at the pictures, and you will see how lovely it really is.

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine Orleans is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkieDenver
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel. What a find! It is a block from Bourbon St in the French Quarter and surprisingly quiet. Upon arrival, my group of six (three rooms) were upgraded to the patio rooms across the street from the main hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly and suggested restaurants in the area. We used our key to access the courtyard. The rooms surrounded the courtyard with doors and shuttered windows. We had a very spacious room with exposed brick wall and beams on the ceiling. There was a large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and bathrobes. The bed had a very comfortable memory foam mattress. Everything was very clean. There was a happy hour shortly after we arrived and we enjoyed a free drink over by the pool. We had an easy walk around the French Quarter and had a great dinner at Landry's followed by beignets at Cafe du Monde. In the morning there is a breakfast with a variety of choices including make your own waffles, yogurt, fruit, juices and coffee and breads and cereals. The history of the hotel is fun with a past of brothel and hospital. There is some documentation of hauntings. This is also the property where John Audubon completed his famous "Birds of America" series. I would not hesitate recommending this property or returning to it. There was nothing I didn't love.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: academic81
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in room 307. It's a reasonably nice hotel, with extremely(!!!) friendly staff. Nice room, huge flatpanel tv, nice bathroom. Figuring out how to turn on the shower took me ten minutes and a call to the lobby though, hahaha, delicate mechanism. But great water pressure etc. They keep it very clean. Breakfast is a plus, self-service including waffle maker etc., tons of things to choose from, only downside all plastic cups plates etc... but well that's the US I guess. Great location in the heart of the french quarter. Nice little courtyard with pool.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Dauphine Orleans, BUT. . .”
Reviews.Author: Dee52NY
Reviews.Content: if they put you in a room over the parking garage ask them to move you! The noise coming up from the interior car park is awful. The concrete acts like an echo chamber, and since the elevators are off the parking garage you hear every car door slam, argument between the valets and drunks coming in late. Having said that, the hotel is nice- room and bath recently refurbished, very clean, and the location is great for seeing the French Quarter and a few blocks from the St Charles streetcar.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Christmas week and got a great rate for a deluxe room. Check in was no problem, room was really great. HUGE, I mean really big with room for at least 3 king sized beds. Had a sitting area, desk, nice updated finishes, plasma TV, nice updated bathroom as well. Even though many New Orleans visitors will tell you, you only need a room to sleep, if you can get a nice room, it just enhances the trip that much more. Property is very pretty, well maintained courtyard with a small pool and a small gym. Courtyard was very nice for just having morning coffee or a glass of wine after dinner. They serve a pretty basic Costco type continental breakfast which is a nice plus, but just beware of hungry families on the rampage for free food in the morning. Not everyone remembers manners when it comes to free danish, I guess. Still, a nice touch. They have a hotel bar called May Baileys, you get a free drink coupon when you check in. The coupon is ONLY good for beer or wine, no longer good for mixed drinks. While a nice touch, seems a little stingy. The bar is a nice little locals place. Went there a couple of times and it was mostly empty. This is not really a FULL SERVICE hotel, i.e. no concierge, doorman or room service, but when you need help, everyone is more than willing. Also WIFI is FREE!! And it worked fine. This will normally bump your stay by 10 or 15 bucks a day at a bigger hotel. Maid service was great, they respected my do not disturb signage all week until I emerged around noon each day. About the only minor, I mean really minor thing I didn't like was the ugly elevators. They are in really bad shape HOWEVER they work great, they just look like crap! Location is great, a block away from Bourbon but no noise issues at all. I would absolutely recommend this place for anyone looking for really good value.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the French Quarter --- good and bad”
Reviews.Author: paradigmwg
Reviews.Content: The only negative I had with the Dauphine is the $28 per day valet parking charge. I was unaware of this level of a charge until I arrived (it was not mentioned on the Priceline page). That said, I got a fantastic price from Priceline (only $62 per night) so all-in-all, price was great. We were immediately greeted very positively by the parking valet who offered to tell us about the best places in town. The hotel is old (of course) and is located in the heart of the French Quarter just one block off Bourbon Street. Even so, it was quiet and very subdued and most of the people we saw were in our age group (50-60). Check in was very quick and courteous and we were in our room on the 3rd floor in a matter of minutes. Even with the Priceline pricing, we did receive a King Room (nice). The room was very clean and comfortable - lots of pillows - and a good A/C system. The bath was dated but still very functional. The flat screen TV was a nice touch and free internet is something that many hotels actually charge for (and it was actually high speed). May Bailey's (the bar located on the first floor) was a bit overrated - at least the night we stopped in. The drinks were done well but fairly pricey and the server was disinterested ..... took a while to get her attention and then even longer to get her attention a second time. By the time we were able to get her attention, we had pretty much given up on having a second drink. Breakfast is free but very basic (pretty much what you'd find in any mid-class motel). with strawberries and cantaloupe as the fresh fruit, bagels, toast, some cereal, and one waffle maker. There was plenty of fresh orange juice and coffee (both important!). The room was surprisingly quiet except for our last night there when people above us decided to simply throw their trash off their balcony rather than in the trash but that's not the hotel's fault. Our first night there was also our first night in Orleans (ever) and, frankly, our walk from the hotel to Bourbon Street was a little scary. Dauphine Street is dark as is the connector street to Bourbon Street (St. Louis). As the evenings went on, it became much less so and everyone we passed or came across seemed pretty friendly and normal. I'm not sure I would have been comfortable walking around too late when the crowds went down but I guess that would be the case in any city. Overall, I'm glad we stayed in the French Quarter ..... definitely worth the money we paid on Priceline!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dauphine!”
Reviews.Author: acraftydiva
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days prior to a cruise and couldn't be happier with the Dauphine Orleans! The rooms have recently been remodeled and everything was clean and bright. The location could not be better! Just 1 block off Bourbon but with none of the noise! The complimentary breakfast was a great way to start the day. The staff was eager to help in any way they could. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: EstiloM
Reviews.Content: A cozy boutique hotel with friendly staff - Don the Bellman is a wonderful resource for info on local restaurants and nightspots. Our room was clean and comfortable with a marble bathroom, however there were a couple of issues: (1) the air-conditioning - we had to turn it down every night; and (2) Our room was located over the parking garage which proved to be a source of undesireable late night noise, with car doors slamming and raucous laughter as revelers returned to the hotel after a night of partying. This took place from approx. 2:00 a.m. - 5:00 a.m. (note: this occurred on the weekend, Friday and Saturday night; we were not disturbed by late noise during the week). If you're a light sleeper, be sure to request a room that does not face the parking garage. Renovation of the hotel is almost complete. The final upgrade will be the elevators, which are in dire need of a makeover. Amenities include a swimming pool and fitness center, replete with eliptical and cycling equipment however, there is only one treadmill, and it was in high demand during our stay. Complimentary breakfast is served daily and although the menu is limited, it included fresh fruit which was a plus. In addition, the hotel has two lovely courtyards; a great place to enjoy a cup of coffee or do some reading. In spite of the minor issues mentioned previously, we found the Dauphine Orleans to be a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GracieTess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to New Orleans every November and meet 15-20 friends to celebrate birthdays!! We have stayed at various hotels in the French Quarter and found the Dauphine to be great. Our room was clean, had a small balcony overlooking Dauphine, and the hotel has the cutest little courtyard perfect for morning coffee. It was a little noisy but that is the norm in the French Quarter. Staff was friendly and the hotel is in a terrific location for walking about the city. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly quiet for the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: julony
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans is an oasis of tranquility, given its proximity to Bourbon Street. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful, the rooms were large and the beds super-comfortable. There is no restaurant as such but the complementary buffet breakfast was perfectly adequate. In any case, who dines in a hotel in New Orleans? On the other hand, the bar puts to shame many of its competitors, both in terms of value for money ambience and elegance of decor. And how nice to see bar staff that are friendly and competent. Add to this free access to the Internet and you can see why the Dauphine is so busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great people...”
Reviews.Author: nickey7194
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute getaway to New Orleans and found the Dauphine to be simple but elegant. We stayed on the second floor in a deluxe king-bed room which was perfect. The only con was the view of the garage but if you ask for a courtyard view I am sure they may oblige. It is one block from Bourbon St. and about six from Decatur St. and Jackson Square. Each staff member from front desk to security was very pleasant, all quality employees. Price was a bit steep but the accomodations and perks made it very worth while. We will return in the future...

Reviews.Title: “Hated The Hotel They Even Had Us Arrested For Talking To Loud”
Reviews.Author: tabbikat2219
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel was dirty and the rooms were not up to the standards in the pictures or as promised. We had to ask each day for our room to be cleaned housekeeping complained they didnt have any towels to do so. On our second night there after returning from dinner we came back and there were other ppls possessions on our balcony and cameras missing from our room. We called the desk they called the police who wouldnt even write a reoprt. So we emailed a complaint to the manager since he never was available. That same night as we packed to leave we had our balcony open one of us was out on it the other in the bathroom. We were talking back and forth. Security came to our room and said we were being to loud we apologized. 5 minutes later sherriffs showed up took us put in our nightgowns and arrested us for disturbing the peace. After a hellacious nightmare of 20 ours long we returned to gather out belongings which the hotel had thrown into garbage bags to find our money missing. They offered to call the police again. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. We are two women in our thirtys who were doing nothing wrong but made a complaint and they took revenge on us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChillyMutt
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and friendly staff. Room was nice and recently renovated. Paid $79/nt.

Reviews.Title: “The Dauphine Orleans is Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jimmycyzinski
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the Dauphine Orleans based on the reviews I read here on Tripadvisor. I did a lot of research to find the best room for the best deal in the French Quarter...I'm convinced I found it! Over the last few years, my rooms at other hotels in NOLA/French Quarter were extremely run down and somewhat grungy. Comfort, cleanliness, and aesthetic appeal were most important for me in finding a hotel this time. I booked our room by calling the hotel directly and I asked specifically for one of their newly renovated rooms. What they gave us was a Deluxe Main House King on the 4th floor. After we arrived, I spoke with a hotel employee and from what I understand, the entire main house is almost completely renovated. They were painting and putting finishing touches on the second floor while we were there. Our room was great...better than I expected. It was extremely clean and crisp. The decor is a nice blend of traditional and contemporary, all done in neutral colors. I usually don't walk barefoot in hotel rooms, but this place was so clean and the carpet was so soft, I had no problem doing it. As stated by other reviewers, the bed with Tempur-Pedic mattress was amazing. My husband and I spent several hours on the road before arriving and the mattress was just heaven to help us relax. The flat screen TV was a bonus, too. From the pictures I had seen posted here, I was a little worried about the bathroom being too cramped. It was small, but not at all bad. The layout was functional, but not much beyond that. Again...very clean. The other pluses for this hotel: friendly, helpful staff, free wireless internet, complimentary continental breakfast, complimentary drink at May Bailey's, on-site parking (about $30 per day), and a quiet location. This is a great hotel and a great bargain. I have finally found my favorite place to stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a couple of problems related to renovations...”
Reviews.Author: thebeerhunter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in July 2008. The hotel is currently undergoing construction. We were assured it would not affect the hotel guests in any way. This was slightly untrue -- unless you got up at 8AM, and you happened to be on the third floor while they were renovating the room right beneath you, and using jackhammers, you were going to be affected. We were awakened by construction noise each day. We couldn't change rooms, as the hotel was fully booked for the Essence festival. Still, our room, which had been renovated, was quite nice. The beds were very comfortable, with lots of pillows, and apparently topped with a Tempurpedic mattress pad. The air conditioning was very strong, and you could turn it down VERY low, which was wonderful! There was a nice wall-mounted flat screen TV. The bathroom, though small, was nicely appointed, and the lotion, shower gel, and conditioner on offer were of good quality, and in larger sizes than usual for hotels.
