The hotel has its own parking garage, though small, and depending on how busy they are it might take a while to get your car, as there only seems to be one person managing getting cars at a time. The elevators are outside, and not air conditioned...so the ride up to your floor can produce some sweat! The little bar connected to the hotel, May Bailey, is a nice little place that offers some free "snacks" from 5-7pm weekdays -- cheese and crackers, etc. It seems to be a local place, we saw regulars there each day. Bartenders were very friendly. all in all, we would stay here again if the price was right -- but would definitely make sure all construction is completed before coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Location Without Noise of Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: sdsansky
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay to include airfare and hotel for 4 nights at the Dauphine Orleans through Bookit.com at a great price. As with all other guests our room rate included 2 complimentary cocktails in May Baileys, continental breakfast and USA Today each day. Check-in: Fast and easy. The person who checked us in was quite nice. Our room keys came in a little pouch that opened up to a map of the French Quarter which was very handy. Our room: We had a king room on the 4th floor. The room was clean and simply decorated to our tastes. Flat screen LG TV mounted to the wall across from the bed, free wired or wireless internet access. The bed and pillows were VERY comfortable. Our room faced another building but that was ok. We weren't there to look out the window. The bathroom was clean and had extra towels, washclothes, bath products and a bath robe. There was minimal drawer space in the room so keep that in mind, you will need to hang most things up and may need more hangars. We were ok as we were not doing anything too dressy so it wasn't an issue. The internet access worked but was a bit slow. That was ok for the most part as it was free and wireless. There was an inroom coffee maker which we didn't utilize. The A/C was perfect for us, the bedding was clean our room was done up each day. No problem with our comfort in the room. The Breakfast: I have read mixed reviews of the breakfast. I agree with them. It was included so we did eat at it 3 of the 4 days. The breakfast room was always clean and there were more than enough tables. I think I counted seats for at least 25 people, plus more tables under umbrellas right outside the door by the pool. The food was what you expect for a free continental. You could make your own waffles out of batter (not frozen). Fresh cut fruit, really good mint tea and coffee was good. Ass't breads for toasting, cereal. Was supposed to be yogurt but it was never stocked when I went. I think that the breakfast attendant DOES stock and restock unlike what other reviewers have said, but the food is kind of all on top of each other in one little spot I think it was just as hard for her to stock as it was for us to get to the food. You were kind of on top of each other as you made toast and someone reached for cereal etc. The common areas: Far and away the worst part of the hotel was the elevators. They worked but are in a poor state-the wood paneling is coming off the interior, the floor tiles are cracked, they are dirty and the feel like they may be on their last legs. We never got stuck or anything but I always breathed a sigh of relief that we didn't. As they are redoing the hotel I hope the elevators are part of it. The hallway on our floor was always clean, quite and well lit. The lobby was small-as others have said. It was clean and pretty and it was a lobby. Who cares if it isn't a hot spot to hang out in? If you are going all the way to New Orleans to hang out in a hotel lobby that is your first problem! Swimming Pool-we never got around to using it but it was always clean, stocked with fluffy towels and it looked inviting to me. Just couldn't fit it in. May Baileys-We went for our free drinks, it looked like we had just missed a happy hour with cheese and some hot food. The bartender was very friendly, the mixed drink was great and my husband liked the Abita beer which is local. As some places are pricey for drinks it was nice to have one on them. We did not use the parking garage, but I am sure it was fine. Location: We were around the corner from the heart of Bourbon Street. We never heard a thing though. The hotel was extremely quiet and that was great for sleeping in. We were a 1 minute walk to Bourbon, a 10 minute walk to Canal Street or St. Charles. Very centrally located. This is a boutique style hotel so if you are looking for the sameness of a Marriott or other chain this isn't for you. (Don't get me wrong, I stay in Marriotts all the time but a city like New Orleans deserves something a little different) If you need room service and a big lavish lobby look elsewhere. If you want a quiet spot that is pretty and comfortable after a long day touring or a long night drinking then the Dauphine Orleans is a great spot for you. I was pleased with the hotel and would recommend it again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LouiseAl
Reviews.Content: I admit that it is now four years since I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel and that things, management, rooms etc may have changed. So bear that in mind when reading my review. We arrived in New Orleans Louis Armstrong Airport early evening and used the airport shuttle to take us into town. The driver knew exactly where the hotel was and was able to point out some interesting places for us along the way - Bourbon Street, Harrah's Casino etc ;-) We had booked our room through the hotel's website and everything was okay when we arrived. We got a nice room overlooking the parking lot, which did not give us any problems during our stay. We also got vouchers for the hotel bar. After a quick stroll on Bourbon, only a block away from the hotel, we went to bed in the wonderful soft beds. The room also had a big tv and a large and clean bathroom and an aircon which worked with no problems. We also had a special air-cleaning unit as it was a smoking room, but the air-cleaning unit did it's job and we were not able to smell any smoke at all while there. The breakfast and coffee was good and we also enjoyed the small pool. A big plus as we were in New Orleans in August and it was very, very hot and humid. All staff were friendly and we liked the free car whose driver took us to Harrah's at night. We felt that the hotel was very good value for money and had a wonderful location in The Frech Quarter for the things we wanted. I would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dauphine! Great room Great price!”
Reviews.Author: Infinityimage18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dauphine from June 10 to the 16th. I was worried after reading several reviews about the staff and the overall condition of the hotel (as many have said as well) but it turned out to be wonderful! I was on the 4th floor in room 404 which is newly renovated and that floor is complete, the 3rd floor was under renovation but we heard no construction noise our entire stay (they are not renting out the unrenovated rooms). The air in our room worked perfectly, which let me tell you after walking around in 90 degree weather all day it was quite nice to come back to a very chilled room! The bathroom is updated (see pictures) with full marble (this was a standard double bed room). It has tempurpedic mattresses which mold to your body after a few min of laying down and a flat screen tv for your viewing enjoyment. Maid service was great except for one day when we slept in until almost 11 (long night on bourbon) and they skipped our room, but with one call to the front desk we had fresh towels and bed linens at our door in minutes. Valet parking was marginal, we had to wait numerous times for the parking attendant to show up, even with that problem I do recommend the service because street parking is horrible and you cant find a spot nearby thats longer than 2hr parking. They have a continental breakfast that is very good but be warned, get there before 10 (it goes till 11) because they don't restock anything, so when the last bagel is gone, its gone and thats it.....I recommend just doing brunch at a restaurant nearby. The grounds are wonderful and the pool area is clean but small. The bar is dark and outdated but great for your free drink voucher that you get upon arrival. The hotel is within walking distance to everything the French Quarter has to offer as well as the riverwalk, harrahs casino, and the aquarium/imax. It is a very family friendly hotel and it felt very safe for our stay. The elevators do open up to the parking garage and they do smell of gas, but what do you expect? it opens up to the garage! Space is very limited in this city. The lobby is upscale and the lady's behind the front desk are nice and helpful. This was a very nice boutique hotel that has charm which a run of the mill holiday inn or best western just don't have. I plan to stay here again on my 2nd visit to NOLA next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: 2floridians
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and the price was right! The location was very good. They are currently doing some renovation work, but our room was completed. It was very clean, well kept. We had no complaints. Renovations were going on at about 10 a.m. during the week, so if you want to sleep in during the week, it may not be condusive. The hotel is one block away from Bourbon St. There was music from nearby businesses late at night but nothing too outrageous. Breakfast included hot waffles. All in all, it was super!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Butt”
Reviews.Author: king20462000
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were very nice. Nevertheless the last thing you want to hear at 5:00am is the staff taking out the garbage it sounded 20 min. like a train wreck every morning. Don't stay on the side with the parking garge view the noise is constent. I party with the best and go to bed at 3:00 3:30 or at least I tried. This does not even count the construction that starts at 8:00am every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Totally overrated - don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: viatie73
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on all of the positive reviews I found on tripadvisor and I was very disappointed. The first room they put us in had dirty, damp carpet and smelled of mildew. They did move us to a "premium" room at no extra cost, but the premium room was simply a bigger room with slightly updated carpet and the same outdated furnishings and dingy linens. The front desk staff was decent and the pool area was pleasant, but everything else was just really bad. Both elevators broke down while we were there and the breakfast was terrible. All of the food was tasteless and cheap and they served it all on paper plates and with plastic silverware. Don't bother - there are a lot better options in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk, away from this place”
Reviews.Author: je23
Reviews.Content: Arguably, one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in in my entire liife. 1 cockroach in the room, a TV remote gone missing, a leaky (and loud) A/C unit that leaked water all over the bathroom floor, an elevator that should be condemned, a desk staff that is amazingly unhelpful and unremorseful, an amazingly dingy room, the weakest hair-dryer ever assembled. It's not just us -- every time we get into the elevator, we hear tales of other complaints (no phone in one room, light bulbs out). Trust me - this is NOT 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: CarolynIthaca
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, we were nervous about staying here, but some were really good and we found that most hotels had about the same overall rating - some good some bad, yada yada. Also, we figured that most hotels in the french quarter had been affected by Katrina and would be dingy and water damaged. This was not at all the case. We learned that Katrina flooding landlocked the french quarter but it didn't flood, so the buildings were not damaged there. We found the staff to be welcoming (not effusive, but polite, professional and very helpful). The small courtyard was lovely (weather was unseasonably cold for us to use the pool. And we were lucky and bold enough to ask for a newly rennovated room They gladly switched us from the second floor to 417 in the main building. It was lovely - everything brand new, bedding, furniture, flat screen tv. Soft towels, a robe and comfy beds. We never used the coffee maker (a pod style 2 cuper) because the coffee at breakfast (available 6:30 to 11) was delish & strong. Breakfast was simple so we made peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. They also had hard boiled eggs, croissants, juice and sometimes belgian waffles. Free wireless connection was powerful & easy to use. Guest computer in the lobby is connected to the office printer and the staff gladly retrieved maps & tickets we needed to print. We used the in room safe for our valubles, even our laptops. One Macbook and a 15" dell lattitude which I was able to gently cram in after removing the battery. Honestly, I did not get the feeling we needed to use the safe, but well, just to be safe, we did. We highly recommend it and will return. Also a tip: We rented bikes instead of a car and were very happy about that decision. The traffic in the French Quarter (esp in the evening) is miserable. Getting bikes into the elevator and the room was a tight squeeze but better and far cheaper than dealing with parking. Lots of cyclists in New Orleans - very few seem to follow rules of the road. We highly recommend Michael's Bicycles on Frenchman. It's walking distance from the hotel, bikes were worn but in great shape, staff was informative & friendly. Note they are closed on Weds.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Lodging and Location”
Reviews.Author: eroc38
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from New Orleans and enjoyed our stay at Dauphine. Here are a few of the key pluses for the hotel: 1) Location!!! One block over from Bourbon. This made it nice and easy to go back and change clothes or shoes, take a quick rest, open the window to hear the music. 2) Amenities!! Flatscreen LCD TVs, newly remodeled rooms, beautiful bathroom, and terrific Air Conditioning (trust me this is needed!). 3) One minute walk to our new favorite restaurant on the planet (no joke)! Make sure you stop at Jager-Haus which is located on Conti in between Bourbon and Dauphine. It is the most authentic German food and the beer selection there is really eclectic compared to the Miller and Bud that you have to drink on Bourbon. A nice change of pace from the Gumbo and Cajun. Check out my review on this restaurant. We were so thuroughly impressed by it! 4) Service at the front desk was OK, but the help in the garage (hailing taxis, setting up tours, making recommendations), was second to none! This is a solid pick when in the French Quarter, close enough to everything, but removed just enough not to have to deal with all of the drunk noise at 3:00 in the morning! We slept like babies and you will too! OH, the price was terrific too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dauphine Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jcame54250
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I found this hotel! My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay and we will definitely return. Staff was friendly and efficient. Several small problems were fixed immediately. We got free drink vouchers for May Baileys Pub. There is free internet access in the lobby and I was told that WiFi will be available soon. We had a standard king room that felt spacious and was immaculately clean. Mattress was VERY comfortable. Bathroom was marbled with a full tub and strong shower. Full continental breakfast is served in a cafe area downstairs or you can eat in the courtyard under an umbrella. Very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: smithtk
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans is my favorite place to stay in NOLA. I have tried different hotels the last couple of trips I have taken and have wished I had just stuck with the Dauphine. I have only stayed in the rooms in the courtyard across the street from the main building and they are fantastic. It feels private, looks beautiful, and is quiet although it is only a block from Bourbon Street. The only reason I did not rate the hotel as excellent is that we have had wet carpet from a plumbing leak in the past - older building with some issues. We tolerated the problem because we love the place, but others might not.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Euro style in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: macwacks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend business trip, as an alternative to the over-priced conference hotel three blocks away. I was looking for a quiet location off Bourbon in the Quarter, which offered comfort & some amenities at a fair price. I enjoyed my stay here very much & would recommend it to others w/ similar tastes. (I don't like chain hotels & good coffee is a must!) I was in a king bed room w/ a small balcony, overlooking the parking garage. The bed's memory foam mattress---VERY sweet! Marble tiling and filtered water in the bathroom were nice, too. The place was clean & also puts on a great complimentary breakfast, free wireless (but only in the common areas downstairs), and a sweet courtyard with tables for enjoying your hot waffles & fruit while you check your email. This place is just one block off Bourbon St., but I was glad my room was well-screened from the din--it gets old after the first night. Jackson Square and the Cafe du Monde are about six blocks away. If you didn't already know, you don't need a car to navigate the French Quarter--best to leave it elsewhere, since parking is pricey. But don't miss the chance to tour the neighborhoods still damaged by Katrina. It's not pretty, but necessary to understand NOLA today.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel when you factor it all in.”
Reviews.Author: metnav87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night of Dec 1, 07. I made reservations over the phone and got a two double bed room for 63$. Upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was extremely courteous and friendly.. Check in was a breeze with no problems. I did get a bit of a surprise, hotel parking is $28 a day. But it is very convenient to the hotel. The room was very clean but the room was very "lived in". The carpet and walls could stand to be redone. The bathroom was very nice with a full tub and updated fixtures. The hotel location is perfect if you are in town for the french quarter, it is only one block to bourbon street. I was there for a saints game and the superdome was only about a 25 minute walk. In conclusion when you consider several things... The Location The condition of all the hotels in that area The price and the staff, this hotel is the best in my opinion. I would recommend it for most anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bartender was a TRIP!”
Reviews.Author: Crykyt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four day stay in NOLA, the third night being at the Dauphine Orleans. The shuttle was going to pick us up at 5:40 am, so we spent the later evening in our room, which was EXTREMELY comfortable with a Tempur-pedic bed. The free cocktail at the hotel bar was hysterical, as the bartender, who apparently got called in on his day off, was the surliest guy with a smile on his face I ever met. He spent the entire time we were there complaining to the patrons how he got called in, didn't want to be there, and was closing at 8pm, depsite the fact I overheard hotel staff saying the bar was open til midnight. He did it all with a smile on his face. Those who didn't walk out, treated it like a show. The one working elevator didn't go up from the first ffloor, unless domeone on a higher level came down.... After three days of constant walking the French Quarter, walking up four flights was not too fun, as my thighs were the only thing that weren't hurting :) Regardless, I would definately stay here again and would definately reccommend this hotel to others. If I had paid an additional $75, I would have been happy with the room quality and the staff at the front desk's service.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller444
Reviews.Content: I went on holiday to the USA over the last 2 weeks, staying at 3 seperate hotels, and can honestly say this is the worst. It is one of the worst I have stayed in anywhere. The room was small and ill-appointed, with no bath tub, and a coffee maker which did not work. My husband is handicapped, and was offered a wheelchair on the first night, but this was taken away from us after that. It was also very difficult for him to get into the bar, but that did not matter so much as it seemed to close at approximately 10pm. The final straw was when I found a cockroach in the room - this must be one of the dirtiest places in the USA!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: nurse1sue
Reviews.Content: we started out our first 5 nights of our convention at the omni royal orleans which was very nice but your typical high end chain. as soon as a room opened at the dauphine orleans we changed hotels as bill had stayed there before and loved it. i had already fallen in love with new orleans but the dauphine was the icing on the cake. what a wonderful hotel. so much character and history. the rooms were charming and our room (139) was very large and comfortable. loved the jet tub after a day of walking the french quarter. used the hot tub several times as well. our room opened out onto a beautiful little courtyard that we enjoyed both during the day and into the night. the staff was friendly and efficient. housekeeping was great and kept the room clean and well stocked. the complimentary breakfasts were great and plenty to choose from. there is also a great little bar/resturant next door called deja vu and they have wonderful food, open 24 hrs a day and very cheap prices. they also will deliver! we ate there 1 or 2 times a day. the location is the best as you are only one block from bourbon st and two blocks from royal st. i can't wait to go back and we are already planning our next stay. this hotel is a must for those who want to experience the true french quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Grasshopper74
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location. If you are looking to experience the French Quarter, this is a great choice. If you get a balcony room, expect some street noise late at night, but to me the balcony is worth it. I was pleasantly surprised by the professional and courteous staff...that can be hard to come by in downtown New Orleans. Also, this hotel has several great courtyards which are attractions in and of themselves. I really enjoyed my stay. Every time I go to New Orleans in the future I will be checking rates here.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay the Night”
Reviews.Author: wownola
Reviews.Content: We booked through Orbitz a King or Two Double Room. When we arrived, despite assurances there would be a King room, there was not. As that was not a guarantee, we accepted the room, until we saw it. It was a two star at best. The beds were 30 years old with yellow linens (using the term broadly). There was a nonexistent balcony which overlooked the parking garage. The bathroom was clean but tiny. We were with another couple and all agreed within 5 minutes that we could not stay. We immediately checked out and proceeded to another hotel which was much much much better. I know there must be better rooms in that hotel but you had better reserve the best.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Sweet”
Reviews.Author: JFKSNA
Reviews.Content: I needed to be in New Orleans for a conference and then decided to add on a few extra days with my husband to celebrate our 20th anniversary. Our room was in the Dauphine Patio area, which is actually across the street from the main office and lobby. The rooms are not spacious, but they are sweet and private. We had a room on the second floor (i.e., no elevators) with french doors that opened out to the common balcony. Very nice courtyard for guests to share. Positive comments: Old New Orleans, jacuzzi bathtub, private, nice bed, continental breakfast, free internet and wireless access in lobby, helpful staff, great on-property, non-Bourbon Street bar - May Bailey's. Not so positive: Couldn't get an exact answer on internet in my room (ranging from $1.00 per minute for usage to "no"), no room service, cheap paper products (i.e., toilet paper and tissues simply tear off in my hand), small size of room. I suspect there are larger rooms at the Dauphine, but since I booked a mere two weeks before arrival, I had to take what was still available. The location is great if you want to be near Bourbon Street, as it is only one block away and except for Saturday night, we really couldn't hear a lot of the action once we were ensconced in our room. Definitely worth it for the cost. NOT for those who are more comfortable with standard accommodations that are offered at Marriott, Omni, etc. ABSOLUTELY for those who are looking for something a little different than what a chain property would offer. Definitely try to get a room that does NOT overlook the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel - Traveler from Houston , Tx.”
Reviews.Author: itrevino
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans was recommended by a co-worker, I book a room in hopes that I would be as pleased as he was. David the front desk clerk was very busy, yet very personable and pleasant. Our room was very nice, and clean. The beds are awesome, the bath room was small but the over all experience was at the hotel was great. Parking was expensive, but everything was within walking distance and we did not need to take our car anywhere. I will stay there again on my next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “The Dauphine Orleans was a lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaMom2010
Reviews.Content: After booking our trip, I happened to read the review about falling ceiling tiles, bad plumbing, etc and went into a complete panic. When we arrived, we were very happy with our choice - it is a lovely, small, boutique hotel (we like waking up knowing what city we are in - unlike the Ritz Carlton or a Marriott or any one of those big places where you can't tell where you are because they all look the same!) in a great location - near everything, but away from the craziness of Bourbon Street. Our King room was large, light and immaculately clean. The bathroom was sparkling marble and mirror - and completely functioning. Breakfast wasn't amazing, but was certainly acceptable ... especially if you have an early morning tour. Fresh fruit, yogurt, hot and cold cereals, all sorts of breads and pastries - even a waffle machine! Everyone from the front desk staff to housekeeping was pleasant and very accommodating; I find it hard to believe that they were unresponsive to problems and complaints. In fact, administrative staff was very visible and I would not have hesitated to speak up if we'd had a problem. Go to New Orleans - they need us there! Stay at the Dauphine Orleans and be sure to stop in at May Bailey's for a late night cocktail - it's a delightful spot!

Reviews.Title: “Average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Ilse1959
Reviews.Content: Dauphine Orleans Hotel 7/2007 When I think of Dauphine Orleans Hotel I think average accommodations. Our room was clean and the linen was of good quality. The staff was hit or miss. We were told that a bottle of Champagne would be delivered to our room in honor of celebrating my husbands 50th but it never arrived. The location was great just a very short walk to Bourbon Street. The price through Orbitz was a good deal (Hotel/Air). The breakfast was adequate but they seemed to dissemble the spread early so no sleeping in if you want the breakfast and there is no public bathroom on the main floor where the breakfast is served. There is a bathroom in Mae Bialyâ€™s the bar lounge that is across from the breakfast area but it doesnâ€™t open until later than breakfast time. So if you need to use the restroom you have to go back to your room. The pool area is very quaint and a nice place to sit and relax. I would stay at Dauphine Orleans Hotel again I donâ€™t think there is a better deal in The French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BabsSC
Reviews.Content: I told the front desk staff I would write my version of my stay at this hotel, as I had read so many "unflattering" reviews. I even created a post on TA I was so worried about my choice. Well, the hotel seems to have put away all the electrical wires, buckets, falling tiles....I saw NO evidence of that anywhere. This is an old building which bring along a few idiocrincies. We were on the 4th floor and had to flush the toilet twice at a time. Didn't ruin my trip! The beds are comfy...my only complaint was that I did not get the balcony room as requested. Was traveling with hubby and my Mom and didn't want to make a big deal out of it. Our view was of the pool which was just fine... The breakfast was great and the staff who runs it are wonderful. You get a few welcome drink next door at May Baleys (sp?). Yeah! Loved our stay and don't worry about this hotel (at least from my point of view).

Reviews.Title: “Brrrrr!”
Reviews.Author: SushiMartini
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a quiet place, yet still be in the middle of everything (and only a block away from Bourbon), I highly recommend the Dauphine Orleans. When we arrived, we were pleasantly suprised to find out that we had been upgraded to a jacuzzi suite (I had requested a courtyard king). When we got to our room, I was impressed with how nice it was. The suite had a very comfortable king-size memory foam mattress. The jacuzzi room had a lighted vanity--perfect for getting ready for nighttime activities. The actual bathroom was not so nice--it could have been cleaner but then again the building is very old. I will say the maid service was pretty spotty, and I had to steal some toilet paper from the maid cart since they never gave us any refills. I had one, well two, major complaints about this hotel. 1) Cold showers. The hot water heater did not do its job. It was hard to enjoy the tepid temperature of the jacuzzi, and every morning I had to face the prospect of a cold shower. I complained numerous times at the front desk, yet nothing was ever done. 2) The chain inside the toilet broke, and we asked them to fix that as well. Again, nothing was done and we had to rig it with a staple out of a matchbook. Overall, I would recommend the Dauphine Orleans because it is a good value. If you are lucky, you won't have any problems, and you'll be glad you stayed. Would I stay there again? Well, the Hotel Monteleone is a just few blocks away and it's right next to Dickie Brennan's Steakhouse. Plus, they have a rotating bar.

Reviews.Title: “housekeeping is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: furtwo
Reviews.Content: my husband and i were looking for a hotel that would make us feel at home, relaxed and not rushed. This was the hotel. They served a great breakfast each morning. The housekeeping staff was very friendly. Our check in and check out was very relaxed and not hurried as in some hotels with the check out deadline. Everyone on the housekeeping staff was absolutely great!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CajunTraveler_7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend getaway to New Orleans. We chose the Dauphine Orleans Hotel. We had stayed there before Hurricane Katrina in a beautiful, newly decorated new room. After being told there would be no refunds...We arrived to a lobby with ceiling tiles falling down, extension cords for box fans wired through the air conditioner vents, dirty room with blotched ceilings that were poorly patched, dirty floor in bathroom, ice bucket not emptied, coffee not supplied and poor air conditioning. Upon speaking with other guests, we found a couple that had changed rooms twice in one stay due to faulty air conditioning. I understand what New Orleans went through for the hurricane, however, if a hotel is not prepared to open completely renovated they should not open at all. This gives a poor idea of progress being made in New Orleans, which is not fair because many establishments have been successful. We will return to our beloved New Orleans, but not the Dauphine Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geddon22
Reviews.Content: Located on Dauphine Street, one block above and parallel to the swingning Bourbon Street, the Dauphine Orleans is a lovely hotel in a great location. It was also quite a bargain as part of an air/hotel package. The management was also extremely accomodating, as we were traveling with a baby and had certain requests--like a refrigerator and a room that didn't face the street. To our delight and deep appreciation, this resulted in a room upgrade at no extra cost. The put us in the annex across the street, where rooms faced a serene courtyard. Our room contained a sprawling king-size bed beneath a high ceiling featuring exposed beams, surrounded by gorgeous, rich red brick. The bed had a very comfortable foam-top mattress and several feather pillows. he bathroom featured more marble, the tub had jets (we didn't use the jets, but they were a nice option), and the shower was a two-headed monster that blasted water with authority. The only thing that was wrong with the room was the closet door, which was off the hinges--a little dangerous for our curious toddler. Also would love WiFi, but that will probably come. Overall, our experience at Dauphine Orleans was pleasant and relaxing--just what you'd need from days spent discovering the wonderful neighborhoods of New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price Through Travelocity”
Reviews.Author: fotodude
Reviews.Content: TURN-ONS: Price (fantastic deal w/airfare on Travelocity), location (quiet, safe area one block from Bourbon Street), fairly large clean room w/partial view, comfortable beds (TempurPedic but not the foam type - these were still very comfy), beautiful marble bathroom, good (free) continental breakfast, robes, complimentary champagne for our wedding anniversary (a very nice touch), the shower water is filtered, beautiful bar (May Baily's) w/great bartender and free drink coupon given at check-in, hot tub available across the street. TURN-OFFS: Tiny lobby, small pool (normal for FQ hotels), small courtyards, has a FQ "vibe" but everything looks worn out and shabby rather than authentic FQ patina, one day our room wasn't cleaned; although supervised by a valet attendant, the elevators to rooms are located in the parking garage open to the street (possible security hazard although we experienced no problems), our air conditioner dripped onto our carpet (not a biggie though), no exhaust fan or circulation in the bathroom, the room had only one painting and a mirror in the living space - a couple more art pieces would dramatically improve the look and feel. We had to call the desk to find out how to turn on the shower. When we stay in the FQ, we expect a FQ hotel to have that FQ feel and patina. We enjoyed our stay at the Dauphine Orleans but it was definitely several steps down from the Maison Dupuy (our favorite.) Considering the great deal we found w/airfare from Travelocity, it was well worth the few shortcoming of the hotel. Would we recommend the Dauphine Orleans? Sure, as long as one understands that this is an old historic FQ hotel and that it (like all others) has some shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “great location and that's mostly it...”
Reviews.Author: teeny78
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the dauphine because of a great deal we found on travelocity. i went to tripadvisor to check out other reviews and i must say i was a bit concerned...but for these reasons i decided to submit a review. location: this was our main draw. the location was great! you're one block away from bourbon street and it is not noisy at all. staff: the guy who checked us in was not friendly - he acted like he was performing an unpleasant chore and had a bad attitude. however, everyone else was friendly. i especially loved our housekeeper - she was very sweet and was the only who really wanted to make our stay there worthwhile. rooms: our room was huge (i still think we got the wrong room but that's not something to complain about!)...it was outdated and dark with a lovely view of a roof. if anything i thought the room was average and it's not like i was expecting the ritz. i did not have any problems with the beds - the mattress was comfy and i slept very well. our bathroom was pretty big and here's where we find my biggest complain: the water. it's soft water and it's awful and it feels like the soap and conditioner has not washed out! one thing that was a pleasant surprise was their bath products - they smelled super good! breakfast: the first morning the breakfast was ok...nothing extraordinary. however the second morning, i had some milk and it was bad. i couldn't believe they were serving spoiled milk! that pretty much ruined my desire for touching anything else there. overall i would definitely stay there again (especially bc of the location)....i mean it is nola and it's not like you're going to stay in your room for very long. the room was decent and not a deal breaker. also if you're looking for something good to eat after coming back from bourbon stop at deja vu. it will surely satisfy your cravings after drinking all those hurricanes!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, old rooms and bad service by 1 single guy”
Reviews.Author: miffycalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel because of the generally good reviews I read on Orbitz, TripAdvisor etc. The location is great, smack right in the middle of the French Quarter, though the hotel is old and not gitzy, it is kept tidy and relatively clean. The French Quarter's known for its old buildings, so I took it in my stride when the bottom of the toilet's cracked and exposing some weird colorations. The porter's are friendly, manager's are fine, but I have a bad experience with a young guy behind the desk. Approaching him for help to look up my delayed flight time is met with reluctance and eventually no help. It was very bad attitude and I wonder why he's there.

Reviews.Title: “50/50”
Reviews.Author: WINolagirl
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel a good review for the most part. There were things I loved and things that really need improvement. When I entered the room I was very disappointed. It was dark and the carpeting was very dirty and sticky. Bedding could be updated. The elevator was filthy and really needed a good cleaning. Now for the good. They have Temperpedic mattesses on the beds. It just does not get much better than that. Also loved the bar. Great bartenders and wonderful atmosphere. People staying at the hotel were also very nice and friendly. I miss the mural in the garage and breakfast room. I think it was a big mistake to paint over them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff, nice cat”
Reviews.Author: clyman
Reviews.Content: My second stay at this hotel was even better than the first. Excellent location, clean rooms, great beds, good expanded continental breakfast. This small hotel has been remodeled and is much improved. The baths are lovely, room was large, courtyard very attractive. Housekeeping was good and services fast, friendly, and attentive to all our requests, including cabs. This is an old hotel and not perfect, this IS the French Quarter, but for the money and location, I wlill continue to stay here when in NOLA. I love breakfast and snacks at the Deja Vu. It is not trouristy and can be loud and funky, a local hangout that allows smoking as it is a bar open 24/7. Almost next door is the Louisianna Bistro, great for dinner. You are very close to finest old and new restaurants and one block from Bourbon St. The only drawback for the particular room we stayed in was that the bathroom fan did not work, no biggie, but an alert to perfectionists. We loved the little friendly cat who appears to live on the premises at street level, not in the room area if you are concerned, just hanging out at the lobby and parking area. Staff loves her and it's that kind of place. I highy recommend this hotel for a comfortable unpretentious stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CMW3333
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a fantastic week-end in New Orleans and loved the Dauphine. I stayed in room 110 which was like having my own cottage with front porch. It was in the courtyard which was so pleasant. My friend stayed in room 104 which was also in the courtyard, except up a flight of steps and smaller room- but with a fantastic bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful and you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “In a word....dump.”
Reviews.Author: title63dick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Duphine during Mardi Gras 2007, booked through Orbitz. I've stayed in many hotels in Nawlins & this has been the worst. Elevator would get stuck, it was a roll of the dice if you had hot water in the shower and even then the water pressure was very low, we were on our own getting a cab, took forever to check our luggage & then when we came back to get our luggage they just sent us to a closet to retrieve our own! Room was small and the bathroom too. I've stayed in nicer motel 6's. There are many better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints Here!”
Reviews.Author: bama_girlx2006
Reviews.Content: I had read a few reviews prior to staying at the Dauphine (but after I had already made reservations) and I was a little concerned. However, I was 99.9% satisfied with my stay. The location cannot be beat. One block off Bourbon Street so its close enough to stumble home at the end of the night but still nice and quiet once you are ready to sleep. There is a great little diner (okay...its a bit dark and tacky, especially late at night) right across the street called the Deja Vu, but they do offer delivery and takeout, and I highly recommended the Southwestern eggrolls for those late night munchies! Our room was clean, nicely appointed (I mean, I've stayed in Sheratons and Hiltons that were comparable), and the beds were unbelievably comfortable! The bathroom was marble and as nice as any name-brand hotel I've ever stayed in (and I travel a lot on business). I thought the "ice machine" was very cute. They had a full size upright freezer in a closet in the hallway, and inside were little baggies of ice (maybe a half gallon in size) stacked on the shelves! It was re-stocked every day, so our makeshift cooler (a large garbage can in our room) stayed nice and full of ice! The only complaint I have, and it was only on one day, was the maid service. Each day, the maid service manager would come by, knock on the door, and check to see that our room had been cleaned to our satisfaction. One day, the maid (who spoke zero English) came by, cleaned the room, took all of our dirty towels, and left no clean towels! And this was the one day the maid service manager didn't stop by. We called down to the front desk, but the towels never came. We finally had to call and fuss a little, but we did finally get clean towels. The maid did put clean sheets on the bed each day which you don't even find in chain hotels these days. Before this trip, I looked and looked for something that would tell me how the French Quarter's atomosphere was since Katrina, and I couldn't find anything! So I will tell anyone who is interested that I found all the clubs and bars and restaurants to be just about back to normal. The crowds were about what I remember for January (me and my girlfriends go to New Orleans every January and have for 8 years in a row now), everything is open, and I saw no effects from Katrina (even in the ride to and from the airport). I also felt safe in the Quarter as the police were standing tall on about every third block or so. I highly recommend the Dauphine!! It ain't the Ritz but for the price and location, it is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: StillThePrettiest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Dauphine last week, during my first visit to New Orleans. We especially loved the courtyard in the 'Patio' side of the premises, and the rooms were large, comfortable and pleasant. Staff were friendly and ready to help; when the heating stopped working on our second evening we were offered a room change, and someone was there within ten minutes to help us move our things. The ample breakfast was also a plus, and the attendant there very friendly. Gorgeous huge soft beds! I'd stay here again. Good: period buildings, friendly staff, central location (but still pretty quiet), large and elegant rooms, robes, facilities, breakfast, parking. Not so good: room slow to be made up upon arrival, and then the next day; parking charges not prohibitive but could be more reasonable, heating stopped working (though problem addressed promptly and satisfactorily without argument, as noted above).

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: IndianapolisNOLA
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited New Orleans for Halloween (October 27 - November 1) and stayed in the Dauphine Orleans. It was a really cool place to stay! We arrived early, but were able to check into our room right away. The room was very clean, the bed was HUGE, and we had plenty of towels, toiletries, and storage space. We were also able to get onto the hotel's wireless internet system without issue. We had a shared balcony that overlooked the valet parking area, but the noise was minimal and didn't bother us during the stay. The valet system was very nice. It was convenient to have our car so close, and the staff was helpful and friendly. The location of the Dauphine Orleans is also very convenient. It is located on Dauphine, between St. Louis and Conti, only a block or so from Bourbon Street. Also, right on the corner, there is a convenience store with an ATM (terminal fee only $.99!) I would definitely stay in this hotel again, and I would like to thank the staff for a great New Orleans stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine Orleans = Jekyll and Hyde”
Reviews.Author: Cubzter
Reviews.Content: Problems permeate every facet of this hotel from staff to facilities. Both are shockingly uneven (at times very nice, the next moment just horrible). My partner and I, as well as friends stayed here for a few days over the Halloween weekend. Everyone in the group has been to NOLA numerous times both pre-and-post Katrina. Our stay was in room 219. Using the Trip Advisor rating system I give this property two stars because it is "Okay, but with some problems". Frankly I think this is very generous based on our experience there. How this hotel got listed on this site as a four star class hotel is absolutely beyond me. It is, AT BEST, a low three star class hotel. In fact, they don't even have a restaurant so this can't possibly be a â€œfour star" hotel because by definition it is not a full service property. One big part of the problem is that, even a year after Katrina, this property is STILL under renovation. Of course they don't mention this on their website. My understanding is that the renovated rooms are pretty okay, but the old rooms (such as the one we were in) are downright awful. I also don't appreciate it when a hotel makes misrepresentations on their website. From DauphineOrleans.com: "In EVERY ROOM (emphasis added), you will find a hair dryer, bathrobes, goose down pillows, body pillows, irons and ironing boards, and a valuables vault. When you return to your room each evening, you will be delighted to find that your bed has been turned down and a treat left on your pillow." While some of the above is true, there are also several inaccuracies, if not outright lies. The pillows were foam (and hard), not goose down. There were no "body pillows" and there was certainly no turndown service provided or even offered. Their maid service in general was almost totally missing in action. I understand there are post-Katrina labor issues, but the other hotels I've stayed at in the Quarter seem to have conquered the bad housekeeping issue and the cleaning staff at the Dauphine is still skating along using that tired excuse. PROS: Okay location, we got a cheap rate, heating/cooling were very effective, soft water filter was nice, free welcome drink in the hotel bar. CONS: Elevators worked intermittently, hotel undergoing renovation but that isn't mentioned when you book, rooms are thoroughly worn out (beat up furniture, hard mattress, lousy foam pillows, heat lamp and regular bathroom light are on the SAME switch...you couldn't have one without the other so it was always swelteringly hot, housekeeping is very shoddy (even though we tipped daily), there is no door on the closet, light fixture falling from the ceiling, security chain lacked the hook part, rooms over garage are very noisy (cars coming/going, alarms in the middle of the night, staff whistling/singing in the garage, etc.), interior rooms have no view to speak of, rude and/or incompetent staff (were yelled at for calling the front desk to complain about a car alarm going off in the hotel garage for several minutes at 4AM)...honestly I could go on forever but I think you get the idea. There are simply too many good places to stay at in the French Quarter. I've stayed in at least two dozen properties there myself and I would place this one near the bottom of those experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dauphine Orleans Hotel during my vacation in late Aug. We were unable to leave before Katrina hit New Orleans. The hotel staff brought their families to the hotel and weathered out the storm with the guests that where left behind. They where wonder to each and everyone of us! The staff really helped us all during the worst moments of our lives! Thank You!!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your wallets!”
Reviews.Author: Marie12361
Reviews.Content: In response to some of the reviews I've seen, just a heads up - my husband and I had our wallets stolen, in the middle of the night, by the staff, WHILE WE WERE IN BED ASLEEP. The hotel manager nor the cops believed us - they made it sound like we just got loaded on Bourbon St. and lost them - but I'll never forget that woman's face that sauntered in and lifted our wallets casually off of the night stands - and I'll never stay there again. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: RUBITH
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Dauphine. The room was simple, but clean. The courtyard and small pool were a bonus since it was about 100 degrees. What do you expect in August? The staff were nice and accomodating. The hotel is located 1 block from Bourbon Street, so close enough to stumble back to the hotel with ease and far enough not to get the noise. I travelled with 3 other women for a girls weekend out and we felt very safe. We went on two walking tours--the ghost and vampire tour and the cemetary and voodoo tour. Both were ok. Take lots of water and expect hot, hot, hot weather especially on the cemetary tour. Great trip. Would stay at the Dauphine again.

Reviews.Title: “Dead bolt lock does not work!!!”
Reviews.Author: KarenAnnP
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently for one week on vacation at the Dauphine. Security is a very big issue. On our last night, I was awakened about 6:00am hearing my room door opening. I could see light coming in from the hallway. Scared half to death I froze in bed, soon the light went away...maybe i had coughed or something and scared the person out. When I was able to get up, I looked out the peephole and saw a mans face looking back,his hand was reaching for the door again so I hit the doorknob,he jumped back and took off. Mind you the deadbolt had been locked when I went to bed. Maybe someone has a pass key?? Management was informed, but did not seem too bothered by this. The rest of the stay had been great. Beds were comfortable, gracious staff and wonderful extended breakfast. The stay would have been perfect except for the probable thief. Next time I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Privacy, French Quarter feel”
Reviews.Author: Scrlet62
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Dauphine Orleans in one of the patio king suites with jacuzzi. The atmosphere of the hotel is very French Quarter with the courtyards and old architecture. Our patio suite had exposed brick walls, exposed wooden rafters, brick fireplace/chimney, old French doors, with a king size bed, jacuzzi, walk-in closet, and small refrigerator in the room. There was no shower in our suite, which was a little inconvenient. The bed linens and towels were nicer than average hotel quality, and there were nicer toiletries and coffee in the room. The privacy was great -- we heard NO people except the housekeeping staff in an apparent utility room next door around 10:00 in the morning. The hotel is on Dauphine Street, one block off Bourbon, so is convenient for walking around the French Quarter but quieter than the partying on Bourbon. We did hear some street noise from motorcycles during the night. The staff was nice, valet parking is on-site, there is a small pool, and the courtyards are nicely planted and cared for. The complimentary breakfast was better than chain hotels, with waffles, bagels, fruit, cereal, all kinds of sweet rolls. We had a complimentary drink in May Bailey's Place, and there were light snacks available. There is a 24/7 fitness room and a small "library" with books that guests may take with them. We enjoyed our stay, we are "picky" but we like the old historical feel, and we would stay at the Dauphine Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tranquilbl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans July 24-29 with two kids 9 and 8 and my mother. The hotel is very accomdating for kids. There is a video game console at an extra charge. Breakfast in the morning was good with waffels, coffee, pasteries, fruit, boiled eggs, and Juice. It was very nice. The breakfast room is a bit small but if you ate early you could get a table. The Swimming pool was small but refreshing and the kids swam there everyday and loved it. We saw many families at the hotel. The staff was very kind and helpful. The rooms were clean and the maids did a great job. The bathrooms look like they were updated recently and were pretty with Marble. This is not really a luxuary resort or a budget hotel but it is somewhat in the middle it has a lot of perks and is in the french quarter. I would recommend to anyone especially with families to stay here. It is also close to the street cars and the wax musem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans Hotel is the perfect place to stay when visiting New Orleans. It is just one block away from Bourbon Street but very quiet. It is also in walking distance from everything - Canal Street, Harrah's, the Riverwalk, French Market, etc. The staff is friendly and attentive. However - it took awhile for the room to be cleaned. We would leave in the morning to walk around and would come back around noon to find the room had not be cleaned. The room itself was nice but showed it's age. The furniture looked like a dated Marriott. The bathroom was small but functional. The water purifier was a nice addition. The bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows. Watch out for the elevators! They were slow in arriving but the doors closed almost immediately. Overall this was a great place to stay. We are planning on staying here again in December.

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine Orleans a good, friendly hotel in the FQ”
Reviews.Author: Edna166
Reviews.Content: The valet staff you meet first coming into the Dauphine are all friendly and professional, leaving a good first impression. The front desk staff is friendly and efficient and houskeeping brought us any requested items in 5 minutes or less of the phone call. The breakfast is extensive and filling with various pastries, fruit, yogurt, make your own waffles, juice, coffee, tea, etc. We were in New Orleans for an extended weekend trip of four college friends and the double/double room was large enough to accomodate all of us without feeling cramped. The bathroom had nice amenities: filtered water and a massaging shower head but no counter space at all. The towels are large but not particularly soft and the bathrobes provided were not too heavy for the July heat. There is no fan in the bathroom so we took cool showers or left the door cracked. The beds are comfortable with down pillows and body pillows. The hotel overall shows some wear but everything was clean and presentable. Our only complaint was the elevators which are small and hot with no air circulation at all. The location is great: only one block off of Bourbon St. and quiet at all hours. Overall, staying at the Dauphine is a good value and a thoroughly pleasant experience. I will definitely consider staying here on my next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent two days in the French Quarter at this hotel. The room was across a small street in the Patio section up one flight of stairs and overlooking a small, well kept garden with fountain. The room was large, clean and the air purfied with a cleaner atop the tv. Bathroom and sink area were adequate but they had recently removed a small refrigerator and didn't fill in the gap. The parking was convenient and an extra $18.00/day, less than the $26.00/person shuttle cost from the airport. Free complimentary breakfast, free drink coupon at the hotel bar and happy hour food. Very nice hotel in a convenient, quiet location just across from the fantantic Bayona restrauant and a short walk from Arnaud's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Dauphine Orleans. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed talking with the bartender Jeffrey who makes a potent hurricane in the attached May Bailey's Bar. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The location is great-1 block from Bourbon St but in a quiet neighborhood. It is a very good value hotel-They offer a complementary cocktail, eve hors d'oeuvres, afternoon tea and a very bountiful breakfast buffet. Don't miss 2 great restaurants while there-Petunias and Muriels.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi gras”
Reviews.Author: JennyS23
Reviews.Content: It has been awhile since we stayed but wanted to give my opinion. My hubby and I stayed here for Mardi Gras. Went wanted a larger room (French Quarter rooms are small, 9 Mardi Gras has taught us something) so we opted for one of the suites. It was great, if you can ask for 111, it is right next to the bar and still has the red lights hanging outside from its days as a brothel. The room had a huge bed several closets, one bathroom with standup shower and toliet and other bathroom has a vanity and HUGE jaccuzi tub. It does have a "old" smell but we knew it would so we brought candles (we always do). Took care of it in no time. The neat thing about this room, you have your own entryway. One door then a flight of stairs and then your door. WORD OF CAUTION: there is a maintenance closet by the room door. Only saw 2 people go in, but our room door was open, did not know about the closet. Needless to say if you leave the room door open be careful of how you are dressed :) Bar was good, location great, people great, parking expensive but every hotel jacks up prices during the Gras. I would recommend the room we had 100%

Reviews.Title: “Run down hotel, location only plus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dauphine for a long weekend over New Years. While the location was great, the rooms were run down, and the elevators were very tempermental. We had to pry the doors open on numerous occasions. The breakfast was mediocre and the pool area and bar were cute. I would not stay here again. Walking through the french quarter I noticed many other hotels that appeared to be alot nicer. The Ritz had the same nightly rate as the Dauphine, had I only known... While the online rate for the Ritz was high and showed no available rooms, if you call up, they are very gracious and have rooms set aside. Give that a shot, or anywhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: irishopper
Reviews.Content: Never having stayed in New Orleans I cannot compare Dauphine to any other hotel, but I have traveled extensively throughout the U.S., Mexico, Europe and can compare to hotels in other areas. I would have to say that the location of the Dauphine can't be beat, close enough to walk to just about everywhere. The people throughout every area of the hotel could not have been nicer, friendly, helpful and all around nice. The bar was delightful, great bartenders, that made some of the best drinks we had throughout New Orleans, the bar is dark but pleasant, the breakfast in the morning was great, fruit, cereals, muffins, sweet rolls, waffles you cooked to order, juices and coffee, they have tea and coffee in the mid afternoon if you are around. Now the rooms, unfortunately, the rooms left something to be desired. There were 7 of us and we all requested rooms with a view, but I guess not soon enough, we were in the main hotel, and I understand the patio rooms are much better. Though our rooms were clean and maintained each day they alway appeared dingy. The lighting is terrible, though 3 lamps, very dark, the room very small and the bathroom, though redone, was done poorly. However, in defense, the shower was fine and the pillows on the bed were great. All in all other than the size, dinginess of the rooms everything was great. The rooms definitely needed an update. I would have to say it was a bit overpriced with my comparisons, but then we were in the French Quarter. We had three rooms not all near each other like requested and the bill for 4 nights came to around $3,300. The amenities, location and people made the hotel. I would rate it about a 3 1/2. I would definitely upgrade the rating if they update the rooms. Some of the reviews just before we left were a bit scary but none of what we had read was true.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Reviews, but not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from New Orleans last week. We have been there two other times and stayed at the Maison Dupuy. There were 8 of us so we decided to try something a little different. We all had courtyard rooms. Our room was very nice, but not $195 a night nice. The courtyard was also pleasant and we had a great time having drinks in the hot tub. Overall this is a nice hotel, great front desk people but it needs updating to charge the rates they do. The rooms were clean and the location was great. I would stay here again but not at such a high rate. There is a restaurant on the corner, dejavu - Great sandwiches open 24 hrs. Do not eat at Petunias on St. Louis. Terrible service/terrible food. Make sure to have a few hurricanes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Bar”
Reviews.Author: PMedMoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to New Orleans for the first time. I booked through Expedia but used tripadvisor to check hotel reviews. I am quite glad I didn't let a few bad reviews turn me away. The location is perfect, one block away from Bourbon. Close enough to walk anywhere but quiet at night. Our room was not huge but had all the amenities we required. Lots of pillows on the bed, clean sheets and a desk and table with chairs. The hotel bar, May Bailey's place, is located on the site of an old bordello. The decor in the bar is in keeping with it's history. Beautiful dark wood and burgundy patterned wallpaper. Both Jeffrey and Amy, the bartenders while we were there, were friendly and helpful with local info. The hotel staff quickly responded to any need we had, whether receiving my baggage (lost in flight) or giving directions for the streetcars. Our room was on the 4th floor, near the elevator, which could be a little noisy in the morning but I didn't go to New Orleans to sleep the day away. Continental breakfast, afternoon tea and bar snacks at "Happy Hour" were all delicious and plentiful. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: byebyebirdy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights at the Dauphine Orleans. I was concerned before arriving because reviews on Trip Advisor were mixed. We chose the Dauphine because 1) hotel selection was limited due to a conference and 2) we had a tight budget. I was able to get a standard room for $120/night through the Dauphine's website. Our room was in the main part of the hotel, not a courtyard room. Our room was very clean. The bathroom had recently been redone with large marble tile and a jacuzzi tub. Water pressure was good and there was plenty of hot water. Every room has french doors opening up to the outside. Our french doors opened to a brick wall. There was no view, but it was nice to be able to open the doors for fresh air. The front desk staff was friendly. The pool appeared clean. Parking is onsite in a secure garage and is $18 daily. The location of the Dauphine is well located in the french quarter. Overall I was satisfied with the experience, but I would not stay there for more than $120 per night. Nor would I stay there for a special occasion or a romantic getaway. It's a very average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine Orleans: Just ok”
Reviews.Author: flipviet
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans in March 2005. We read the reviews on TripAdvisor and decided on the Iberville Suites. However, we could not get 4 nights at the Iberville. So we decided to book the Iberville for 2 nights and look for another similar hotel for the last 2 nights. After much looking and reading TripAdvisor comments, we settled for the Dauphine Orleans because it was about the same price, and it looked, at the time, seems to be about the same as the Iberville. It was not! The Iberville Suites - Great location. We walked the French Quarter from the Iberville with no problems. Very nice room/bed, very comfortable. Staff very friendly. Breakfast is included with hot oatmeal, cook-your-self walfle, yogurt, juices, hot coffee/tea, rolls/toast fruits, etc. In room wired internet access is $13 from midnight to midnight (1 day). I prefer to have wireless access. Dauphine Orleans - Great location. Just down the street from the Iberville. Very friendly staff. Breakfast is included (same variety as the Iberville). Afternoon tea and sweet at the lounge from 3PM - 5PM. There is a small pool, but the water was too cold. The air vent in the room we stayed in blows the air directly at the head of the bed. So we had to just turn it off and open the window when sleeping. The bed, the sheets and blanket were of a Motel 6 class. It does not have in-room internet access. But does have free wireless internet access from the office, lounge and pool area. Since the cost was about the same between the Iberville Suites and Dauphine Orleans, I would expect that they are comparable. But they are not. I would definitely stay at the Iberville Suites again. I would caution those who may be thinking staying right on, or next to Bourbon street. The street gets very noisy from the evening into the night with lould music from bars and stores and people! Unless, of course, that does not bother you!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Oasis”
Reviews.Author: esipfle
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans, so we decided to stay in the French Quarter. It was a very interesting experience. We walked through out the French Quarter before checking into our hotel and were amazed at the stench in the streets -- horse manure, sewage, urine & vomit -- horrible & filthy!!! Needless to say, we were very leary about actually sleeping in such a filthy place. However, all our fears were for naught! TheDauphine Orleans Hotel was an Oasis in the French Quarter. A Private courtyard in the center of the hotel, with a lovely pool. A very charming restaurant and bar. And, our room was wonderful. Newly renovated, luxurious bedding, and very beautiful. We were thrilled. We'd expected the Hotel to be as filthy as the streets -- not so -- it was lovely & relaxing. If we ever return to New Orleans (not likely) we would definately stay at this hotel. One hears of the stench in Venice, however we just visited Venice this fall & never encountered any unpleasant smells. We were amazed at the intense stench of the French Quarter. I literally had to cover my nose & mouth with my coat -- I could not breath. These horrible smells were often mixed with the lovely aroma's of the restaurants -- but, who could eat while smelling the STENCH?? I was truly suprized that the city did not clean the streets & deal with the smell. It was so awful that we couldn't breath walking down the street. I'm glad we saw New Orleans, it's a fun city. But, very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time--Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pleasant surprise. Nice, clean room overlooking street. Only problem was a very slow drain in the tub. Very friendly staff. Continental breakfast very nice--person did a great job keeping it stocked so that everything was available during the breakfast hours. Location is wonderful. Several minutes to Bourbon St. and a short walk to Jackson Square. Just far enough from Bourbon Street to avoid the noise at night. Bar next door a nice alternative when you get tired of the bustle of Bourbon St. Very reasonably priced--If we ever return to the French Quarter, I will certainly stay at the Dauphine Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Staff friendly, location great, solid but not fancy”
Reviews.Author: Muhlyssa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay (2/19/05-2/22/05) and overall it was decent. We paid $189 for the Saturday night, and $149 for the Sunday and Monday night. The staff was nice, the location was good. They have discontinued the local shuttle service, so that was disappointing. When you check in your get a free drink coupon which we did not use. The continential breakfast was fine but pretty crowded the two times we tried to go there. The room we had was a bit rundown but it was clean, the bed was big. I liked that there was lots of pillows on our king size bed. The room we had was on the 2nd floor and it faced the parking lot, so it was noisy. The room size was good. Nice magazines in the room, TV worked great. Didn't look in the mini-bar. One of the wood knobs on the closet was completely worn down so it fell off everytime you tried to open the closet. The bathroom was fine, and like another reviewer mentioned, there was not much room to put your tolietries. Our toliet did stick out in a weird way and it does have some exposed pipes. I wouldn't stay here again but if you have simple tastes or simple requirements, then this might be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience at the Dauphine Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Dauphine Orleans and one that we were so excited about after a wonderful first stay last year. We had stayed at the Dauphine in December of 2003 and had an outstanding stay with them. We were thrilled to visit them once again a year later for our wedding anniversary. I had even written them a letter prior to our arrival stating how wonderful our first stay with them had been. I went out of my way to contact higher management as well to tell them how terrific the hotel and staff had been to us in 2003. With that said, we were expecting our second stay to be just as memorable and romantic. We arrived to a warm welcome and were sent to our room on the second floor. I was a little disappointed at the size of the room since we had stayed in a larger room the year before. Everything seemed wonderful though as we received a knock on the door a few moments later. They delivered a chilled bottle of champagne and anniversary wishes complimentary of the hotel. We were delighted. Our first nights stay was comfortable and uneventful. Upon waking the following morning, we realized we had very little water pressure coming from the the shower head. I contacted the front desk and they said they'd fix the problem a.s.a.p. We left for the day and returned that evening to a note stating that the problem had been fixed by maintenance. We turned the showed on and still only got a very small trickle of water. I called the front desk and they immediately let us switch rooms due to the problem. Everything seemed great and we were even sent to a much larger room on the same floor. The water pressure seemed better but not great and we were then told it could be a universal problem with the entire hotel. We were fine with that since they had done what they could to resolve the situation to our satisfaction. Upon retiring for the night I walked into the bathroom to find dried "feces" on the toilet seat. We had just checked into our room and neither myself or my husband had used the restroom at that point. I was disgusted. I looked outside the room to see if there was still a maid on duty. The room next to ours was still being cleaned at that point and I told the maid of the situation. She seemed busy and irritated when I told her of the problem. After the toilet was cleaned properly I contacted the front desk to speak with a manager. There was no manager on duty at the time but I was told that he would contact when he came back to the office. A few minutes later he contacted me and seemed as if the situation was not a big deal. He said we could move rooms once again but only offered us one room to look at. Upon looking at this very tiny room we decided to stay in our current larger room. I decided to lay in bed and watch t.v. before going to sleep. As I layed down and pulled the covers over myself I felt something on the bed spread. I turned the light on and to my surprise there were several "crusty" looking stains on the comforter. I could only imagine what this could be and told my husband we had to check out. He agreed since we were not staying in this hotel if our room had not been properly cleaned. We have stayed in many hotels over the years and I've never ran into anything like this. I expect a clean well kept room at a classy hotel such as the Dauphine Orleans. We contacted the manager once again and told him that we had to check out. He said okay and didn't try to rectify the situation any further. When I got home I contacted the hotel via a typed letter. I told the head of the hotel what had happened and after 3 months have still yet to hear back from anyone regarding our last stay. It's a shame that we had to experience these things at this lovely hotel. Unfortunately we will not stay at this hotel ever again. It's disappointing to us since our first stay had been so wonderful and memorable. I understand that hotels have problems like this but I would think that the management would at least have sent a letter of apology by now.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Dauphine”
Reviews.Author: chestybushcrusher
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans for Christmas and got an excellent "Papa Noel" rate. I think it ended up being about $79 a night. Our room was not large, but it was nicely decorated with a lovely big bed. Our room overlooked what once would have been the courtyard, but it is now the parking garage. This created a lot of noise in the mornings when the trash collectors came. We complained about it, but the managment said there was nothing that they could do, and that they have made complaints to the city many times about the loud workers. It was like clockwork everyday at 6AM! Shouting trashmen! So knowing that now, I would suggest a room that is overlooking the street instead. Dauphine Street is very quiet given its proximity to the loud and lewd Bourbon Street. It was great location and we were able to walk everywhere. It ended up being very cold and snowing though on Christmas Eve so we did not fancy walking. Thankfully the hotel offers a free shuttle service to guests, which helps since taxis can be quite expensive. Some of the perks of this hotel were the free breakfast and afternoon tea service. Also there were terrycloth robes in the room. The shuttle service was great and the parking for guests was about $17 a day, which in New Orleans is very cheap! I would say this is a good hotel for someone looking for some extras but not wanting to pay dearly for them. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here through Mardi Gras. Got a standard room, king bed, for about $210 a night which wasn't bad considering the time we were here. Room was on 4th floor, quiet except for creaky hallways and slamming doors. Room was clean and big enough to not trip over each other, bathroom large but needed more shelf space to put your toiletries. Free continental breakfast was good, waffles were excellent!! Didn't try the lounge or tea, had better things to do on Bourbon Street. Best part of hotel was the staff and the location. Everyone I ran into that worked here were the most polite and friendly people I've met at a hotel in a long time. But again, the best part is being one block off Bourbon Street. Gave us a "quick exit" when things got crazy or we just needed an hour to relax our feet from so much walking. Quick to the parade routes on Canal street and about a 10 min walk to the river front and french market. Only complaints were that it's a bit rundown, but again, most older hotels in N.O. are. Nonetheless, it was clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again as I hear the non-Mardi Gras prices are actually quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Well...we had to move hotels”
Reviews.Author: Lenore_Usher_GTIH
Reviews.Content: Came to N.O. for Jan 23-27, 2005. For the standard "Jacuzzi Room" across the street, decent price, silly room, scary place. The room was tight, had some recent mechanical fixing being done, the doorknob was 2ft from the floor, (really) and the 6'3" gentleman had to duck to enter. Very dark room, the "locked" gate sometimes wasn't and sometimes locked you in. Went back across the street, they would do better for another $85/night. Told us of the breakfast, drinks, tea, and shuttle. The gentleman at the desk, was saying the words, but very weary and uninterested. A bright spark was the concierge; he had it together, but was bored as well. The new room was large, well worn, upstairs and in the back of the main building. The in-room safe had a key lock, no other security avail. The woman at the desk said, just take your key with you. The heater worked at 60 and 85 but nothing in-between, the bathroom, tho beautiful was exceptionally cold and the mini-bar had an alarm type thing go off at 7:30ish each morning for 10 mins. Let the desk know they said someone would fix. We were interrupted 6-7 times, people would rattle our door, (so no naps) and the maintenance man came at 7pm, said he had a fire in the laundry, and that the last maintenance man was unlicensed and everything was broken.
