He talked for another 1/2 hr, then said he had to go home, his shift was over and would be back at 10 am the next day to fix things. Tea was laughable, the room was dark and they made a joke about San Diego women being afraid of the dark and to just turn on the lights. You could heat your own water in your paper cup and use some teabags in the boxes and they had a plate of danish cookies out. The shuttle driver had to be found and then didn't know where 2 streets were in the quarter, mentioned we could have just walked. Mollys was usually closed or the staff missing. The morning after the 2nd night saw the desk clerk and she had no idea there was anything wrong in the room and then said if the maintenance guy said he would come back, then it was already taken care of. We had breakfast out and changed hotels at 11 am, the maintenance man saw us and said he'd be up soon.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: fritkis
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to everything - but quiet at night. The staff is excellent, very responsive, recommended very good restaurants (get reservations for Bayona!), room clean and good condition. Breakfast okay - good assortment of food but paper plates. The bar was a little sad the night we tried it and don't bother with the tea.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Dauphine Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would agree with an earlier reviewer who gave this hotel a 4.5. We stayed here in October 2004 booked thru Expedia. Our room was standard in the back of the hotel but it was comfortable. The staff was extremely nice from the front desk to the cleaning staff. They have a free continental breakfast which is extensive and includes hardboiled eggs and homemade waffles. The hotel also has a van and will give you a ride if you need it anywhere in the FQ or CBD. They have a nice courtyard and a small pool. Location is excellent. They also have a nice bar and good bartenders (important in N.O.). There are also rooms across the street where some other people with us stayed and they were very nice and overlooked a lovely courtyard. I would recommend staying there or requesting a room overlooking the courtyard in the main building. Hotel is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Grums
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 adults stayed from December 31 to January 3, 2005. The hotel location is great as it is only one block from the heart of Bourbon Street. We stayed on the second floor in the front so we had a balcony but also noise from late partiers on the street as well as the usual streetsweepers and garbage collection. The room was reasonablely large as it has double beds not queen size. The bathroom was quite nice. The hotel is well used and thus there are details that could be improved on. Light switches that should have been wiped down, balcony door locks that need upgrading, carpets that need cleaning, etc. The breakfast is very good but come early as the line up can be long and there are just not enough seats to go around. We ate every breakfast perched on the pool edge or 4 on a lounge chair. Great little bar though and the complimentary drink is nice as the the snacks. Parking is 18.00 per day. Great location and worth the stay. (Be sure to check out French Street across Canel. Great jazz and blues bars with all the ambiance and talent but less of the noise and crowd of Bourbon Street. Nice reprive.)

Reviews.Title: “Love the location, staff nice, great to stumble home to.”
Reviews.Author: KevinElls
Reviews.Content: Nice cool rooms, old world charm, great chill court yard to relax after a day on the town. Breakfast area very nice, good free spread, great service. Never leave the quarter and feel the real New Orleans experience. Why stay in a chain hotel when you can enjoy the quarter. It's not fancy but it's nice.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not get a standard room”
Reviews.Author: Lucero32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I Just returned from a wonderful five days in New Orleans. It was my first time visiting The Big Easy and it surpassed all of my expectations. New Orleans is truly a wonderful city to visit, and from what I am told visiting in December when we did is the way to go. As for the Dauphine, where to begin. We booked our room through Travelocity and got an excellent rate. The room was a standard room so our expectations were pretty basic. Actually, my wife and I are not into spending large sums of money on hotels since we hardly spend any time in the room other than to sleep. As long and the hotel is clean, centrally located, and the staff is friedly, we are happy. We arrived at our room and I was really dissapointed. The hallway (the 2nd floor) reeked of cigarette and bad smelling disinfectant, not a good sign. Our room itself was adequate as far as size but there were a lot of small unsatisfactory details. There was a dirty towel left on our bathroom floor, one of the lights in the bathroom was out, and the remote control to the T.V. wasn't working, and our folding closet doors were falling off their hinges. Not neccesarily big issues, but enough things to give an overall negative impression. We were too tired after a long day of flying to change rooms so we just made the best of it and decided to get to bed early to get an early start in the moring. About 2:00 I wake up shivering, I got out of bed to turn the heat up...nothing. The heater had broken. I put on a sweater and crawled back into bed. The next moring I told the front desk of our situations and they immediatly offered us an upgrade to a suite. Of course, we accepted. They gave us the keys to three rooms and told us to check them out and pick the one we liked best. I think the suite we ended up with was the best suite in the main building. It was a corner suite on the third floor with three windows and two balconies. The sitting area was large, as was the room as a whole. The complimentary breakfast at the hotel is great. Krispy Kreme donuts, cereal, fresh fruit, juice and bagels, and of course Belgian Waffles fresh from the iron. A really great way to start your day off. Overall, our experience in the Dauphine was great. The location of the hotel is fantastic, the staff courteous, a generally nice place to stay for the money. Just make sure you pay the extra money for a suite, or ask for an upgrade, in our case the difference was night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: Vanilla1217
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans is okay. It's in a good location, 1 block from Bourbon St. The room was cozy, except the fact that the beds were hard. I go to New Orleans once a month and I've stayed at many hotels in the French Quarter. There are a couple better ones for this price. I like Place d' Armes (do not get a windowless room), Le Pavillon (this one is not in the French Quarter, but is beautiful), and Hotel St. Marie (get a balcony room, its beautiful). Next time I go to New Orleans, I'm staying at Place d' Armes!

Reviews.Title: “lovely for any price, but very affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. The looks, service, and amenities you would expect at some fancy-shmancy five-star joint, but for realistic prices and with none of the attitude. The room was beautiful and tastefully appointed, the staff was courteous and helpful, and the bar was fantastic. We can't recommend this place enough.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained bathroom, quiet location, good prices”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans December 9 where my rate was $89 on the weekday nights and $119 on the weekends. The bathroom was well-maintained, the sheets/pillow-cases clean, the bed comfortable. Only the carpet was a little worn. Breakfast included bagels, sweet rolls, fruit, and hardboiled eggs. The location was quiet, about a 10 minute walk from Jackson Square Wasn't able to take advantage of the afternoon tea The staff was very friendly They offer a free shuttle service to anywhere in the French Quarter or Central Business District but if you want the true New Orleans Experience you should walk or take the streetcar. A visitor's pass only costs $12 for three days and one of the three streetcar lines goes to most museums, historic buildings, cemeteries, the zoo (with connecting free shuttle van) historic churches, parks in the city including the Art museum, children's amusement park, botanical garden at City Park. A good bus line runs down Magazine Street and another runs up Esplanade Avenue. I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans for the first two nights of our honeymoon. We got the Rendezvous Package available on their website. We stayed in Room 111, right over the bar, otherwise known as a "bordello room". It was great! The room was big, with a separate living room area, a balcony (sadly, it only looked into an alley), a bathroom with a sink, toilet, and shower, and another bathroom with the makeup mirror and Jacuzzi tub. Room 111 also has a private entryway. We got no bar noise, the maids were great, everything in the room worked like it was supposed to, location was good. Continental breakfast was more than I expected. I cannot say it was an amazing value because of the package price, but we were willing to spend it it on our honeymoon. However, that might not be up the average traveler's alley. The bellboys were fast, I liked the take home library, front desk was helpful. I cannot rate it excellent only because I didn't feel the staff was ready to fall all over themselves helping me, and because it was expensive. I love the place, and will certainly stay there again. I read later in a book that I picked up at the French Market that room 111 was haunted, but we didn't see anything!

Reviews.Title: “great price, amenities, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd actually give Dauphine Orleans a 4.5. Not the Marriot, but neither are its' prices. My husband and I stayed in the Dauphine Orleans in early October this year. Got a corner suite that was spacious, well stocked with everything we needed. Concierge was helpful and gracious with planning events, then cancelling them because of the rain from a tropical storm. :) Valets were courteous, and vigilant insuring our stay was safe - personally watched them dispel some shady-looking guys from a doorstop across the road. We didn't drive much, but were pleased with their choice of taxi for our return trip to the airport. Breakfast was always enjoyable and waittresses very polite and helpful. Afternoon tea was a welcome respite from the constant drizzle. The tea room is beautifully painted in Audobon landscapes. Bartender was amiable and helpful directing us to food stuffs and stayed open late tending to other customers the night my husband and I sat outside under an umbrella reminiscing and getting drunk. Location is exceptional. 1 block and across the road from Bourbon Street so an easy walk no matter how intoxicated, but quiet because building across the street serve as buffers. About 5 blocks from Jackson Square, 3 blocks from Canal Street. Old bookstore across the street; convenient grocery store 1/2 block away, and wonderful, odd food available at the Louisiana Bistro 1/2 block away. We'd definitely do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ohiodude
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night when my wife and I visited New Orleans. First, the location is great...a very short block from the action on Burbon Street. At the same time Dauphine street is calm. The place is old, so don't expect the Ritz. But it's nic and it's clean, and there are luxury touches, like bath robes. The staff was kind enough to leave my wife and I a bottle of champagne for our anniversary. Everyone there is very very pleasant and glad to help with anything you need. There may be fancier hotels in the French Quarter, and there may be cheaper hotels in the French Quarter. It would be hard to find a better value than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Dauphine Orleans during October 2004. We had a "suite" and I was expecting something like what I saw on the website. Our "suite" was a box with a tiny window overlookinig some industrial part of NOLA. The carpet was frayed and ripped. The couches were horribly stained. The toilet hardly flushed. The sheets were scratchy. (I know I sounded like a snob on that last comment, but I was really looking forward to luxury with my boyfriend, and frankly, I was disappointed.) I got the sense that the larger suites around the courtyard were nicer (and more expensive), but there were no vacancies so I couldn't check it out. The plus side was that our room was large. The location was great. The staff was very nice. We met some wondereful locals at the bar on a few nights. Great people. We had a nice time in NOLA and I just put this initial disappointment behinid me, but if I were to do it again, I would not stay there. Plan your trip early so you have more choices!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here in early October, joined by a good friend and my 3 year old daughter, and I have to say it was the best hotel I've ever stayed in. It's a beautiful old French Quarter building (the hotel website does NOT do it justice), and our balcony room overlooking Dauphine Street was fantastic - but what truly sets this hotel apart is the STAFF! Incredible! Everyone we encountered, from the front desk, to the breakfast room, to the maids and valets - they were all very, very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one. Initially I feared that New Orleans would not be a good place for a toddler, but it was the Dauphine that made it into a GREAT place for a todder. Some of her favorite places we only found because of advice from Dauphine staff. One incident that really sticks in my mind - my daughter left her pacifier out by the pool, and later that day we actually had a valet spot us walking on Dauphine St and chase us down, just to give it back to her. Incredible!! Thanks, Dauphine, for the beautiful hotel and impeccable service - we'll be back next year! And to those of you who are lucky enough to be planning a stay in the French Quarter now, be sure to have a meal or two at the Quarter Scene, a fantastic neighborhood restaurant that's a short walk straight down Dauphine. We ate creole food all over town during our stay but no place topped the Jambalaya and Pecan Pie at the Quarter Scene!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the hotel website and after reading reviews I found on this site, I expected a much better class of hotel. It does have a great location. The courtyards were lovely. Other than the front desk, the staff was friendly and helpful. But the hotel was far from exceptional - and definitely not worth the money. Perhaps the rooms in other parts of the hotel were better but our room was completely without charm -just a standard inexpensive hotel room. Breakfast was adequate - nothing special. And tea was just that - tea & a very few store bought cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!”
Reviews.Author: 3champ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dauphine Orleans from October 11-16 and couldn't have enjoyed ourselves more. The staff and accomodations were first class all the way. We highly recommend the courtyard rooms across the street. They cost a little more but the balconies and beautiful gardens will make you glad you spent the extra money. So pretty in fact that a few weddings were conducted in the coutyard on Friday of our stay. May Baileys is a quaint little bar attached to the hotel and you get a free drink coupon when you check in, be sure not to miss it. We highly recommend Petunias restaurant for a breakfast you won't soon forget. It's only a half block from the hotel on St.Louis Street. You can spend a fortune at the well known restaurants on authentic cajun and creole cuisine, or you could take our advice and try the Gumbo Shop and have some of the best local dishes at a fraction of the prices the " names " charge you. Try the Shrimp Creole, and Gumbo. For dessert, the bread pudding with whiskey sauce will make you glad you were born !! The Cafe DuMond, of course, is a must for the beignets and cafe au lait. Lines can be exceptionally long at peak times, try mid morning or early evening and you won't have a problem. If you find Waylon Thibodeaux, one of the greatest Cajun-Zydeco fiddle players ever, down on Bourbon Street, you are in for a real treat. When you hear Waylon play, you'll know you are in New Orleans. Last tip, Check out the French Market and attached flea market for souveigners before you buy them for 3X the price on Bourbon Street or Decatur Street. They are the same merchandise without the overhead of the high rent areas built in. We learned the hard way !! Have a great time, I know you will love this town as much as we do. I'd be glad to answer any questions you may have if I can as someone was kind enough to answer all of ours while we were planning our trip here, and helped us immensely. Let the good times roll !!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, in a fantastic location. Our room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. It was hard to believe the very noisy Bourbon Street was only a block away. We loved the pool, the courtyard and just about everything else about this lovely hotel. We would recommend it to anyone wanting comfort, privacy and a home away from home in the wonderful French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place for a base for New Orleans sightseeing...room was very nice...always cleaned promptly......"enhanced" continental breakfast hit the spot....Sean(the night clerk) set up a great city tour for us ahead of time, so we could be off and touring as soon as we got in from the airport(Dixie City Tours...only six people and a small van so we got down some mighty narrow streets.) Bellhops were great at recommending restaurants....try Irene's for superb Italian. The Dauphine Orleans was more that we expected...the van service was a real boon since I don't walk distances well.....the pool was great to come back to and cool down after seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of all hotels in the French Quarter, we were prepared for anything. But the Dauphine Orleans was perfect from check-in to check-out. The employees are amazingly friendly, and extremely helpful. They helped plan all of our tours, which turned out to be the best ones the city has to offer. We had a SPOTLESS King room, which was huge (especially by French Quarter standards!) with 2 balconies, marble bathroom with double showerhead, filtered water dispenser, reasonably-priced wet bar, bathrobes, turn-down service, and 1 block off of Bourbon St. Beautiful pool in the courtyard, great breakfast. For $139 a night, we couldn't have asked for any better !

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenstang25
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed here from september 9th to the 14th and we loved it! (just barely missing hurricane ivan)...it is in a great location for easy walking to all the attractions within the quarter as well as a hop skip and a jump up to canal street to catch either the canal street streetcar or the st charles streetcar...the hotel itself is clean and comfortable and the staff are super nice and efficient... each morning our room was cleaned and our bed was turned down as well as each and every time we passed a staff member we were asked if everything was ok with our room or if we needed anything...even the guys down in the parking garage were super friendly and wished us a good evening each time we ventured out... the continental breakfast was ok nothing to brag about and consisted of cereals, pastries, waffles, hard boiled eggs, fruits and juices..this is not by far a ritz carlton hotel and if that is what you are looking for i wouldn't suggest going here BUT if you are looking for a quaint, comfortable, clean, afforable, quiet hotel with a convienent location this would be the one! thanks dauphine for making our stay a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: LOVELY hotel, great city. Would absolutely stay here again. Jeffrey, the bartender, way too cynical for this beautiful town and it's people. Could have made our visit to May's much warmer. But everyone else more than made up for his attitude. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Service Super Duper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent our 1-year-anniversary in New Orleans... We had a wonderful time, and in no small part thanks to the Dauphine Orleans! We had booked an online reservation, a budget res, and in our notes had asked for the best room the budget would allow (anniversary and all): well, despite it's being Southern Decadence and very busy, that meant a room with a beautiful balcony, and champagne delivered to the room upon arrival! We were very impressed, and touched: the service overall was simply outstanding. The room was kept clean, the bedding was incredibly comfortable, and the complimentary "enhanced Continental" breakfast kept me--for the first time in my many years of visits!--satisfied WITHOUT a Cafe Du Monde beignet and au lait for breakkie! My only complaint was the service in May Baily's place: I loved the bar, but at one point felt like I was intruding on the bartender's time when I went to order a drink while out at the pool. I am a bartender too, I know we all have off days (and times) but even so, it wasn't so easy to blow off. Despite this, I will absolutely stay at Dauphine Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dauphine!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! We stayed there 2 weeks ago and had a fantastic time. The rooms are a little small but the extras made up for that. Huge comfortable bed with down pillows! Great free breakfast. Also, loved May Bailey's. Great little bar! The staff was excellent. SO NICE and gave us great tips on places to eat and visit. The free van service came in handy on those hot days. The hotel is only a block away from Bourbon but was very quiet. Overall, had a great stay and will recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience- close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Wayward
Reviews.Content: After visiting New Orleans twice before, the last time being for Mardi Gras in 2002, the French Quarter in mid-August seemed strangely empty. However, finding the Dauphine Orleans made the trip. Only one block north of Bourbon St, three or four blocks from the arts and antiques on Royal, and no more than seven blocks from Jackson Square and the riverfront, the DO's location is superb- and the beds are comfy as well. With continental breakfast, exercise room, morning paper at your door, and outdoor pool, plus parking available (for a price), this is the place to stay in the Quarter, and (at least in the off-season) the rates are very reasonable. Fair warning, though- Dauphine is a relatively quiet street, so if you're looking for the traditional New Orleans balcony entertainment, you're better served finding a room overlooking Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Cozy - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this little gem two weeks ago. We were not dissapointed. It's conveniently located around the block from Bourbon Street which means you can get a good nights sleep. The bed was extremely comfortable and the staff friendly..great southern hospitality. The free breakfast was great as there were many things to choose from. The free van service was great as well. The driver was friendly and offered suggestions. We found a flat rate of 69/night on Travelzoo---..couldnt get any better for a great hotel in a great location. Definetely recommended unless your looking for a modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Those who don't love it, just don't get it!”
Reviews.Author: MissyK1
Reviews.Content: One of the most charming, Boutque hotels ever, 5 star amenities, and sevice, The more history the better! Charming Bar/Bordello attatched. The ambiance of the city oozes throughout this little gem! I've stayed in a few Ritz carltons, Orientals, and FourSeasons, and I'll take The Dauphine in New Orleans. Sincerely, Melissa Kinnard

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ally,UK
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and teenage son spent 3 nights at the Dauphine in early July. We chose the property for both price and location and were not disappointed. The lovely buffet breakfast was a great start to the day, my son especially loved the serve yourself waffles with fresh strawberries. Our beds were luxuriously comfortable and the bathroom, although small, was well appointed. May Baileys was a great place for a quiet cocktail which could be sipped in comfort before taking an evening walk to one of the many great local restaurants. We found the Dauphine to be great value in the heart of the French Quarter and will definitely check their prices if we have the good fortune to visit the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: KinerA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans Hotel in May and loved being right in the French Quarter. The hotel included an expanded Continental Breakfast which was a good value for New Orleans. They had waffles, which you made yourself with pre-measured cups of batter. You had two juices to choose from, regular and gourmet coffee plus Sanka and tea and herbal tea. Also assorted cereals with regular and skim milk, fresh fruit and a selection of pastries. There was also iced tea with cookies in the afternoon, which was a nice touch. While you can book this hotel as part of a package from many on-line sites, we wanted a courtyard room and so called the hotel directly. We do recommend the courtyard rooms, but they are slightly higher priced. The courtyard provided a wonderful respite after a day's touring, but if you book a room in the main building if that is your price range, you can still use your key card to go into their courtyard. Either way, we highly recommend the Daupnine Orleans Hotel. Also, this hotel as seems to be the practice, will raise rates every weekend as there is some kind of a festival every weekend. We found out that Sunday nite is considered part of weekend festival rates, and so we scheduled our vacation for Monday through Saturday and had the benefit of the midweek rates. Discounts are also offered and if you qualify this will make this hotel an even better value. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. When we had our bags taken to our room after checking in, the Bell Man was very helpful in recommending a nice place for lunch. Our room was cleaned thoroughly and disinfected to counteract the high humidity. There is a van to take you to the waterfront area, or the nearby business district, but there was no return pick-up. While this was free, a gratuity was of course expected. We also booked a couple of tours through the front desk, in one case they were able to get the van to stop for us so we could get on the earlier tour. The price was same, and any advertised discounts were honored by their cashier. Eating in the New Orleans French Quarter is not cheap, but during the week there are some coupons, discounts or free bottles of wine. We liked NOLA, Emiril's restaurant in the French Quarter proper, and Bacco, an Italian restaurant. Both were pricey but worth it. For a more economical dinner, we went to Petunia's just around the corner from the Dauphine Orleans. One dinner we had on the steamboat Nachez, and a wonderful ride up he Missisippi River. A lot of activity centers around Jackson Square and the Cibildo, a City Hall type building from the original settlement, which was where the Louisiana Purchase the signed and finalized. There are nearby places for lunch, or supper, and mule-drawn buggy rides on the water side of the park. The other big attraction is of course Bourbon Street. You can choose what you want here, jazz clubs, food and drink, or just walking up and down the street. We found that while they are required to serve drinks in paper cups, the people were very neat and properly disposed of the cups and the street was always clean. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to New Orleans and the Dauphine Orleans Hotel, and have no hesitation in recommending it for your stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Charmiing Place, relaxing stay !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just great! I donâ€™t know where to start. When we checked into our room, we were pleasantly surprised to find 8 different pillows on the bed (feather, body, etc.). The bed was very comfortable and we slept as well as at home! The Breakfast was fantastic! Fresh fruit, waffle maker, hard-boiled eggs, beagles, cereal, yogurt even! The best kept secret was the attached bar. The bartender makes killer drinks and was very friendly. He even suggested a locals restaurant/bar that made the best burgers in town! (Port of Call)

Reviews.Title: “Dauphine was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From June 19th to the 25th, 2 single women and an 11 year old going to the big bad city? Could have been a disaster, but thanks to this great little hotel and its very friendly staff, it was an experience of a lifetime. The room and the service were excellent, relaxing, and luxurious. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and even tipped us off to a film shoot around the corner. The beds, the robes, the breakfast, never made it back for tea. They booked our trips for us, shuttled us, and bent over backwards to supply us with info and extra's. My daughter had a wonderful time playing in the courtyard pool while we swam, sipped, and socialized poolside in the evenings. Met alot of wonderful people, Bill, Sharon, T, and Chuck, while the bartender supplied us with beverages of our choosing. The relaxed atmosphere was very condusive to make new friendships and wonderful memories. I'd recommend this place to anyone who doesn't travel alot to guarantee a great experience. The hotel itself was beautiful and historic without being antiquated, the location was great and May Bailey's was alot more sedate and upscale than the Bourbon Street bars. I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed - room dark,damp and dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Dauphine after reading the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel was a great disappointment - our room was dark, smelt very damp and hadn't been cleaned properly. There were empty beer cans and cigarette butts on our balcony and pools of water on the table. It seems that there are very different classes of rooms at this hotel and it just depends whether you get lucky or not. The rooms around the courtyard looked a lot better - our room was up on the 3rd floor - room 327 - to be avoided!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine Orleans was a wonderful hotel to stay at in the French Quarter. The person who made my reservation clearly had customer service as his top priority. Everyone was nice, including our maid who gave me suggestions of places to eat. Rooms are well-appointed and even though the bathrooms were a little small, all amenities were included. I would highly recommend this very centrally located hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovin' the Dauphine!!!!!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: aeromama
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a diamond in the rough! If you are looking for quaint and private, this is your ticket! Make sure to ge one of the "patio" rooms. These are across the street from the main hotel and are much more private. Also, the patio room side of the hotel has a hot tub which is seldom used and therefore it's nice to use at night and to have all to yourself. I don't think I would ever want to stay anywhere else. The service and staff were impecable! These rooms are nicer (at least mine was) than the Hilton's that I frequent. If you are looking for old world feel, this is the place! But you get all the luxury at the same time. The rooms have air and water filtration systems, pillowtop mattresses, a body pillow, feather pillows, minibar, fridge, safe, iron, hairdryer, Lord and Mayfair toilettries, a jacuzzi tub with wrapped-around mirrors in the bathroom along with TWO shower heads! Wow! What luxury.. Kudos to the staff.. They made my stay wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit to New Orleans and I made reservations at 4 different hotels, one of which was the Dauphine. I chose this one, even tho I read a couple of negative reviews, because the bulk of reviews was very positive. I'm so glad I did. From the moment we arrived (5/27/04-6/1/04) the atmosphere and southern hospitality couldn't have been better. The staff was friendly, the room in excellent shape, continental breakfast, afternoon hordeurves & teas were wonderful...just everything - pool & courtyards beautiful. Would I stay here again? Absolutely. The guest bathrobes, turned down beds w/ treats, purified air system was included in the modest price of the regular double room we got. Next time I'd like to stay in one of the suites that adjoins the courtyard with jacuzzi tub. If you're ever in New Orleans, try this hotel...only 1 block to Bourbon St, but far away enough from the noise and close enough to all other sites. A shuttle bus was always available to take us to certain areas in the Quarter. Loved it here...try the Dauphine...it's the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Best Value in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Dauphine Orleans and it will definitely not be our last! This is the best value for your $ in New Orleans. Our hotel room was clean, and the bed was the most comfortable bed on which I've ever slept. The location was perfect - convenient to everything and QUIET. The staff was extremely helpful and very friendly. Ask Jeff at the bar for a Bloody Mary with extra spicy beans- he makes the best in the city! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ambivalent about the Dauphine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from spending three nights (Fri, Sat, Sun) at the Dauphine Orleans. Check-in late Friday afternoon and get a bad taste of the hotel right from the start. Given our room key which was for a courtyard/pool view room. We got the courtyard in the buiding across the street from the main building. Up a couple flights of stairs, get to the room and the room had not been made and actually still had personal belongings in it. So it's back down and across the street to get another room - no apologies, just another key. Get into our room and none of the lights work - turns out everything is unplugged including the air fresheneing system they advertise (need to save on those electric bills?). Room is nice enough - exposed brick walls and vaulted ceilings with wood trusses add ambience far beyond any standard chain hotel. A bit on the small side but considering where you are and the age of the buildings - very passable. Jacuzzi tub with a dual shower head was great. Ask to use the advertised shuttle service to take us out to Commander's Palace for lunch and we are met with a deaf ear - no explanation just that they will get us a taxi. (Did take advantage of the shuttle later that evening for a ride to dinner.) Second day into our stay - need more toiletries. Ask to have additional toilet paper and bar of soap delivered - never receive it. Also, my electric shaver dies on me and I have no razor back-up. call the front desk to see if they have anything available and advise that there is a drug store 4 blocks away. Stop in at Mae Bailey's for a drink Friday night. Great atmosphere - but air conditioning is broken. Catherine the bartender says it is being fixed the next day. Air-conditioning is broken all 3 nights. On the up side - the Dauphine's location is terrific. The rooms were fine and had great character/ambience. Mae bailey's was great but a bit uncomfortable. Having spent an average of $190 per night for our stay, I would say that I am less than enthusiastic about the Dauphine Orleans. It seems they are happy with their location but don't really put the service in making your stay enjoyable. Would only stay here again if tehy ironed out the service issues or the rates are dropped dramatically.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: swallFayetteville_AR
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Dauphine Orleans. It was even better than pictured on their web site. We stayed in one of the Courtyard Rooms. The courtyard was heavenly with a fountain and lots of plants, as well as a hot tub and tables and chairs. The room was beautiful especially the bathroom with the jacuzzi tub. The service was great and the parking attendant was especially nice. The location, one block from Bourbon Street, was so convenient and surprisingly quiet. We loved it and highly recommend it. We were there between the French Quarter Festival and the Jazz Festival so the rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTexas
Reviews.Content: Great location, pretty room, and lots of nice amenities: complimentary breakfast, welcome cocktail, tea time. A maintenance problem was handled promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time at the Dauphine. We were able to get the king jacuzzi suite above May Bailey's. It was absolutely delightful, the bed was among the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The tub was large, and comfortably accomodated two people. I was most worried about that, and had to get many hotels to admit their jet tubs wouldn't fit two people. There is a small balcony that faces the main building, and was nice to catch some fresh air in the mornings. The front desk guy, Shawn, was superbly friendly, we had a good time joking around. May Bailey's is a wonderful, quaint place and the bartender made reservations for us at an incredible restaurant...Olivier's. I have to grin at folks who talk about how "dirty" and unseamly NO is. This is not some pristine corporate resort with cabana boys. But if you want a down-home good time, make the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Dauphine Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Dauphine Orlean several times and have always enjoyed it immensely. We especially like the annex across the street, more privacy, closer to the hot tub etc. Also, the Continental brakfast is outstanding and a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Trackser
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and pleasant, and the continental breakfast was first rate -- such fresh fruit! We were in the main building, on the street, but noise was no problem. Albeit, we were there a week after fat tuesday. Other hotels at comparable prices were located 2-3 blocks out of the quarter downtown, and in retrospect, the Dauphine is a great location. The room was nice enough to have spent much more time it in, if there wasn't so much else to experience. The Evergreen air/water cleaning system is a definite plus. Great in-room drinking water! Also it was done up wonderfully each day. Don't forget to tip those maids.

Reviews.Title: “European Flair”
Reviews.Author: amrdia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dauphine 02/27/04-02/29/04. This was the week after Mardi Gras. The staff although having survived the hectic period went out of their way to serve us. They were extremely friendly. The rooms in the main buiding were quiet, clean and comfortable. The bar is excellent. The bar tender was Jeffery. He was very competent and friendly. The drinks were potent and reasonable. The hotel is located 1 block off Bourbon in the center, very convenient. They will take you by van within the city limits anywhere you want. The continental breakfast is more than continental. The Inn is very European not a mega resort. You will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Dauphine Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to New Orleans a few times, but this was our first trip to the Dauphine Orleans. And it won't be our last. We love this place. From the moment we pulled into the parking garage to the moment we left, we were treated better than any other hotel we've ever stayed at. We were guarenteed a parking place for the busy weekend, which was wonderful. The staff is polite and helpful. you get free welcome drinks in the hotel bar and discount coupons for other places in the area. The rooms are a nice size and the beds have 4 pillows and a body pillow. You get bathrobes and a mini bar too. The amenities are great. The courtyard is beautiful and you can eat the free breakfast out there in the morning. We love this place and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Charm! Can't beat the rates!”
Reviews.Author: LuvGoodEats
Reviews.Content: The Dauphine was one of the highlights to our little road trip from Seattle. As it was our first experience in the South, we got loads of the famous Southern Charm from the folks at the Dauphine. We were greeted by sincerely friendly service and a round of cocktails from the lovely bartender. Our cozy rooms had two balconies over looking the courtyard. Don't overlook the stationary stack in the rooms, a surprise proclamation awaits... The hotel is a 2 block trot from Burbon Street and was a perfect escape from a wild night of bar hopping. Secure parking with impeccable window washing service is available prix compris. When we checked out, the hotel let us take a peek at the unoccupied suites in the hotel. This definitely gave us something to look forward to for our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated, clean, and has nice courtyards. However, fumes of chemcials in the hot tub were over whelming!!!! The hotel staff weren't the friendliest, no one smiled or acknowledged us -- we felt ignored, especially in the bar. We were the only ones in the bar, and it still took the bar tender 10 minutes to say hi to us.

Reviews.Title: “Just Don't Expect Too Much”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The courtesy van driver (Asa) is wonderful! The rest of the staff are o.k. Our room was the smallest in which I've ever stayed, but it was clean. We reserved a suite for the 2nd/3rd nites, but it was dirty and scary (hot sauce on the couch) and looked like there was a party in it the nite before we took it. We moved back to our little room where we were at least used to the weirdness. Our stay was quite an experience. The very, very best part is the complimentary cocktail. Ma Bailey's was the very best bar we went to during out entire trip. Both the bartenders were wonderful. The drinks were the best. This was our 1st time in NO and we found it to be very dirty, not too friendly, and somewhat dangerous. Dauphine is very New Orleans. I'm glad we did it for the experience, but we wouldn't do it again.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Dauphine Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMayfield
Reviews.Content: My husband & I (along with about 14 other couples) visited New Orleans 4 months ago and stayed at the Dauphine for the first time. We absolutely loved it!! It was close enough to the happenings on Bourbon, but was also very quiet when we needed it. The folks were extremely friendly, especially Amy the bartender at May Baileys Place. I will recommend this hotel to any one that asks and will also stay here again on my next visit to the Big Easy!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsSpike34
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans for a long weekend in August. It was her birthday and the staff was so thoughtful and placed a bottle of champagne on ice with glasses in our room. Our room was spotless and we especially appreciated the air cleaning system and wonderful pillows. Although the bathroom was small it was nice with marble vanity and water filtration system. The staff was very helpful without being intrusive. Make sure to eat at the restaurant across the street, Bayona. It was to die for! The little pool in the courtyard was great for cooling off and sunbathing.

Reviews.Title: “Captivating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the dauphine in march of 2003 after mardi gras had passed and was delighted with how quiet it was, yet how close to all the action of the french quarter. i had an absolutely gorgeous room across the street from the main hotel overlooking a captivating courtyard. my room was just beautiful, i loved the brick walls, the huge comfortable bed, the french doors, the jet tub. i felt like a princess in it and the room was very clean and inviting. the hotel exceeded my expectations (i found it online) and i would stay there again in a heartbeat. in fact, i fully intend to do just that this spring.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Dauphine!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the patio rooms during November 2003 and LOVED IT! What a quaint, cute, cozy place to stay. It really oozed the feeling of the French Quarter. If you do not like small hotels then this is not the place for you...but if you are looking for a place that FEELS French Quarter STAY HERE!!!!! Plus, the location is unbeatable! We cannot wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend on October 10th and could not have had a more pleasant of stay. The rooms were clean, with nice down pillows. Wonderful breakfast with lots of choices. Two blocks from Bourbon Street. Friendly and helpful staff. Afternoon tea was nothing more than generic brand cookies, so don't plan your day around it. I highly recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dauphine!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dauphine Orleans in August of 2000. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and had goose down pillows. My room overlooked the pool, which I liked and did not find to be all that noisy. The hotel is close to everything and has a great bar!!! I can't wait until I get a vacation so I can come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon at the dauphine”
Reviews.Author: Colleen1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dauphine Orleans on our honeymoon. The room was small and nothing to rave about. I didn't find the staff at the front desk very friendly, although the bell hops and parking lot attendents were so nice. A great thing about the hotel is the comp. shuttle which is very nice. It beats paying for a taxi, and the longest we had to wait for the shuttle was 10 mins. The May Bailey bar is worth checking out. It has a cool vibe and is pretty quiet. They also had the best hurricane I had in the city! The continental breakfast was pretty good, one of the best I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Dauphin Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were here 9/24/03 thru 9/28/03. The hotel exceeded are expectations. The rooms were a good size, clean and very comfortable. Everyone on staff was exceedingly friendly. Service was terrific, but not intrusive. Excellent continental breakfast with fresh fruit, waffles, pastries, etc. Pool and courtyard were quiet and lovely. Mae Baily's is a great place for a pre-dinner cocktail (they don't gouge you like most of the other bars in the French Quarter). Close to everything, but quiet location. The hotel may be a little faded around the edges, but that seems appropriate for the French Quarter. The whole place had a terrific atmosphere. One of our party may have even spotted on of the resident ghosts! We definately stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dauphine Orleans Sept. 13-16 and had a wonderful time. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating and our room was delightful. We used the hotel shuttle alot and all the drivers were terrific but I would like to say that Asa was top notch. I would like to send him a greeting from the Foleys and the Wagners. Hi Asa!! Thank you for your great friendly service during our stay at the Dauphine Orleans. Please also send a thank you to the other drivers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room. Needs Updating!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked good on paper. I wanted a hotel with a courtyard and a pool - real New Orleans flavor. This is not it! The room was tiny and the air conditioning could't even keep it comfortable. The room was musty. There is no lobby except 2 chairs in front of the desk. The pool was small and the courtyard so tiny you could fall in the pool trying to get around it. I don't see what the positive reviewers saw. Maybe they have nothing to compare it to. I say don't waste a great trip on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Barbms
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to New Orleans where we stayed at the Dauphine Orleans. I was a little uncomfortable about a hotel that I didn't know anything about but read numerous reviews about this one and for the most part they were all good. We had stayed at another hotel in NO in April that I had found and let me just say that it was not a good experience so we were a little apprehensive but...the reviews were all right! This is a great hotel with good service and friendly staff. All the little extras made a big difference. Housekeeping was very good and turn down service is a nice touch. The continental breakfast with waffles to go along with all the fruit and other items was good and fresh. It was very clean and the staff kept it supplied very well. I have seen reviews that said it was a little worn in places but when you think of how old it is and the people coming through every day it would have to be a little worn. While we were there, the staff was painting and cleaning even though the temperature was extremely hot and humid. We were vey pleased with our stay and will be going back many more times. May Bailey's was also very nice, quiet, and clean. A good place to stay in the French Quarter that is close to everything but quiet.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: an excellent hotel right in the french quarter! very close to everything. one block from bourbon street but without all the noise. we stayed 2 nights in this charming hotel. rooms were very nice as well as the hotel staff. the continental breakfast was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: robynjamaica
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3night stay at the Dauphine Orleans. If you want to appreciate the true colors of the French Quarter, this hotel with its unique rooms is the place! Reserve a patio room - you get so much more for just a bit extra in price. Loved the location - only one block from Bourbon, but so quiet you'd never know it. Heavy curtains blocked out the early morning sun in our room - loved slipping on our robes after bathing in our wonderful marble bathroom complete with jacuzzi tub. We had a corner room on the second floor which gave us extra square footage, vaulted ceiling and balcony that overlooked Dauphine Street. The pool was a godsend after walking the streets of the french quarter all day and was a quick way to cool off before dressing up and meeting the rest of our friends in the May Baily's lounge for cocktails and complimentary hors d'oeuvres. Jeffrey, the bartender, whips up some great drinks and does an outstanding job of recommending places to dine. The bed, complete with goose down pillows is wonderful after spending a night out on Bourbon street. Friendly staff all the way around, clean rooms & public areas, speedy maid service every morning.

HotelInfo.Name: Dauphine Orleans Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 415 Dauphine St., New Orleans, LA 70112
